>> where, z	the third digit is incremented when editorial only changes have been incorporated in the document.
[('when editorial only changes have been incorporated in the document', 'when')] ----> where z	the third digit incremented
>> The EPS Mobility Management protocol defined in the present document provides procedures for the control of mobility when the User Equipment is using the Evolved UMTS Terrestrial Radio Access Network.
[('when the User Equipment is using the Evolved UMTS Terrestrial Radio Access Network', 'when')] ----> The EPS Mobility Management protocol defined in the present document provides procedures for the control of mobility
>> 1x CS fallback capable UE: A UE that uses a CS infrastructure for a voice call and other CS-domain services by falling back to cdma2000® 1x access network if the UE is served by EUTRAN when a CS service is requested.
[('by falling back to cdma2000® 1x access network if the UE is served by EUTRAN when a CS service is requested', 'by')] ----> A UE that uses a CS infrastructure for a voice call and other CS-domain services
>> APN based congestion control: Congestion control in session management where the network can reject session management requests from UEs or deactivate PDN connections when the associated APN is congested.
[('when the associated APN is congested', 'when')] ----> where the network can deactivate PDN connections
>> Attached for emergency bearer services: A UE is attached for emergency bearer services if it has only a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established.
[('if it has only a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established', 'if')] ----> A UE attached for emergency bearer services
>> Attached for access to RLOS: A UE is attached for access to RLOS if the UE requested access to RLOS during the attach procedure and has a PDN connection for RLOS established after completion of attach procedure.
[('the UE requested access to RLOS during the attach procedure', 'if'), ('the UE has a PDN connection for RLOS established after completion of attach procedure', 'if')] ----> A UE attached for access to RLOS
>> UE supporting CIoT EPS optimizations: A UE that supports control plane CIoT EPS optimization or user plane CIoT EPS optimization and one or more other CIoT EPS optimizations when the UE is in S1 mode.
[('when the UE is in S1 mode', 'when')] ----> A UE that supports control plane CIoT EPS optimization or user plane CIoT EPS optimization and one or more other CIoT EPS optimizations
>> CS fallback capable UE: A UE that uses a CS infrastructure for a voice call and other CS-domain services by falling back to A/Gb or Iu mode if the UE is served by EUTRAN when a CS service is requested.
[('by falling back to A/Gb or Iu mode if the UE is served by EUTRAN when a CS service is requested', 'by')] ----> A UE that uses a CS infrastructure for a voice call and other CS-domain services
>> EMM context: An EMM context is established in the UE and the MME when an attach procedure is successfully completed.
[('when an attach procedure is successfully completed', 'when')] ----> An EMM context established in the UE and the MME
>> EMM-CONNECTED mode: A UE is in EMM-CONNECTED mode when a NAS signalling connection between UE and network is established.
[('when a NAS signalling connection between UE and network is established', 'when')] ----> A UE is in EMM-CONNECTED mode
>> EMM-IDLE mode: A UE is in EMM-IDLE mode when no NAS signalling connection between UE and network exists or when RRC connection suspend has been indicated by lower layers.
[('when RRC connection suspend indicated by lower layers', 'when')] ----> A UE is in EMM-IDLE mode
>> EMM-IDLE mode: A UE is in EMM-IDLE mode when no NAS signalling connection between UE and network exists or when RRC connection suspend has been indicated by lower layers.
[('when no NAS signalling connection between UE and network exists', 'when')] ----> A UE is in EMM-IDLE mode
>> Group specific session management congestion control: Type of congestion control at session management level that is applied to reject session management requests from UEs belonging to a particular group when one or more group congestion criteria as specified in 3GPP TS 23.401 [10] are met.
[('when one or more group congestion criteria as specified in 3GPP TS 23.401 [ 10 ] are met', 'when')] ----> Type of congestion control at session management level that applied to reject session management requests from UEs belonging to a particular group
>> Initial NAS message: A NAS message is considered as an initial NAS message, if this NAS message can trigger the establishment of a NAS signalling connection.
[('if this NAS message can trigger the establishment of a NAS signalling connection', 'if')] ----> A NAS message considered as an initial NAS message
>> When the AS indicates a lower layer failure to NAS, the NAS signalling connection is not available.
[('When the AS indicates a lower layer failure to NAS', 'when')] ----> the NAS signalling connection is not available
>> The procedure transaction identity is released when the procedure is completed.
[('when the procedure is completed', 'when')] ----> The procedure transaction identity released
>> RAT-related TMSI: When the UE is camping on an E-UTRAN cell, the RAT-related TMSI is the GUTI; when it is camping on a GERAN or UTRAN cell, the RAT-related TMSI is the P-TMSI.
[('When the UE is camping on an E-UTRAN cell', 'when')] ----> the RAT-related TMSI is the GUTI
>> RAT-related TMSI: When the UE is camping on an E-UTRAN cell, the RAT-related TMSI is the GUTI; when it is camping on a GERAN or UTRAN cell, the RAT-related TMSI is the P-TMSI.
[('when it is camping on a GERAN or UTRAN cell', 'when')] ----> the RAT-related TMSI is the P-TMSI
>> For a multi-access system this case applies if the current serving radio access network provides access to network services via E-UTRA by NB-IoT.
[('if the current serving radio access network provides access to network services via E-UTRA by NB-IoT', 'if')] ----> For a multi-access system this case applies
>> For a multi-access system this case applies if the system operates in S1 mode, but not in NB-S1 mode.
[('if the system operates in S1 mode , but not in NB-S1 mode', 'if')] ----> For a multi-access system this case applies
>> Traffic flow aggregate: A temporary aggregate of packet filters that are included in a UE requested bearer resource allocation procedure or a UE requested bearer resource modification procedure and that is inserted into a traffic flow template for an EPS bearer context by the network once the UE requested bearer resource allocation procedure or UE requested bearer resource modification procedure is completed.
[('once the UE requested bearer resource allocation procedure or UE requested bearer resource modification procedure is completed', 'once')] ----> A temporary aggregate of packet filters that inserted into a traffic flow template for an EPS bearer context by the network
>> If availability is indicated, the UE uses the IM CN Subsystem and can terminate or originate requests for SIP sessions including an audio component with codecs suited for voice.
[('If availability is indicated', 'if')] ----> the UE can originate requests for SIP sessions including an audio component with codecs suited for voice
>> If availability is indicated, the UE uses the IM CN Subsystem and can terminate or originate requests for SIP sessions including an audio component with codecs suited for voice.
[('If availability is indicated', 'if')] ----> the UE can terminate requests for SIP sessions including an audio component with codecs suited for voice
>> If availability is indicated, the UE uses the IM CN Subsystem and can terminate or originate requests for SIP sessions including an audio component with codecs suited for voice.
[('If availability is indicated', 'if')] ----> the UE uses the IM CN Subsystem
>> If a UE has preference for voice services, then the UE's usage setting is "voice centric".
[('If a UE has preference for voice services', 'if')] ----> then the UE's usage setting is voice centric
>> If a UE has preference for data services, then the UE's usage setting is "data centric".
[('If a UE has preference for data services', 'if')] ----> then the UE's usage setting is data centric
>> If the UE is capable of both S1 mode and N1 mode, there is a single UE's usage setting which applies to both 5GS and EPS.
[('If the UE is capable of both S1 mode and N1 mode', 'if')] ----> is a single UE's usage setting which applies to both 5GS and EPS
>> If EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection is not supported by the UE or the MME, then the success of the attach procedure is dependent on the success of the default EPS bearer context activation procedure.
[('If EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection is not supported by the UE or the MME', 'if')] ----> then the success of the attach procedure is dependent on the success of the default EPS bearer context activation procedure
>> If the attach procedure fails, then the ESM procedures also fail.
[('If the attach procedure fails', 'if')] ----> then the ESM procedures also fail
>> A UE configured for NAS signalling low priority indicates this by including the Device properties IE in the appropriate NAS message and setting the low priority indicator to "MS is configured for NAS signalling low priority", except for the following cases in which the UE shall set the low priority indicator to "MS is not configured for NAS signalling low priority":
[('including the Device properties IE in the appropriate NAS message', 'by'), ('setting the low priority indicator to " MS is configured for NAS signalling low priority', 'by')] ----> A UE configured for NAS signalling low priority indicates this except for the following cases in which the UE shall set the low priority indicator to " MS is not configured for NAS signalling low priority "
>> the UE is not configured to use IMS voice, i.e. when the voice domain preference for E-UTRAN, as defined in 3GPP TS 24.167 [13B], indicates that voice communication services are allowed to be invoked only over the CS domain;
[('when the voice domain preference for E-UTRAN , as defined in 3GPP TS 24.167 [ 13B ] , indicates that voice communication services are allowed to be invoked only over the CS domain', 'when')] ----> the UE not configured to use IMS voice , i.e .
>> The EPS security context is taken into use by the UE and the MME, when the MME initiates a security mode control procedure or during the inter-system handover procedure from A/Gb mode to S1 mode or Iu mode to S1 mode.
[('when the MME initiates a security mode control procedure or during the inter-system handover procedure from A/Gb mode to S1 mode or Iu mode to S1 mode', 'when')] ----> The EPS security context taken into use by the UE and the MME
>> When the EPS security context is a native EPS security context, the eKSI has the value of KSIASME, and when the current EPS security context is of type mapped, the eKSI has the value of KSISGSN.
[('When the EPS security context is a native EPS security context', 'when')] ----> the eKSI has the value of KSIASME
>> When the EPS security context is a native EPS security context, the eKSI has the value of KSIASME, and when the current EPS security context is of type mapped, the eKSI has the value of KSISGSN.
[('the current EPS security context is of type', 'when'), ('type mapped', 'when')] ----> the eKSI has the value of KSISGSN
>> In the present document, when the UE is required to delete an eKSI, the UE shall set the eKSI to the value "no key is available" and consider also the associated keys KASME or K'ASME, EPS NAS ciphering key and EPS NAS integrity key invalid.
[('when the UE is required to delete an eKSI', 'when')] ----> In the present document the UE shall set the eKSI to the value " no key is available "
>> In the present document, when the UE is required to delete an eKSI, the UE shall set the eKSI to the value "no key is available" and consider also the associated keys KASME or K'ASME, EPS NAS ciphering key and EPS NAS integrity key invalid.
[('when the UE is required to delete an eKSI', 'when')] ----> In the present document the UE shall consider also the associated keys KASME or K'ASME , EPS NAS ciphering key and EPS NAS integrity key invalid
>> After a successful EPS authentication, which creates a new partial native EPS security context, the MME and the UE shall delete the non-current EPS security context, if any.
[('if any', 'if')] ----> After a successful EPS authentication , which creates a new partial native EPS security context the MME and the UE shall delete the non-current EPS security context
>> When a partial native EPS security context is taken into use through a security mode control procedure, the MME and the UE shall delete the previously current EPS security context.
[('When a partial native EPS security context is taken into use through a security mode control procedure', 'when')] ----> the MME and the UE shall delete the previously current EPS security context
>> When the MME and the UE create an EPS security context using null integrity and null ciphering algorithm during an attach procedure for emergency bearer services, or a tracking area updating procedure for a UE that has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services, the MME and the UE shall delete the previous current EPS security context.
[('When the MME and the UE create an EPS security context using null integrity and null ciphering algorithm during an attach procedure for emergency bearer services , or a tracking area updating procedure for a UE that has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services', 'when')] ----> the MME and the UE shall delete the previous current EPS security context
>> When a new mapped EPS security context or EPS security context created using null integrity and null ciphering algorithm is taken into use during the inter-system handover from A/Gb mode to S1 mode or Iu mode to S1 mode, the MME and the UE shall not delete the previously current native EPS security context, if any.
[('When a new mapped EPS security context or EPS security context created using null integrity and null ciphering algorithm is taken into use during the inter-system handover from A/Gb mode to S1 mode or Iu mode to S1 mode', 'when'), ('if any', 'if')] ----> the MME and the UE shall not delete the previously current native EPS security context
>> If no previously current native EPS security context exists, the MME and the UE shall not delete the partial native EPS security context, if any.
[('If no previously current native EPS security context exists', 'if'), ('if any', 'if')] ----> the MME and the UE shall not delete the partial native EPS security context
>> When the MME and the UE derive a new mapped EPS security context during inter-system handover from A/Gb mode to S1 mode or Iu mode to S1 mode, the MME and the UE shall delete any existing current mapped EPS security context.
[('When the MME and the UE derive a new mapped EPS security context during inter-system handover from A/Gb mode to S1 mode or Iu mode to S1 mode', 'when')] ----> the MME and the UE shall delete any existing current mapped EPS security context
>> When a non-current full native EPS security context is taken into use by a security mode control procedure, then the MME and the UE shall delete the previously current mapped EPS security context.
[('When a non-current full native EPS security context is taken into use by a security mode control procedure', 'when')] ----> then the MME and the UE shall delete the previously current mapped EPS security context
>> When the UE or the MME moves from EMM-REGISTERED to EMM-DEREGISTERED state, if the current EPS security context is a mapped EPS security context and a non-current full native EPS security context exists, then the non-current EPS security context shall become the current EPS security context.
[('When the UE or the MME moves from EMM-REGISTERED to EMM-DEREGISTERED state', 'when'), ('the current EPS security context is a mapped EPS security context', 'if'), ('a non-current full native EPS security context exists', 'if')] ----> then the non-current EPS security context shall become the current EPS security context
>> The UE shall mark the EPS security context on the USIM or in the non-volatile memory as invalid when the UE initiates an attach procedure as described in subclause 5.5.1 or when the UE leaves state EMM-DEREGISTERED for any other state except EMM-NULL.
[('when the UE leaves state EMM-DEREGISTERED for any other state except EMM-NULL', 'when')] ----> The UE shall mark the EPS security context on the USIM or in the non-volatile memory as invalid
>> The UE shall mark the EPS security context on the USIM or in the non-volatile memory as invalid when the UE initiates an attach procedure as described in subclause 5.5.1 or when the UE leaves state EMM-DEREGISTERED for any other state except EMM-NULL.
[('when the UE initiates an attach procedure as described in subclause 5.5.1', 'when')] ----> The UE shall mark the EPS security context on the USIM or in the non-volatile memory as invalid
>> Secure exchange of NAS messages via a NAS signalling connection is usually established by the MME during the attach procedure by initiating a security mode control procedure.
[('by initiating a security mode control procedure', 'by')] ----> Secure exchange of NAS messages via a NAS signalling connection usually established by the MME during the attach procedure
>> During inter-system change from N1 mode to S1 mode in EMM-IDLE mode, if the UE is operating in the single-registration mode and, if the tracking area updating procedure is initiated as specified in 3GPP TS 24.501 [54], the UE shall transmit a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message integrity protected with the current 5G NAS security context and the UE shall derive a mapped EPS security context.
[('the UE operating in the single-registration mode', 'if'), ('the tracking area updating procedure initiated as specified in 3GPP TS 24.501 [ 54 ]', 'if')] ----> During inter-system change from N1 mode to S1 mode in EMM-IDLE mode the UE shall transmit a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message integrity protected with the current 5G NAS security context
>> After receiving the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message including the eKSI, the MME forwards the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message to the source AMF, if possible, to obtain the mapped EPS security context from the AMF as specified in 3GPP TS 33.501 [56].
[('if possible', 'if')] ----> After receiving the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message including the eKSI the MME forwards the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message to the source AMF to obtain the mapped EPS security context from the AMF as specified in 3GPP TS 33.501 [ 56 ]
>> The MME re-establishes the secure exchange of NAS messages by either, replying with a TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message that is integrity protected and ciphered using the mapped EPS security context.
[('by either', 'by')] ----> The MME re-establishes the secure exchange of NAS messages replying with a TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message that is integrity protected and ciphered using the mapped EPS security context
>> The MME re-establishes the secure exchange of NAS messages by either, initiating a security mode control procedure.
[('by either', 'by')] ----> The MME re-establishes the secure exchange of NAS messages initiating a security mode control procedure
>> During inter-system change from N1 mode to S1 mode in EMM-IDLE mode, if the UE is operating in the single-registration mode and, if the attach procedure is initiated as specified in 3GPP TS 24.501 [54] and, if the UE has received an "interworking without N26 interface not supported" indication from the network and the UE has a valid 5G NAS security context, the UE shall send an ATTACH REQUEST message integrity protected with the current 5G NAS security context and the UE shall derive a mapped EPS security context.
[('the UE operating in the single-registration mode', 'if'), ('the attach procedure initiated as specified in 3GPP TS 24.501 [ 54 ]', 'if'), ('if the UE has received an " interworking without N26 interface not supported " indication from the network the UE has a valid 5G NAS security context', 'if')] ----> During the UE shall send an ATTACH REQUEST message integrity protected with the current 5G NAS security context
>> After receiving the ATTACH REQUEST message including the eKSI, the MME forwards the ATTACH REQUEST message to the source AMF, if possible, to obtain the mapped EPS security context from the AMF as specified in 3GPP TS 33.501 [56].
[('if possible', 'if')] ----> After receiving the ATTACH REQUEST message including the eKSI the MME forwards the ATTACH REQUEST message to the source AMF to obtain the mapped EPS security context from the AMF as specified in 3GPP TS 33.501 [ 56 ]
>> The MME re-establishes the secure exchange of NAS messages by either, replying with an ATTACH ACCEPT message that is integrity protected and ciphered using the mapped EPS NAS security context.
[('by either', 'by')] ----> The MME re-establishes the secure exchange of NAS messages replying with an ATTACH ACCEPT message that is integrity protected and ciphered using the mapped EPS NAS security context
>> During inter-system change from N1 mode to S1 mode in EMM-IDLE mode, if the UE is operating in the single-registration mode and, if the attach procedure is initiated as specified in 3GPP TS 24.501 [54] and, otherwise, if the UE has a valid native EPS security context, the UE shall send an ATTACH REQUEST message integrity protected with the native EPS security context.
[('if the UE has a valid native EPS security context', 'if'), ('the UE operating in the single-registration mode', 'if'), ('the attach procedure initiated as specified in 3GPP TS 24.501 [ 54 ]', 'if')] ----> During inter-system change from N1 mode to S1 mode in EMM-IDLE mode otherwise the UE shall send an ATTACH REQUEST message integrity protected with the native EPS security context
>> If the verification is successful, the MME re-establishes the secure exchange of NAS messages by either, replying with an ATTACH ACCEPT message that is integrity protected and ciphered using the current EPS security context.
[('If the verification is successful', 'if'), ('by either , replying with an ATTACH ACCEPT message that is integrity protected and ciphered using the current EPS security context', 'by')] ----> the MME re-establishes the secure exchange of NAS messages
>> If the verification is successful, the MME re-establishes the secure exchange of NAS messages by either, initiating a security mode control procedure.
[('If the verification is successful', 'if'), ('by either', 'by')] ----> the MME re-establishes the secure exchange of NAS messages initiating a security mode control procedure
>> During inter-system change from N1 mode to S1 mode in EMM-IDLE mode, if the UE is operating in the single-registration mode and, if the attach procedure is initiated as specified in 3GPP TS 24.501 [54] and, otherwise, if the UE has no valid native EPS security context, the UE shall send an ATTACH REQUEST message without integrity protection and encryption.
[('if the UE has no valid native EPS security context', 'if'), ('the UE operating in the single-registration mode', 'if'), ('the attach procedure initiated as specified in 3GPP TS 24.501 [ 54 ]', 'if')] ----> During inter-system change from N1 mode to S1 mode in EMM-IDLE mode otherwise the UE shall send an ATTACH REQUEST message without integrity protection and encryption
>> When a UE in EMM-IDLE mode establishes a new NAS signalling connection and has a valid current EPS security context, secure exchange of NAS messages can be re-established in the following ways:
[('When a UE in EMM-IDLE mode establishes a new NAS signalling connection and has a valid current EPS security context', 'when')] ----> secure exchange of NAS messages can re-established in the following ways
>> If the verification is successful, the MME may re-establish the secure exchange of NAS messages, by replying with a NAS message that is integrity protected and ciphered using the current EPS security context.
[('If the verification is successful', 'if'), ('by replying with a NAS message that is integrity protected and ciphered using the current EPS security context', 'by')] ----> the MME may re-establish the secure exchange of NAS messages
>> If the verification is successful, the MME may re-establish the secure exchange of NAS messages, by initiating a security mode control procedure.
[('If the verification is successful', 'if'), ('by initiating a security mode control procedure', 'by')] ----> the MME may re-establish the secure exchange of NAS messages
>> If the initial NAS message was a SERVICE REQUEST message or EXTENDED SERVICE REQUEST message, secure exchange of NAS messages is triggered by the indication from the lower layers that the user plane radio bearers are successfully set up.
[('If the initial NAS message was a SERVICE REQUEST message or EXTENDED SERVICE REQUEST message', 'if')] ----> secure exchange of NAS messages triggered by the indication from the lower layers that the user plane radio bearers are successfully set up
>> If the UE has no current EPS security context and performs a tracking area updating procedure after an inter-system change in idle mode from A/Gb mode to S1 mode or Iu mode to S1 mode, the UE shall send the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message without integrity protection and encryption.
[('the UE has no current EPS security context', 'if'), ('the UE performs a tracking area updating procedure after an inter-system change in idle mode from A/Gb mode to S1 mode or Iu mode to S1 mode', 'if')] ----> the UE shall send the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message without integrity protection and encryption
>> The MME creates a fresh mapped EPS security context and takes this context into use by initiating a security mode control procedure and this context becomes the current EPS security context in both the UE and the MME.
[('by initiating a security mode control procedure', 'by')] ----> The MME takes this context into use
>> If the initial NAS message is a CONTROL PLANE SERVICE REQUEST message, the UE shall send the message integrity protected.
[('If the initial NAS message is a CONTROL PLANE SERVICE REQUEST message', 'if')] ----> the UE shall send the message integrity protected
>> Secure exchange of NAS messages is re-established in the UE, upon receipt of a NAS message that is integrity protected and ciphered using the current EPS security context;
[('upon receiving of a NAS message that is integrity protected and ciphered using the current EPS security context', 'upon')] ----> Secure exchange of NAS messages re-established in the UE
>> Secure exchange of NAS messages is re-established in the UE, upon receipt of a SECURITY MODE COMMAND message that has successfully passed the integrity check.
[('upon receiving of a SECURITY MODE COMMAND message that has successfully passed the integrity check', 'upon')] ----> Secure exchange of NAS messages re-established in the UE
>> When the MME initiates a re-authentication to create a new EPS security context, the messages exchanged during the authentication procedure are integrity protected and ciphered using the current EPS security context, if any.
[('When the MME initiates a re-authentication to create a new EPS security context', 'when')] ----> the messages exchanged during the authentication procedure are integrity protected and ciphered using the current EPS security context , if any
>> When the UE responds with a SECURITY MODE COMPLETE, it shall send the message integrity protected and ciphered with the new EPS security context.
[('When the UE responds with a SECURITY MODE COMPLETE', 'when')] ----> it shall send the message integrity protected and ciphered with the new EPS security context
>> The MME can also modify the current EPS security context or take the non-current native EPS security context, if any, into use, by sending a SECURITY MODE COMMAND message including the eKSI of the EPS security context to be modified and including a new set of selected NAS security algorithms.
[('by sending a SECURITY MODE COMMAND message including the eKSI of the EPS security context to be modified and including a new set of selected NAS security algorithms', 'by')] ----> The MME can also take the non-current native EPS security context , if any into use
>> When the UE replies with a SECURITY MODE COMPLETE message, it shall send the message integrity protected and ciphered with the modified EPS security context.
[('When the UE replies with a SECURITY MODE COMPLETE message', 'when')] ----> it shall send the message integrity protected and ciphered with the modified EPS security context
>> When NAS COUNT is input to NAS ciphering or NAS integrity algorithms it shall be considered to be a 32-bit entity which shall be constructed by padding the 24-bit internal representation with 8 zeros in the most significant bits.
[('When NAS COUNT is input to NAS ciphering or NAS integrity algorithms', 'when')] ----> shall considered to be a 32-bit entity which shall be constructed by padding the 24-bit internal representation with 8 zeros in the most significant bits
>> After each new or retransmitted outbound security protected NAS message, the sender shall increase the NAS COUNT number by one, except for the initial NAS messages if the lower layers indicated the failure to establish the RRC connection.
[('if the lower layers indicated the failure to establish the RRC connection', 'if')] ----> After each new or retransmitted outbound security protected NAS message the sender shall increase the NAS COUNT number by one except for the initial NAS messages
>> Specifically, on the sender side, the NAS sequence number shall be increased by one, and if the result is zero, the NAS overflow counter shall also be incremented by one.
[('if the result is zero', 'if')] ----> the NAS overflow counter shall also incremented by one
>> Specifically, if the estimated NAS sequence number wraps around, the NAS overflow counter shall be incremented by one.
[('if the estimated NAS sequence number wraps around', 'if')] ----> Specifically the NAS overflow counter shall incremented by one
>> When the MME receives a NAS token via SGSN during an idle mode inter-system change from S1 mode to A/Gb mode or Iu mode, the MME shall check the NAS token as specified in 3GPP TS 33.401 [19], subclause 9.1.1, and update its uplink NAS COUNT with the uplink NAS COUNT value used for the successful check of the NAS token.
[('When the MME receives a NAS token via SGSN during an idle mode inter-system change from S1 mode to A/Gb mode or Iu mode', 'when')] ----> the MME shall check the NAS token as specified in 3GPP TS 33.401 [ 19 ] subclause 9.1.1
>> When the MME receives a NAS token via SGSN during an idle mode inter-system change from S1 mode to A/Gb mode or Iu mode, the MME shall check the NAS token as specified in 3GPP TS 33.401 [19], subclause 9.1.1, and update its uplink NAS COUNT with the uplink NAS COUNT value used for the successful check of the NAS token.
[('When the MME receives a NAS token via SGSN during an idle mode inter-system change from S1 mode to A/Gb mode or Iu mode', 'when')] ----> the MME shall update its uplink NAS COUNT with the uplink NAS COUNT value used for the successful check of the NAS token
>> During the handover from UTRAN/GERAN to E-UTRAN, when a mapped EPS security context is derived and taken into use, the MME shall set both the uplink and downlink NAS COUNT counters of this EPS security context to zero.
[('when a mapped EPS security context derived', 'when'), ('when a mapped EPS security context taken into use', 'when')] ----> During the handover from UTRAN/GERAN to E-UTRAN the MME shall set both the uplink and downlink NAS COUNT counters of this EPS security context to zero
>> When a mapped EPS security context is derived as specified in 3GPP TS 33.501 [56] and taken into use during the inter-system change from N1 mode to S1 mode in 5GMM-CONNECTED mode, the MME shall store the mapped EPS NAS security context with the uplink and downlink NAS COUNT counters associated with the derived K'ASME key set to the uplink and downlink NAS COUNT counters of the mapped EPS NAS security context respectively.
[('When a mapped EPS security context derived as specified in 3GPP TS 33.501 [ 56 ]', 'when'), ('When a mapped EPS security context taken into use during the inter-system change from N1 mode to S1 mode in 5GMM-CONNECTED mode', 'when')] ----> the MME shall store the mapped EPS NAS security context with the uplink and downlink NAS COUNT counters associated with the derived K'ASME key set to the uplink and downlink NAS COUNT counters of the mapped EPS NAS security context respectively
>> When a mapped EPS security context is derived as specified in 3GPP TS 33.501 [56] and taken into use during the inter-system change from N1 mode to S1 mode in EMM-IDLE mode for the UE operating in single-registration mode in a network supporting N26 interface, the MME shall store the mapped EPS NAS security context with the uplink and downlink NAS COUNT counters associated with the derived K'ASME key set to the uplink and downlink NAS COUNT counters of the mapped EPS NAS security context respectively.
[('When a mapped EPS security context derived as specified in 3GPP TS 33.501 [ 56 ]', 'when'), ('When a mapped EPS security context taken into use during the inter-system change from N1 mode to S1 mode in EMM-IDLE mode for the UE operating in single-registration mode in a network supporting N26 interface', 'when')] ----> the MME shall store the mapped EPS NAS security context with the uplink and downlink NAS COUNT counters associated with the derived K'ASME key set to the uplink and downlink NAS COUNT counters of the mapped EPS NAS security context respectively
>> When this is the case, the receiver shall estimate the remaining 3 most significant bits of the sequence number.
[('When this is the case', 'when')] ----> the receiver shall estimate the remaining 3 most significant bits of the sequence number
>> Replay protection is not applicable when EIA0 is used.
[('when EIA0 is used', 'when')] ----> Replay protection is not applicable
>> Integrity verification is not applicable when EIA0 is used.
[('when EIA0 is used', 'when')] ----> Integrity verification is not applicable
>> When an initial plain NAS message for transport of user data via control plane is to be partially ciphered, the length of the key stream is set to the length of the part of the initial plain NAS message that is to be ciphered.
[('an initial plain NAS message for transport of user data via control plane is to be partially ciphered', 'when'), ('When an initial plain NAS message for transport of user data via control plane partially ciphered', 'when')] ----> the length of the key stream set to the length of the part of the initial plain NAS message that is to be ciphered
>> If, when increasing the NAS COUNT as specified above, the MME detects that either its downlink NAS COUNT or the UE's uplink NAS COUNT is "close" to wrap around,, the MME shall take the following actions:
[('when increasing the NAS COUNT as specified above', 'if'), ('either its downlink NAS COUNT or the UE\'s uplink NAS COUNT is " close " to wrap around', 'if')] ----> the MME shall take the following actions
>> If there is no non-current native EPS security context with sufficiently low NAS COUNT values, the MME shall initiate a new AKA procedure with the UE, leading to a new established EPS security context and the NAS COUNT being reset to 0 in both the UE and the MME when the new EPS security context is activated;
[('If there is no non-current native EPS security context with sufficiently low NAS COUNT values', 'if')] ----> the MME shall initiate a new AKA procedure with the UE leading to a new established EPS security context and the NAS COUNT being reset to 0 in both the UE and the MME when the new EPS security context is activated
>> If for some reason a new KASME has not been established using AKA before the NAS COUNT wraps around, the node in need of sending a NAS message shall instead release the NAS signalling connection.
[('If for some reason a new KASME has not been established using AKA before the NAS COUNT wraps around', 'if')] ----> the node in need of sending a NAS message shall instead release the NAS signalling connection
>> When the EIA0 is used as the NAS integrity algorithm, the UE and the MME shall allow NAS COUNT wrap around.
[('When the EIA0 is used as the NAS integrity algorithm', 'when')] ----> the UE and the MME shall allow NAS COUNT wrap around
>> If NAS COUNT wrap around occurs, the following requirements apply:
[('If NAS COUNT wrap around occurs', 'if')] ----> the following requirements apply
>> For the UE, integrity protected signalling is mandatory for the NAS messages once a valid EPS security context exists and has been taken into use.
[('once a valid EPS security context exists', 'once'), ('once a valid EPS security context taken into use', 'once')] ----> For the UE integrity protected signalling is mandatory for the NAS messages
>> For the network, integrity protected signalling is mandatory for the NAS messages once a secure exchange of NAS messages has been established for the NAS signalling connection.
[('once a secure exchange of NAS messages has been established for the NAS signalling connection', 'once')] ----> For the network integrity protected signalling is mandatory for the NAS messages
>> If the "null integrity protection algorithm" EIA0 has been selected as a integrity protection algorithm, the receiver shall regard the NAS messages with the security header indicating integrity protection as integrity protected.
[('If the " null integrity protection algorithm " EIA0 has been selected as a integrity protection algorithm', 'if')] ----> the receiver shall regard the NAS messages with the security header indicating integrity protection as integrity protected
>> When a NAS message needs to be sent both ciphered and integrity protected, the NAS message is first ciphered and then the ciphered NAS message and the NAS sequence number are integrity protected by calculating the MAC.
[('by calculating the MAC', 'by')] ----> then the ciphered NAS message and the NAS sequence number protected
>> The same applies when an initial NAS message needs to be sent partially ciphered and integrity protected.
[('when an initial NAS message needs to be sent partially ciphered and integrity protected', 'when')] ----> The same applies
>> When a NAS message needs to be sent only integrity protected and unciphered, the unciphered NAS message and the NAS sequence number are integrity protected by calculating the MAC.
[('When a NAS message needs to be sent only integrity protected', 'when'), ('only integrity unciphered', 'when')] ----> the unciphered NAS message and the NAS sequence number are integrity protected by calculating the MAC
>> When during the EPS attach procedure or service request procedure an ESM message is piggybacked in an EMM message, there is only one sequence number IE and one message authentication code IE, if any, for the combined NAS message.
[('When during the EPS attach procedure or service request procedure an ESM message is piggybacked in an EMM message', 'when')] ----> is only one sequence number IE and one message authentication code IE , if any , for the combined NAS message
>> Once the secure exchange of NAS messages has been established, the receiving EMM or ESM entity in the UE shall not process any NAS signalling messages unless they have been successfully integrity checked by the NAS.
[('Once the secure exchange of NAS messages has been established', 'once')] ----> the receiving EMM or ESM entity in the UE shall not process any NAS signalling messages unless they have been successfully integrity checked by the NAS
>> If NAS signalling messages, having not successfully passed the integrity check, are received, then the NAS in the UE shall discard that message.
[('If NAS signalling messages , having not successfully passed the integrity check , are received', 'if')] ----> then the NAS in the UE shall discard that message
>> If any NAS signalling message is received as not integrity protected even though the secure exchange of NAS messages has been established by the network, then the NAS shall discard this message.
[('If any NAS signalling message is received as not integrity protected even though the secure exchange of NAS messages has been established by the network', 'if')] ----> then the NAS shall discard this message
>> All ESM messages are integrity protected except a PDN CONNECTIVITY REQUEST message if it is sent piggybacked in ATTACH REQUEST message and NAS security is not activated.
[('it sent piggybacked in ATTACH REQUEST message', 'if'), ('NAS security not activated', 'if')] ----> All ESM messages integrity protected
>> Once a current EPS security context exists, until the secure exchange of NAS messages has been established for the NAS signalling connection, the receiving EMM entity in the MME shall process the following NAS signalling messages, even if the MAC included in the message fails the integrity check or cannot be verified, as the EPS security context is not available in the network:
[('Once a current EPS security context exists', 'once')] ----> until the secure exchange of NAS messages has been established for the NAS signalling connection the receiving EMM entity in the MME shall process the following NAS signalling messages even if the MAC included in the message fails the integrity check or cannot be verified , as the EPS security context is not available in the network
>> If an ATTACH REQUEST message is received without integrity protection or fails the integrity check and it is not an attach request for emergency bearer services and it is not an attach request for access to RLOS, the MME shall authenticate the subscriber before processing the attach request any further.
[('an ATTACH REQUEST message received without integrity protection', 'if'), ('an ATTACH REQUEST message fails the integrity check', 'if'), ('it is not an attach request for emergency bearer services', 'if'), ('it is not an attach request for access to RLOS', 'if')] ----> the MME shall authenticate the subscriber before processing the attach request any further
>> Additionally, if the MME initiates a security mode control procedure, the MME shall include a HASHMME IE in the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message as specified in subclause 5.4.3.2.
[('if the MME initiates a security mode control procedure', 'if')] ----> Additionally the MME shall include a HASHMME IE in the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message as specified in subclause 5.4.3.2
>> For the case when the attach procedure is for emergency bearer services see subclause 5.5.1.2.3 and subclause 5.4.2.5.
[('when the attach procedure is for emergency bearer services', 'when')] ----> For the case see subclause 5.5.1.2.3 and subclause 5.4.2.5
>> If a DETACH REQUEST message fails the integrity check, the MME shall proceed as follows:
[('If a DETACH REQUEST message fails the integrity check', 'if')] ----> the MME shall proceed as follows
>> If it is not a detach request due to switch off, and the MME can initiate an authentication procedure, the MME should authenticate the subscriber before processing the detach request any further.
[('it is not a detach request due to switch off', 'if'), ('the MME can initiate an authentication procedure', 'if')] ----> the MME should authenticate the subscriber before processing the detach request any further
>> If it is a detach request due to switch off, or the MME does not initiate an authentication procedure for any other reason, the MME may ignore the detach request and remain in state EMM-REGISTERED.
[('the MME not initiate an authentication procedure for any other reason', 'if')] ----> the MME may ignore the detach request
>> If it is a detach request due to switch off, or the MME does not initiate an authentication procedure for any other reason, the MME may ignore the detach request and remain in state EMM-REGISTERED.
[('it is a detach request due to switch off', 'if')] ----> the MME may ignore the detach request
>> If it is a detach request due to switch off, or the MME does not initiate an authentication procedure for any other reason, the MME may ignore the detach request and remain in state EMM-REGISTERED.
[('it is a detach request due to switch off', 'if')] ----> the MME may remain in state EMM-REGISTERED
>> If it is a detach request due to switch off, or the MME does not initiate an authentication procedure for any other reason, the MME may ignore the detach request and remain in state EMM-REGISTERED.
[('the MME not initiate an authentication procedure for any other reason', 'if')] ----> the MME may remain in state EMM-REGISTERED
>> If a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message is received without integrity protection or fails the integrity check and the UE provided a nonceUE, GPRS ciphering key sequence number, P-TMSI and RAI in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message, the MME shall initiate a security mode control procedure to take a new mapped EPS security context into use; otherwise, if the UE has only a PDN connection for non-emergency bearer services established and the PDN connection is not for RLOS, the MME shall initiate an authentication procedure.
[('the UE has only a PDN connection for non-emergency bearer services established', 'if'), ('the PDN connection is not for RLOS', 'if')] ----> the MME shall initiate an authentication procedure
>> For the case when the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services or for RLOS see subclause 5.5.3.2.3 and subclause 5.4.2.5.
[('when the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services or for', 'when')] ----> For the case RLOS see subclause 5.5.3.2.3 and subclause 5.4.2.5
>> If a SERVICE REQUEST, EXTENDED SERVICE REQUEST or CONTROL PLANE SERVICE REQUEST message fails the integrity check and the UE has only PDN connections for non-emergency bearer services established and the PDN connections are not for RLOS, the MME shall send the SERVICE REJECT message with EMM cause #9 "UE identity cannot be derived by the network" and keep the EMM-context and EPS security context unchanged.
[('a SERVICE REQUEST , EXTENDED SERVICE REQUEST or CONTROL PLANE SERVICE REQUEST message fails the integrity check', 'if'), ('the UE has only PDN connections for non-emergency bearer services established', 'if'), ('the PDN connections are not for RLOS', 'if')] ----> the MME shall send the SERVICE REJECT message with EMM cause # 9 " UE identity cannot be derived by the network "
>> If a SERVICE REQUEST, EXTENDED SERVICE REQUEST or CONTROL PLANE SERVICE REQUEST message fails the integrity check and the UE has only PDN connections for non-emergency bearer services established and the PDN connections are not for RLOS, the MME shall send the SERVICE REJECT message with EMM cause #9 "UE identity cannot be derived by the network" and keep the EMM-context and EPS security context unchanged.
[('a SERVICE REQUEST , EXTENDED SERVICE REQUEST or CONTROL PLANE SERVICE REQUEST message fails the integrity check', 'if'), ('the UE has only PDN connections for non-emergency bearer services established', 'if'), ('the PDN connections are not for RLOS', 'if')] ----> the MME shall keep unchanged
>> For the case when the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services or RLOS and integrity check fails, the MME may skip the authentication procedure even if no EPS security context is available and proceed directly to the execution of the security mode control procedure as specified in subclause 5.4.3.
[('the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services or RLOS and integrity check', 'when'), ('when the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services or RLOS integrity check fails', 'when')] ----> For the case the MME may proceed directly to the execution of the security mode control procedure as specified in subclause 5.4.3
>> For the case when the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services or RLOS and integrity check fails, the MME may skip the authentication procedure even if no EPS security context is available and proceed directly to the execution of the security mode control procedure as specified in subclause 5.4.3.
[('the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services or RLOS and integrity check', 'when'), ('when the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services or RLOS integrity check fails', 'when')] ----> For the case the MME may skip the authentication procedure even if no EPS security context is available
>> Once the secure exchange of NAS messages has been established for the NAS signalling connection, the receiving EMM or ESM entity in the MME shall not process any NAS signalling messages unless they have been successfully integrity checked by the NAS.
[('Once the secure exchange of NAS messages has been established for the NAS signalling connection', 'once')] ----> the receiving EMM or ESM entity in the MME shall not process any NAS signalling messages unless they have been successfully integrity checked by the NAS
>> If any NAS signalling message, having not successfully passed the integrity check, is received, then the NAS in the MME shall discard that message.
[('If any NAS signalling message , having not successfully passed the integrity check , is received', 'if')] ----> then the NAS in the MME shall discard that message
>> If any NAS signalling message is received, as not integrity protected even though the secure exchange of NAS messages has been established, then the NAS shall discard this message.
[('any NAS signalling message received', 'if'), ('not integrity protected even though the secure exchange of NAS messages has been established', 'if')] ----> then the NAS shall discard this message
>> When operation of the network without ciphering is configured, the MME shall indicate the use of "null ciphering algorithm" EEA0 in the current security context for all UEs.
[('When operation of the network without ciphering is configured', 'when')] ----> the MME shall indicate the use of " null ciphering algorithm " EEA0 in the current security context for all UEs
>> When the UE establishes a new NAS signalling connection, it shall send the initial NAS message partially ciphered, if it is a CONTROL PLANE SERVICE REQUEST message including an ESM message container information element or a NAS message container information element;
[('When the UE establishes a new NAS signalling connection', 'when'), ('if it is a CONTROL PLANE SERVICE REQUEST message including an ESM message container information element or a NAS message container information element', 'if')] ----> it shall send the initial NAS message partially ciphered
>> When the UE establishes a new NAS signalling connection, it shall send the initial NAS message unciphered, if it is any other initial NAS message.
[('When the UE establishes a new NAS signalling connection', 'when'), ('if it is any other initial NAS message', 'if')] ----> it shall send the initial NAS message unciphered
>> The UE shall partially cipher the CONTROL PLANE SERVICE REQUEST message by ciphering the value part of the ESM message container IE or the value part of the NAS message container, using the ciphering algorithm of the current EPS security context.
[('by ciphering the value part of the ESM message container IE or the value part of the NAS message container', 'by')] ----> The UE shall partially cipher the CONTROL PLANE SERVICE REQUEST message using the ciphering algorithm of the current EPS security context
>> Except for the CONTROL PLANE SERVICE REQUEST message including an ESM message container information element or a NAS message container information element, the UE shall start the ciphering and deciphering of NAS messages when the secure exchange of NAS messages has been established for a NAS signalling connection.
[('when the secure exchange of NAS messages has been established for a NAS signalling connection', 'when')] ----> Except for the CONTROL PLANE SERVICE REQUEST message including an ESM message container information element or a NAS message container information element the UE shall start the ciphering and deciphering of NAS messages
>> Once the encryption of NAS messages has been started between the MME and the UE, the receiver shall discard the unciphered NAS messages which shall have been ciphered according to the rules described in this specification.
[('Once the encryption of NAS messages has been started between the MME and the UE', 'once')] ----> the receiver shall discard the unciphered NAS messages which shall have been ciphered according to the rules described in this specification
>> If the "null ciphering algorithm" EEA0 has been selected as a ciphering algorithm, the NAS messages with the security header indicating ciphering are regarded as ciphered.
[('If the " null ciphering algorithm " EEA0 has been selected as a ciphering algorithm', 'if')] ----> the NAS messages with the security header indicating ciphering regarded as ciphered
>> The UE shall only disable the E-UTRA capability when in EMM-IDLE mode.
[('when in EMM-IDLE mode', 'when')] ----> The UE shall only disable the E-UTRA capability
>> When the UE supports both N1 mode and S1 mode then the UE's capability to access the 5GCN via E-UTRA shall not be affected, if the UE's E-UTRA capability is disabled or enabled.
[('When the UE supports both N1 mode and S1 mode', 'when'), ("if the UE's E-UTRA capability is disabled or enabled", 'if')] ----> then the UE's capability to access the 5GCN via E-UTRA shall not affected
>> When the UE is disabling the E-UTRA capability not due to redirection to 5GCN required, it should proceed as follows:
[('When the UE is disabling the E-UTRA capability not due to redirection to 5GCN required', 'when')] ----> it should proceed as follows
>> if another RAT of the registered PLMN or a PLMN from the list of equivalent PLMNs cannot be found, or the UE does not have a registered PLMN, then perform PLMN selection as specified in 3GPP TS 23.122 [6].
[('the UE not have a registered PLMN', 'if')] ----> then perform PLMN selection as specified in 3GPP TS 23.122 [ 6 ]
>> if another RAT of the registered PLMN or a PLMN from the list of equivalent PLMNs cannot be found, or the UE does not have a registered PLMN, then perform PLMN selection as specified in 3GPP TS 23.122 [6].
[('another RAT of the registered PLMN or a PLMN from the list of equivalent PLMNs cannot found', 'if')] ----> then perform PLMN selection as specified in 3GPP TS 23.122 [ 6 ]
>> If disabling of E-UTRA capability was not due to UE initiated detach procedure for EPS services only, the UE may re-enable the E-UTRA capability for this PLMN selection;
[('If disabling of E-UTRA capability was not due to UE initiated detach procedure for EPS services only', 'if')] ----> the UE may re-enable the E-UTRA capability for this PLMN selection
>> if no other allowed PLMN and RAT combinations are available, then the UE may re-enable the E-UTRA capability and remain registered for EPS services in E-UTRAN of the registered PLMN.
[('if no other allowed PLMN and RAT combinations are available', 'if')] ----> then the UE may remain registered for EPS services in E-UTRAN of the registered PLMN
>> if no other allowed PLMN and RAT combinations are available, then the UE may re-enable the E-UTRA capability and remain registered for EPS services in E-UTRAN of the registered PLMN.
[('if no other allowed PLMN and RAT combinations are available', 'if')] ----> then the UE may re-enable the E-UTRA capability
>> If the UE chooses this option, then it may periodically attempt to select another PLMN and RAT combination that can provide non-EPS services.
[('If the UE chooses this option', 'if')] ----> then it may periodically attempt to select another PLMN and RAT combination that can provide non - EPS services
>> When the UE is disabling the E-UTRA capability upon receiving reject cause #31 "Redirection to 5GCN required" as specified in subclauses 5.5.1.2.5, 5.5.1.3.5, 5.5.3.2.5, 5.5.3.3.5 and 5.6.1.5, it should proceed as follows:
[('When the UE is disabling the E-UTRA capability upon receiving reject cause # 31 " Redirection to 5GCN required " as specified in subclauses 5.5.1.2.5 , 5.5.1.3.5 , 5.5.3.2.5 , 5.5.3.3.5 and 5.6.1.5', 'when')] ----> it should proceed as follows
>> If the UE is in NB-S1 mode, if lower layers do not provide an indication that the current E-UTRA cell is connected to 5GCN or lower layers do not provide an indication that the current E-UTRA cell supports CIoT 5GS optimizations that are supported by the UE, search for a suitable NB-IoT cell connected to 5GCN according to 3GPP TS 36.304 [21];
[('If the UE is in NB-S1 mode', 'if'), ('if layers do not provide an indication that the current E-UTRA cell is connected to 5GCN lower layers not provide an indication that the current E-UTRA cell supports CIoT 5GS optimizations that are supported by the UE', 'if')] ----> search for a suitable NB-IoT cell connected to 5GCN according to 3GPP TS 36.304 [ 21 ]
>> If the UE is in NB-S1 mode, if lower layers do not provide an indication that the current E-UTRA cell is connected to 5GCN or lower layers do not provide an indication that the current E-UTRA cell supports CIoT 5GS optimizations that are supported by the UE, search for a suitable NB-IoT cell connected to 5GCN according to 3GPP TS 36.304 [21];
[('If the UE is in NB-S1 mode', 'if'), ('lower layers not provide an indication that the current E-UTRA cell is connected to 5GCN', 'if')] ----> search for a suitable NB-IoT cell connected to 5GCN according to 3GPP TS 36.304 [ 21 ]
>> If the UE is in NB-S1 mode, if lower layers provide an indication that the current E-UTRA cell is connected to 5GCN and the current E-UTRA cell supports CIoT 5GS optimizations that are supported by the UE then perform a core network selection to select 5GCN as specified in 3GPP TS 24.501 [54] subclause 4.8.4A.1;
[('If the UE is in NB-S1 mode', 'if'), ('lower layers provide an indication that the current E-UTRA cell is connected to 5GCN', 'if'), ('the current E-UTRA cell supports CIoT 5GS optimizations that are supported by the UE', 'if')] ----> then perform a core network selection to select 5GCN as specified in 3GPP TS 24.501 [ 54 ] subclause 4.8.4A.1
>> If the UE is in NB-S1 mode, if lower layers cannot find a suitable NB-IoT cell connected to 5GCN or there is no suitable NB-IoT cell connected to 5GCN which supports CIoT 5GS optimizations that are supported by the UE, the UE may re-enable the E-UTRA capability, and indicate to lower layers to remain camped in E-UTRA connected to EPC of the previously registered PLMN and proceed with the appropriate EMM procedure.
[('If the UE is in NB-S1 mode', 'if'), ('is no suitable NB-IoT cell connected to 5GCN which supports CIoT 5GS optimizations that are supported by the UE', 'if')] ----> the UE may indicate to lower layers to remain camped in E-UTRA connected to EPC of the previously registered PLMN and proceed with the appropriate EMM procedure
>> If the UE is in NB-S1 mode, if lower layers cannot find a suitable NB-IoT cell connected to 5GCN or there is no suitable NB-IoT cell connected to 5GCN which supports CIoT 5GS optimizations that are supported by the UE, the UE may re-enable the E-UTRA capability, and indicate to lower layers to remain camped in E-UTRA connected to EPC of the previously registered PLMN and proceed with the appropriate EMM procedure.
[('If the UE is in NB-S1 mode', 'if'), ('is no suitable NB-IoT cell connected to 5GCN which supports CIoT 5GS optimizations that are supported by the UE', 'if')] ----> the UE may re-enable the E-UTRA capability
>> If the UE is in NB-S1 mode, if lower layers cannot find a suitable NB-IoT cell connected to 5GCN or there is no suitable NB-IoT cell connected to 5GCN which supports CIoT 5GS optimizations that are supported by the UE, the UE may re-enable the E-UTRA capability, and indicate to lower layers to remain camped in E-UTRA connected to EPC of the previously registered PLMN and proceed with the appropriate EMM procedure.
[('If the UE is in NB-S1 mode', 'if'), ('lower layers cannot find a suitable NB-IoT cell connected to 5GCN', 'if')] ----> the UE may re-enable the E-UTRA capability
>> If the UE is in NB-S1 mode, if lower layers cannot find a suitable NB-IoT cell connected to 5GCN or there is no suitable NB-IoT cell connected to 5GCN which supports CIoT 5GS optimizations that are supported by the UE, the UE may re-enable the E-UTRA capability, and indicate to lower layers to remain camped in E-UTRA connected to EPC of the previously registered PLMN and proceed with the appropriate EMM procedure.

>> If the UE is in WB-S1 mode, if lower layers do not provide an indication that the current E-UTRA cell is connected to 5GCN or lower layers do not provide an indication that the current E-UTRA cell supports CIoT 5GS optimizations that are supported by the UE, search for a suitable E-UTRA cell connected to 5GCN according to 3GPP TS 36.304 [21];
[('If the UE is in WB-S1 mode', 'if'), ('lower layers not provide an indication that the current E-UTRA cell is connected to 5GCN', 'if')] ----> search for a suitable E-UTRA cell connected to 5GCN according to 3GPP TS 36.304 [ 21 ]

>> If the UE is in WB-S1 mode, if lower layers provide an indication that the current E-UTRA cell is connected to 5GCN and the current E-UTRA cell supports CIoT 5GS optimizations that are supported by the UE, then perform a core network selection to select 5GCN as specified in 3GPP TS 24.501 [54] subclause 4.8.4A.1;
[('If the UE is in WB-S1 mode', 'if'), ('lower layers provide an indication that the current E-UTRA cell is connected to 5GCN', 'if'), ('the current E-UTRA cell supports CIoT 5GS optimizations that are supported by the UE', 'if')] ----> then perform a core network selection to select 5GCN as specified in 3GPP TS 24.501 [ 54 ] subclause 4.8.4A.1

>> If the UE is in WB-S1 mode, if lower layers cannot find a suitable E-UTRA cell connected to 5GCN or there is no suitable E-UTRA cell connected to 5GCN which supports CIoT 5GS optimizations that are supported by the UE, the UE may re-enable the E-UTRA capability, and indicate to lower layers to remain camped in E-UTRA connected to EPC of the previously registered PLMN and proceed with the appropriate EMM procedure.
[('If the UE is in WB-S1 mode', 'if'), ('lower layers cannot find a suitable E-UTRA cell connected to 5GCN', 'if')] ----> the UE may re-enable the E-UTRA capability
>> The UE shall re-enable the E-UTRA capability when performing a PLMN selection unless, the disabling of E-UTRA capability was due to UE initiated detach procedure for EPS services only;
[('when performing a PLMN selection', 'when')] ----> The UE shall re-enable the E-UTRA capability unless , the disabling of E-UTRA capability was due to UE initiated detach procedure for EPS services only
>> The UE shall re-enable the E-UTRA capability when performing a PLMN selection unless, the UE has already re-enabled the E-UTRA capability when performing bullets b
[('when performing a PLMN selection', 'when')] ----> The UE shall re-enable the E-UTRA capability unless , the UE has already re-enabled the E-UTRA capability when performing bullets b
>> If UE that has disabled its E-UTRA capability due to IMS voice not available and CS fallback not available re-enables it when PLMN selection is performed, then it should memorize the identity of the PLMNs where E-UTRA capability was disabled and use that stored information in subsequent PLMN selections as specified in 3GPP TS 23.122 [6].
[('UE that disabled its E-UTRA capability due to IMS voice', 'if'), ('when PLMN selection performed', 'if')] ----> then it should memorize the identity of the PLMNs where E-UTRA capability was disabled
>> If UE that has disabled its E-UTRA capability due to IMS voice not available and CS fallback not available re-enables it when PLMN selection is performed, then it should memorize the identity of the PLMNs where E-UTRA capability was disabled and use that stored information in subsequent PLMN selections as specified in 3GPP TS 23.122 [6].
[('UE that disabled its E-UTRA capability due to IMS voice', 'if'), ('when PLMN selection performed', 'if')] ----> then it should use that stored information in subsequent PLMN selections as specified in 3GPP TS 23.122
>> If the "E-UTRA Disabling Allowed for EMM cause #15" parameter as specified in 3GPP TS 24.368 [15A] or 3GPP TS 31.102 [17] is present and set to enabled and if the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message including both EMM cause #15 "no suitable cells in tracking area" and an Extended EMM cause IE with value "E-UTRAN not allowed", then the UE shall disable the E-UTRA capability, memorize the identity of the PLMN where the E-UTRA capability was disabled and use that stored information in subsequent PLMN selections as specified in 3GPP TS 23.122 [6].
[('the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message including both EMM cause # 15 " no suitable cells in tracking area " and an Extended EMM cause IE with value " E-UTRAN not allowed', 'if'), ('the " E-UTRA Disabling Allowed for EMM cause # 15 " parameter as specified in 3GPP TS 24.368 [ 15A ] or 3GPP TS 31.102 [ 17 ] is present', 'if'), ('the " E-UTRA Disabling Allowed for EMM cause # 15 " parameter as specified in 3GPP TS 24.368 [ 15A ] or 3GPP TS 31.102 [ 17 ] set to enabled', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall memorize the identity of the PLMN where the E-UTRA capability was disabled
>> If the "E-UTRA Disabling Allowed for EMM cause #15" parameter as specified in 3GPP TS 24.368 [15A] or 3GPP TS 31.102 [17] is present and set to enabled and if the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message including both EMM cause #15 "no suitable cells in tracking area" and an Extended EMM cause IE with value "E-UTRAN not allowed", then the UE shall disable the E-UTRA capability, memorize the identity of the PLMN where the E-UTRA capability was disabled and use that stored information in subsequent PLMN selections as specified in 3GPP TS 23.122 [6].
[('the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message including both EMM cause # 15 " no suitable cells in tracking area " and an Extended EMM cause IE with value " E-UTRAN not allowed', 'if'), ('the " E-UTRA Disabling Allowed for EMM cause # 15 " parameter as specified in 3GPP TS 24.368 [ 15A ] or 3GPP TS 31.102 [ 17 ] is present', 'if'), ('the " E-UTRA Disabling Allowed for EMM cause # 15 " parameter as specified in 3GPP TS 24.368 [ 15A ] or 3GPP TS 31.102 [ 17 ] set to enabled', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall disable the E-UTRA capability
>> When the UE supporting the A/Gb and/or Iu mode together with the S1 mode needs to stay in A/Gb or Iu mode, in order to prevent unwanted handover or cell reselection from UTRAN/GERAN to E-UTRAN, the UE shall disable the E-UTRA capability and:

[('When the UE supporting the A/Gb and/or Iu mode together with the S1 mode needs to stay in A/Gb or Iu mode', 'when')] ----> the UE shall disable the E-UTRA capability
>> When the UE supporting the A/Gb and/or Iu mode together with the S1 mode needs to stay in A/Gb or Iu mode, in order to prevent unwanted handover or cell reselection from UTRAN/GERAN to E-UTRAN, the UE shall disable the E-UTRA capability and, the UE NAS layer shall indicate the access stratum layer of disabling of the E-UTRA capability.

>> As an implementation option, the UE may start a timer for enabling E-UTRA when the UE's attach attempt counter or tracking area updating attempt counter reaches 5 and the UE disables E-UTRA capability for cases described in subclauses 5.5.1.2.6, 5.5.1.3.4.3, 5.5.1.3.6, 5.5.3.2.6, 5.5.3.3.4.3 and 5.5.3.3.6.
[("when the UE's attach attempt counter or tracking area updating attempt counter reaches 5", 'when')] ----> As an implementation option the UE may start a timer for enabling E-UTRA
>> On expiry of this timer, if the UE is in Iu mode or A/Gb mode and is in idle mode as specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [13] on expiry of the timer, the UE should enable the E-UTRA capability;
[('the UE is in Iu mode or A/Gb mode', 'if'), ('the UE is in idle mode as specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [ 13 ] on expiring of the timer', 'if')] ----> On expiring of this timer the UE should enable the E-UTRA capability

>> If the UE is configured for eCall only mode as specified in 3GPP TS 31.102 [17] and moves from GERAN/UTRAN to E-UTRAN, the UE shall, if timer T3242 is running, start timer T3444 with the time left on T3242 and stop timer T3242;

>> If the UE is configured for eCall only mode as specified in 3GPP TS 31.102 [17] and moves from GERAN/UTRAN to E-UTRAN, the UE shall, if timer T3243 is running, start timer T3445 with the time left on T3243 and stop timer T3243;
[('If the UE is configured for eCall only mode as specified in 3GPP TS 31.102 [ 17 ] and moves from GERAN/UTRAN to E-UTRAN', 'if'), ('if timer T3243 is running', 'if')] ----> the UE shall start timer T3445 with the time left on T3243
>> If the UE is configured for eCall only mode as specified in 3GPP TS 31.102 [17] and moves from GERAN/UTRAN to E-UTRAN, the UE shall, if timer T3243 is running, start timer T3445 with the time left on T3243 and stop timer T3243;
[('If the UE is configured for eCall only mode as specified in 3GPP TS 31.102 [ 17 ] and moves from GERAN/UTRAN to E-UTRAN', 'if'), ('if timer T3243 is running', 'if')] ----> the UE shall stop timer T3243
>> If the UE is configured for eCall only mode as specified in 3GPP TS 31.102 [17] and moves from GERAN/UTRAN to E-UTRAN, the UE shall, if the UE is attached for both EPS services and non-EPS services and timer T3242 or timer T3243 is running, perform a combined tracking area updating procedure;
[('If the UE is configured for eCall only mode as specified in 3GPP TS 31.102 [ 17 ] and moves from GERAN/UTRAN to E-UTRAN', 'if'), ('if the UE is attached for both EPS services and non - EPS services and timer T3242 or timer T3243 is running', 'if')] ----> the UE shall perform a combined tracking area updating procedure
>> If the UE is configured for eCall only mode as specified in 3GPP TS 31.102 [17] and moves from GERAN/UTRAN to E-UTRAN, the UE shall, if the UE is attached for non-EPS services only and timer T3242 or timer T3243 is running, perform a combined attach procedure.
[('If the UE is configured for eCall only mode as specified in 3GPP TS 31.102 [ 17 ] and moves from GERAN/UTRAN to E-UTRAN', 'if'), ('the UE attached for non - EPS services only', 'if'), ('timer T3242 or timer T3243 running', 'if')] ----> the UE shall perform a combined attach procedure
>> The state EMM-DEREGISTERED is entered in the UE, when, the detach or combined detach is performed either by the UE or by the MME;
[('when , the detach or combined detach is performed either by the UE or by the MME', 'when')] ----> The state EMM-DEREGISTERED entered in the UE
>> The state EMM-DEREGISTERED is entered in the UE, when, the attach request is rejected by the MME;
[('when , the attach request is rejected by the MME', 'when')] ----> The state EMM-DEREGISTERED entered in the UE
>> The state EMM-DEREGISTERED is entered in the UE, when, the tracking area update request is rejected by the MME;
[('when , the tracking area update request is rejected by the MME', 'when')] ----> The state EMM-DEREGISTERED entered in the UE
>> The state EMM-DEREGISTERED is entered in the UE, when, the service request procedure is rejected by the MME;
[('when , the service request procedure is rejected by the MME', 'when')] ----> The state EMM-DEREGISTERED entered in the UE
>> The state EMM-DEREGISTERED is entered in the UE, when, the UE deactivates all EPS bearer contexts locally;
[('when , the UE deactivates all EPS bearer contexts locally', 'when')] ----> The state EMM-DEREGISTERED entered in the UE
>> The state EMM-DEREGISTERED is entered in the UE, when, the UE is switched on;
[('when , the UE is switched on', 'when')] ----> The state EMM-DEREGISTERED entered in the UE
>> The state EMM-DEREGISTERED is entered in the UE, when, an inter-system change from S1 mode to non3GPP access is completed and the non3GPP access network provides PDN connectivity to the same EPC;
[('an inter-system change from S1 mode to non3GPP access completed', 'when'), ('the non3GPP access network provides PDN connectivity to the same EPC', 'when')] ----> The state EMM-DEREGISTERED entered in the UE

[('when the UE attached for emergency bearer services is in EMM-IDLE mode', 'when'), ('its periodic tracking area update timer expires', 'when')] ----> The state EMM-DEREGISTERED entered in the UE
>> When the UE is switched on, the substate shall be PLMN-SEARCH if the USIM is available and valid.
[('When the UE is switched on', 'when'), ('if the USIM is available and valid', 'if')] ----> the substate shall be PLMN-SEARCH
>> if no cell can be selected, the substate shall be NO-CELL-AVAILABLE;
[('if no cell can be selected', 'if')] ----> the substate shall be NO-CELL-AVAILABLE
>> if no USIM is present, the substate shall be NO-IMSI;
[('if no USIM is present', 'if')] ----> the substate shall be NO-IMSI
>> if a suitable cell has been found and the PLMN or tracking area is not in the forbidden list, then the substate shall be NORMAL-SERVICE;
[('a suitable cell found', 'if'), ('the PLMN or tracking area is not in the forbidden list', 'if')] ----> then the substate shall be NORMAL-SERVICE

[('known not to be able to provide normal service', 'if'), ('the selected cell not be able to provide normal service', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall enter the substate LIMITED-SERVICE

>> The UE shall initiate an attach or combined attach procedure if timer T3346 is not running.

[('If timer T3346 is running', 'if')] ----> the UE shall initiate an attach or combined attach procedure on the expiring of timer T3346
>> The UE shall initiate an attach or combined attach procedure when entering a cell which provides normal service.
[('when entering a cell which provides normal service', 'when')] ----> The UE shall initiate an attach or combined attach procedure
>> The UE, shall initiate an attach or combined attach procedure when entering a new PLMN, if timer T3346 is running and the new PLMN is not equivalent to the PLMN where the UE started timer T3346, the PLMN identity of the new cell is not in one of the forbidden PLMN lists and the tracking area is not in one of the lists of forbidden tracking areas;
[('when entering a new PLMN', 'when')] ----> The UE shall initiate an attach or combined attach procedure

>> When the tracking area of the current cell is in the list of tracking areas that the UE previously registered in the MME during the NAS signalling connection establishment, the UE NAS shall provide the lower layers with the S-TMSI, but shall not provide the registered MME identifier to the lower layers;
[('When the tracking area of the current cell is in the list of tracking areas that the UE previously registered in the MME during the NAS signalling connection establishment', 'when')] ----> the UE NAS shall not provide the registered MME identifier to the lower layers
>> When the tracking area of the current cell is in the list of tracking areas that the UE previously registered in the MME during the NAS signalling connection establishment, the UE NAS shall provide the lower layers with the S-TMSI, but shall not provide the registered MME identifier to the lower layers;

>> When the tracking area of the current cell is not in the list of tracking areas that the UE previously registered in the MME during the NAS signalling connection establishment, the UE NAS shall provide the lower layers with the MME identifier part of the valid GUTI with an indication that the identifier is a native GUMMEI.

>> If the TIN indicates "P-TMSI", or the TIN is not available, and the UE holds a valid P-TMSI and RAI, the UE NAS shall provide the lower layers with the MME identifier part of the mapped GUTI, which is generated from the P-TMSI and RAI with an indication that the identifier is a mapped GUMMEI;
