>> In S101 mode, when the cdma2000® HRPD access network resources are available for tunnelled NAS signalling, the UE shall enter EMM-CONNECTED mode and consider the S101 mode NAS signalling connection established.
[('when the cdma2000® HRPD access network resources are available for tunnelled NAS signalling', 'when')] ----> In S101 mode the UE shall consider the S101 mode NAS signalling connection established
>> In S1 mode, when the RRC connection has been released, the UE shall enter EMM-IDLE mode and consider the NAS signalling connection released.
[('when the RRC connection has been released', 'when')] ----> In S1 mode the UE shall enter EMM-IDLE mode
>> In S1 mode, when the RRC connection has been released, the UE shall enter EMM-IDLE mode and consider the NAS signalling connection released.
[('when the RRC connection has been released', 'when')] ----> In S1 mode the UE shall consider the NAS signalling connection released
>> If the UE is configured for eCall only mode as specified in 3GPP TS 31.102 [17] then, if the NAS signalling connection that was released had been established for eCall over IMS, the UE shall start timer T3444;
[('If the UE is configured for eCall only mode as specified in 3GPP TS 31.102 [ 17 ]', 'if'), ('if the NAS signalling connection that was released had been established for eCall over IMS', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall start timer T3444
>> If the UE is configured for eCall only mode as specified in 3GPP TS 31.102 [17] then, if the NAS signalling connection that was released had been established for a call to an HPLMN designated non-emergency MSISDN or URI for test or terminal reconfiguration service, the UE shall start timer T3445.
[('If the UE is configured for eCall only mode as specified in 3GPP TS 31.102 [ 17 ]', 'if'), ('if the NAS signalling connection that was released had been established for a call to an HPLMN designated non-emergency MSISDN or URI for test or terminal reconfiguration service', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall start timer T3445
>> The UE shall start the SGC timer T3447 with the service gap time value available in the UE when the NAS signalling connection is released if, the UE supports SGC feature, and the service gap timer value is available in the UE and does not indicate zero;
[('when the NAS signalling connection is released if', 'when')] ----> The UE shall start the SGC timer T3447 with the service gap time value available in the UE
>> The UE shall start the SGC timer T3447 with the service gap time value available in the UE when the NAS signalling connection is released if, the NAS signalling connection that was released had been established for mobile originated request for transfer of uplink data.
[('when the NAS signalling connection is released', 'when'), ('if , the NAS signalling connection that was released had been established for mobile originated request for transfer of uplink data', 'if')] ----> The UE shall start the SGC timer T3447 with the service gap time value available in the UE
>> If the UE receives the "Extended wait time" from the lower layers when no attach, tracking area updating or service request procedure is ongoing, the UE shall ignore the "Extended wait time".
[('If the UE receives the " Extended wait time " from the lower layers when no attach , tracking area updating or service request procedure is ongoing', 'if')] ----> the UE shall ignore the " Extended wait time "
>> To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection, the UE, shall start the timer T3440 if the UE receives any of the EMM cause values #11, #12, #13, #14, #15, #25, #31 or #35;
[('if the UE receives any of the EMM cause values # 11 , # 12 , # 13 , # 14 , # 15 , # 25 , # 31 or # 35', 'if')] ----> To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection the UE shall start the timer T3440
>> To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection, the UE, shall start the timer T3440 if, the UE receives a TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message which does not include a UE radio capability ID deletion indication IE;
[('if , the UE receives a TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message which does not include a UE radio capability ID deletion indication IE', 'if')] ----> To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection the UE shall start the timer T3440
>> To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection, the UE, shall start the timer T3440 if, the UE has not set the "active" flag in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message;
[('if , the UE has not set the " active " flag in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message', 'if')] ----> To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection the UE shall start the timer T3440
>> To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection, the UE, shall start the timer T3440 if, the UE has not set the "signalling active" flag in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message;
[('if , the UE has not set the " signalling active " flag in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message', 'if')] ----> To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection the UE shall start the timer T3440
>> To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection, the UE, shall start the timer T3440 if, the tracking area updating or combined tracking area updating procedure has been initiated in EMM-IDLE mode;
[('if , the tracking area updating or combined tracking area updating procedure has been initiated in EMM-IDLE mode', 'if')] ----> To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection the UE , shall start the timer T3440
>> To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection, the UE, shall start the timer T3440 if, the user plane radio bearers have not been set up;
[('if , the user plane radio bearers have not been set up', 'if')] ----> To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection the UE shall start the timer T3440
>> To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection, the UE, shall start the timer T3440 if the UE receives a DETACH ACCEPT message and the UE has set the detach type to "IMSI detach" in the DETACH REQUEST message and user plane radio bearers have not been set up;
[('if the UE receives a DETACH ACCEPT message and the UE has set the detach type to " IMSI detach " in the DETACH REQUEST message and user plane radio bearers have not been set up', 'if')] ----> To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection the UE shall start the timer T3440
>> To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection, the UE, shall start the timer T3440 if the UE receives a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message indicating, any of the EMM cause values #9 or #10 and the UE has no CS fallback emergency call, CS fallback call, 1xCS fallback emergency call, or 1xCS fallback call pending;
[('if the UE receives a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message indicating , any of the EMM cause values # 9 or # 10', 'if')] ----> To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection the UE , shall start the timer T3440 has no CS fallback emergency call , CS fallback
>> To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection, the UE, shall start the timer T3440 if the UE receives a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message indicating, the EMM cause values #40, the TRACKING AREA UPDATE message was not triggered due to receiving a paging for CS fallback or a paging for 1xCS fallback, and the UE has no CS fallback emergency call, CS fallback call, 1xCS fallback emergency call, or 1xCS fallback call pending;
[('if the UE receives a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message indicating , the EMM cause values # 40', 'if')] ----> To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection the UE , shall start the timer T3440
>> To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection, the UE, shall start the timer T3440 if the UE receives a SERVICE REJECT message indicating any of the EMM cause values #9, #10 or #40 as a response to a SERVICE REQUEST message CONTROL PLANE SERVICE REQUEST message, or an EXTENDED SERVICE REQUEST message with service type set to "packet services via S1";
[('the UE receives a SERVICE REJECT message indicating any of the EMM cause values # 9 , # 10 or # 40', 'if')] ----> To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection the UE shall start the timer T3440
>> To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection, the UE, shall start the timer T3440 if the UE receives a SERVICE REJECT message indicating any of the EMM cause values #9, #10 or #40 as a response to a SERVICE REQUEST message CONTROL PLANE SERVICE REQUEST message, or an EXTENDED SERVICE REQUEST message with service type set to "packet services via S1";
[('service type set to " packet services via S1', 'if')] ----> To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection the UE shall start the timer T3440
>> To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection, the UE, may start the timer T3440 if the UE receives any of the EMM cause values #3, #6, #7 or #8 or if it receives an AUTHENTICATION REJECT message;
[('the UE receives any of the EMM cause values # 3 , # 6 , # 7 or # 8', 'if')] ----> To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection the UE may start the timer T3440
>> To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection, the UE, may start the timer T3440 if the UE receives any of the EMM cause values #3, #6, #7 or #8 or if it receives an AUTHENTICATION REJECT message;
[('it receives an AUTHENTICATION REJECT message', 'if')] ----> To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection the UE may start the timer T3440
>> To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection, the UE, shall start the timer T3440 if the UE receives a SERVICE REJECT message indicating the EMM cause value #39 and the UE has initiated EXTENDED SERVICE REQUEST in EMM-IDLE and the user plane radio bearers have not been set up;
[('if the UE receives a SERVICE REJECT message indicating the EMM cause value # 39 and the UE has initiated EXTENDED SERVICE REQUEST in EMM-IDLE and the user plane radio bearers have not been set up', 'if')] ----> To allow the network to release the NAS signalling connection the UE shall start the timer T3440

>> Upon expiry of T3440, in cases a, b, c, f and h, the UE shall locally release the established NAS signalling connection;
[('Upon expiring of T3440', 'upon')] ----> in cases a , b , c , f and h the UE shall locally release the established NAS signalling connection
>> Upon expiry of T3440, in cases d and e, the UE shall locally release the established NAS signalling connection and the UE shall initiate the attach procedure as described in subclause 5.5.3.2.5, 5.5.3.3.5 or 5.6.1.5.
[('Upon expiring', 'upon')] ----> in cases d and e the UE shall locally release the established NAS signalling connection

>> In case b, upon receiving a request from upper layers to send NAS signalling not associated with establishing either a CS emergency call or a PDN connection for emergency bearer services, the UE shall wait for the the local release of the established NAS signalling connection upon expiry of timer T3440 or T3440 being stopped before proceeding;

>> Upon trigger of a procedure using an initial NAS message when in EMM-IDLE mode with suspend indication, the UE shall, if the initial NAS message is a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message which includes a UE radio capability information update needed IE, enter EMM-IDLE mode without suspend indication and proceed with the tracking area updating procedure;
[('if the initial NAS message is a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message which includes a UE radio capability information update needed IE', 'if')] ----> Upon trigger of a procedure using an initial NAS message when in EMM-IDLE mode with suspend indication the UE shall proceed with the tracking area updating procedure
>> Upon trigger of a procedure using an initial NAS message when in EMM-IDLE mode with suspend indication, the UE shall, if the initial NAS message is a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message which includes a UE radio capability information update needed IE, enter EMM-IDLE mode without suspend indication and proceed with the tracking area updating procedure;

>> Upon trigger of a procedure using an initial NAS message when in EMM-IDLE mode with suspend indication, the UE shall, otherwise, request the lower layer to resume the RRC connection.
[('Upon trigger of a procedure using an initial NAS message when in EMM-IDLE mode with suspend indication', 'upon')] ----> the UE shall otherwise request the lower layer to resume the RRC connection
>> If the pending NAS message is, the message shall not be sent.
[('If the pending NAS message is', 'if')] ----> the message shall not sent
>> Otherwise the UE shall cipher the message as specified in subclause 4.4.5 and send the pending initial NAS message upon entering EMM-CONNECTED mode;
[('upon entering EMM-CONNECTED mode', 'upon')] ----> Otherwise the UE shall send the pending initial NAS message
>> Upon fallback indication from the lower layers at RRC connection resume when in EMM-IDLE mode with suspend indication, the UE shall enter EMM-IDLE mode without suspend indication, send any pending initial NAS message and proceed as if RRC connection establishment had been requested;
[('Upon fallback indication from the lower layers at RRC connection resume when in EMM-IDLE mode with suspend indication', 'upon')] ----> the UE shall send any pending initial NAS message
>> Upon fallback indication from the lower layers at RRC connection resume when in EMM-IDLE mode with suspend indication, the UE shall enter EMM-IDLE mode without suspend indication, send any pending initial NAS message and proceed as if RRC connection establishment had been requested;
[('when in EMM-IDLE mode with suspend indication', 'when')] ----> Upon fallback indication from the lower layers at RRC connection resume the UE shall enter EMM-IDLE mode without suspend indication
>> Upon fallback indication from the lower layers at RRC connection resume when in EMM-IDLE mode with suspend indication, the UE shall enter EMM-IDLE mode without suspend indication, send any pending initial NAS message and proceed as if RRC connection establishment had been requested;
[('Upon fallback indication from the lower layers at RRC connection resume when in EMM-IDLE mode with suspend indication', 'upon')] ----> the UE shall proceed as if RRC connection establishment had been requested
>> Upon indication from the lower layers that the RRC connection resume has failed and indication from the lower layers that the RRC connection is suspended, the UE shall enter EMM-IDLE mode with suspend indication and restart the ongoing NAS procedure if required;
[('if required', 'if')] ----> Upon indication from the lower layers that the RRC connection resume has failed and indication from the lower layers that the RRC connection is suspended the UE shall restart the ongoing NAS procedure
>> Upon indication from the lower layers that the RRC connection resume has failed and indication from the lower layers that the RRC connection is not suspended, the UE shall enter EMM-IDLE mode without suspend indication and restart the ongoing NAS procedure if required.
[('if required', 'if')] ----> Upon indication from the lower layers that the RRC connection resume has failed and indication from the lower layers that the RRC connection is not suspended the UE shall restart the ongoing NAS procedure
>> These lists shall be erased when the UE is switched off or when the UICC containing the USIM is removed, and periodically.
[('when the UE switched', 'when'), ('when the UICC containing the USIM removed', 'when')] ----> These lists shall erased
>> When the lists are erased, the UE performs cell selection according to 3GPP TS 36.304 [21].
[('When the lists are erased', 'when')] ----> the UE performs cell selection according to 3GPP TS 36.304 [ 21 ]
>> One or more tracking areas is removed from the list of "forbidden tracking areas for roaming" in the UE, as well as the list of "forbidden tracking areas for regional provision of service" if, after a subsequent procedure e.g. attach procedure, tracking area updating procedure and GUTI reallocation procedure, one or more tracking areas in the lists is received from the network.
[('if , after a subsequent procedure e.g . attach procedure , tracking area updating procedure and GUTI reallocation procedure , one or more tracking areas in the lists is received from the network', 'if')] ----> One or more tracking areas removed from the list of " forbidden tracking areas for roaming " in the UE , as well as the list of " forbidden tracking areas for regional provision of service "
>> If the UE has only one PDN connection established which is for emergency bearer services, the tracking areas shall not be removed from these lists if one or more tracking areas in the lists are received from the network.
[('If the UE has only one PDN connection established which is for emergency bearer services', 'if'), ('if one or more tracking areas in the lists are received from the network', 'if')] ----> the tracking areas shall not removed from these lists
>> When the list is full and a new entry has to be inserted, the oldest entry shall be deleted.
[('the list is full', 'when'), ('a new entry inserted', 'when')] ----> the oldest entry shall deleted
>> The UE shall erase this list when the UE is switched off or when the USIM is removed.
[('when the USIM removed', 'when')] ----> The UE shall erase this list
>> The UE shall erase this list when the UE is switched off or when the USIM is removed.
[('when the UE switched', 'when')] ----> The UE shall erase this list
>> When the list is full and a new PLMN identity has to be inserted, the UE shall delete the oldest PLMN identity.
[('the list is full', 'when'), ('a new PLMN identity inserted', 'when')] ----> the UE shall delete the oldest PLMN identity
>> When the UE is switched off, it shall keep the stored list so that it can be used for PLMN selection after switch on.
[('When the UE is switched off', 'when')] ----> it shall keep the stored list so that it can be used for PLMN selection after switch on
>> The UE shall delete the stored list if the USIM is removed or when the UE attached for emergency bearer services or access to RLOS enters the state EMM-DEREGISTERED.
[('if the USIM is removed or when the UE attached for emergency bearer services or access to RLOS enters the state EMM-DEREGISTERED', 'if')] ----> The UE shall delete the stored list
>> If timer T3412 received by the UE in an ATTACH ACCEPT or TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message contains an indication that the timer is deactivated or the timer value is zero, then timer T3412 is deactivated and the UE shall not perform the periodic tracking area updating procedure.
[('If timer T3412 received by the UE in an ATTACH ACCEPT or TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT', 'if')] ----> message contains an indication that the timer is deactivated or the timer value is zero
>> Timer T3412 is reset and started with its initial value, when the UE changes from EMM-CONNECTED to EMM-IDLE mode.
[('when the UE changes from EMM-CONNECTED to EMM-IDLE mode', 'when')] ----> Timer T3412 started with its initial value ,
>> Timer T3412 is stopped when the UE enters EMM-CONNECTED mode or the EMM-DEREGISTERED state.
[('when the UE enters EMM-CONNECTED mode or the EMM-DEREGISTERED state', 'when')] ----> Timer T3412 stopped
>> If the UE is attached for emergency bearer services, and timer T3412 expires, the UE shall not initiate a periodic tracking area updating procedure, but shall locally detach from the network.
[('the UE attached for emergency bearer services', 'if'), ('timer T3412 expires', 'if')] ----> the UE shall locally detach from the network
>> If the UE is attached for emergency bearer services, and timer T3412 expires, the UE shall not initiate a periodic tracking area updating procedure, but shall locally detach from the network.
[('the UE attached for emergency bearer services', 'if'), ('timer T3412 expires', 'if')] ----> the UE shall not initiate a periodic tracking area updating procedure
>> When the UE is camping on a suitable cell, it may re-attach to regain normal service.
[('When the UE is camping on a suitable cell', 'when')] ----> it may re-attach to regain normal service
>> If the UE is not attached for emergency bearer services, and is in a state other than EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE when timer T3412 expires, the periodic tracking area updating procedure is delayed until the UE returns to EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE.
[('the UE not attached for emergency bearer services', 'if'), ('the UE is in a state other than EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE when timer T3412 expires', 'if')] ----> the periodic tracking area updating procedure delayed until the UE returns to EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE
>> If ISR is activated, the UE shall keep both timer T3412 and timer T3312.
[('If ISR is activated', 'if')] ----> the UE shall keep both timer T3412 and timer T3312
>> The UE shall start timer T3423, if timer T3412 expires, and timer T3346 is running or the UE is in:
[('timer T3412 expires', 'if')] ----> The UE shall start timer T3423
>> The UE shall start timer T3423, if timer T3412 expires, and timer T3346 is running or the UE is in:
[('timer T3346 running', 'if')] ----> The UE shall start timer T3423
>> The UE shall start timer T3423, if timer T3412 expires, and timer T3346 is running or the UE is in:
[('the UE is in', 'if')] ----> The UE shall start timer T3423
>> The UE shall initiate the tracking area updating procedure and stop timer T3423 when it enters state EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE before timer T3423 expires.
[('when it enters state EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE before timer T3423 expires', 'when')] ----> The UE shall stop timer T3423
>> If timer T3423 expires the UE shall memorize that it has to initiate a tracking area updating procedure when it returns to state EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE.
[('If timer T3423 expires', 'if')] ----> the UE shall memorize that it has to initiate a tracking area updating procedure when it returns to state EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE
>> If the UE is attached to both EPS and non-EPS services, and if timer T3412 expires or timer T3423 expires when the UE is in EMM-REGISTERED.NO-CELL-AVAILABLE state, then the UE shall initiate the combined tracking area updating procedure indicating "combined TA/LA updating with IMSI attach" when the UE returns to EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE state.
[('when the UE returns to EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE state', 'when'), ('timer T3412 expires', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall initiate the combined tracking area updating procedure indicating " combined TA/LA updating with IMSI attach "
>> If the UE is attached to both EPS and non-EPS services, and if timer T3412 expires or timer T3423 expires when the UE is in EMM-REGISTERED.NO-CELL-AVAILABLE state, then the UE shall initiate the combined tracking area updating procedure indicating "combined TA/LA updating with IMSI attach" when the UE returns to EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE state.
[('when the UE returns to EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE state', 'when'), ('timer T3423 expires when the UE is in EMM-REGISTERED.NO-CELL-AVAILABLE state', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall initiate the combined tracking area updating procedure indicating " combined TA/LA updating with IMSI attach "
>> If the UE is attached to both EPS and non-EPS services, and if timer T3412 expires or timer T3423 expires when the UE is in EMM-REGISTERED.NO-CELL-AVAILABLE state, then the UE shall initiate the combined tracking area updating procedure indicating "combined TA/LA updating with IMSI attach" when the UE returns to EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE state.
[('when the UE returns to EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE state', 'when'), ('the UE attached to both EPS and non - EPS services', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall initiate the combined tracking area updating procedure indicating " combined TA/LA updating with IMSI attach "
>> When the network includes T3412 extended value IE in the ATTACH ACCEPT message or TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message, the network uses timer T3412 extended value IE as the value of timer T3412.
[('When the network includes T3412 extended value IE in the ATTACH ACCEPT message or TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message', 'when')] ----> the network uses timer T3412 extended value IE as the value of timer T3412
>> The network supervises the periodic tracking area updating procedure of the UE by means of the mobile reachable timer.
[('by means of the mobile reachable timer', 'by')] ----> The network supervises the periodic tracking area updating procedure of the UE
>> If the UE is not attached for emergency bearer services, the mobile reachable timer shall be longer than T3412.
[('If the UE is not attached for emergency bearer services', 'if')] ----> the mobile reachable timer shall be longer than T3412
>> If ISR is not activated, the network behaviour upon expiry of the mobile reachable timer is network dependent, but typically the network stops sending paging messages to the UE on the first expiry, and may take other appropriate actions.
[('If ISR is not activated', 'if')] ----> the network behaviour upon expiring of the mobile reachable timer is network dependent
>> If the UE is attached for emergency bearer services, the MME shall set the mobile reachable timer with a value equal to timer T3412.
[('If the UE is attached for emergency bearer services', 'if')] ----> the MME shall set the mobile reachable timer with a value equal to timer T3412
>> When the mobile reachable timer expires, the MME shall locally detach the UE.
[('When the mobile reachable timer expires', 'when')] ----> the MME shall locally detach the UE
>> The mobile reachable timer shall be reset and started with the value as indicated above, when the MME releases the NAS signalling connection for the UE.
[('when the MME releases the NAS signalling connection for the UE', 'when')] ----> The mobile reachable timer shall reset with the value as indicated above
>> The mobile reachable timer shall be reset and started with the value as indicated above, when the MME releases the NAS signalling connection for the UE.
[('when the MME releases the NAS signalling connection for the UE', 'when')] ----> The mobile reachable timer shall started with the value as indicated above
>> The mobile reachable timer shall be stopped when a NAS signalling connection is established for the UE.
[('when a NAS signalling connection is established for the UE', 'when')] ----> The mobile reachable timer shall stopped
>> Upon expiry of the mobile reachable timer the network shall start the implicit detach timer.
[('Upon expiring of the mobile reachable timer', 'upon')] ----> the network shall start the implicit detach timer
>> If ISR is activated, the default value of the implicit detach timer is 4 minutes greater than timer T3423.
[('If ISR is activated', 'if')] ----> the default value of the implicit detach timer is 4 minutes greater than timer T3423
>> If the implicit detach timer expires before the UE contacts the network, the network shall implicitly detach the UE.
[('If the implicit detach timer expires before the UE contacts the network', 'if')] ----> the network shall implicitly detach the UE
>> If the MME includes timer T3346 in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message or the SERVICE REJECT message and timer T3346 is greater than timer T3412, the MME sets the mobile reachable timer and the implicit detach timer such that the sum of the timer values is greater than timer T3346.
[('If the MME includes timer T3346 in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT message or the SERVICE REJECT message and timer T3346 is greater than timer T3412', 'if')] ----> the MME sets the mobile reachable timer and the implicit detach timer such that the sum of the timer values is greater than timer T3346
>> If the network includes the T3324 value IE in the ATTACH ACCEPT message or TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message,and if the UE is not attached for emergency bearer services and has no PDN connection for emergency bearer services the MME shall set the active timer to a value equal to the value of timer T3324.
[('the UE not attached for emergency bearer services', 'if'), ('the UE has no PDN connection for emergency bearer services', 'if')] ----> If the network includes the T3324 value IE in the ATTACH ACCEPT message or TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message,and the MME shall set the active timer to a value equal to the value of timer T3324
>> If the UE has established a PDN connection for emergency services after receiving the timer T3324 value IE in the ATTACH ACCEPT message or the last TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message, the active timer shall not be started.
[('If the UE has established a PDN connection for emergency services after receiving the timer T3324 value IE in the ATTACH ACCEPT message or the last TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message', 'if')] ----> the active timer shall not started
>> The active timer shall be reset and started with the value as indicated above, when the MME releases the NAS signalling connection for the UE.
[('when the MME releases the NAS signalling connection for the UE', 'when')] ----> The active timer shall be reset and started with the value as indicated above
>> The active timer shall be stopped when an NAS signalling connection is established for the UE.
[('when an NAS signalling connection is established for the UE', 'when')] ----> The active timer shall stopped
>> The implicit detach timer shall be stopped when a NAS signalling connection is established for the UE.
[('when a NAS signalling connection is established for the UE', 'when')] ----> The implicit detach timer shall stopped
>> If the value is different from "deactivated", the UE shall apply this value in all tracking areas of the list of tracking areas assigned to the UE, until a new value is received.
[('If the value is different from " deactivated "', 'if')] ----> the UE shall apply this value in all tracking areas of the list of tracking areas assigned to the UE until a new value is received
>> If an ATTACH REJECT message including timer T3402 value different from "deactivated", was received integrity protected, the UE shall apply this value until a new value is received with integrity protection or a new PLMN is selected.
[('If an ATTACH REJECT message including timer T3402 value different from " deactivated " , was received integrity protected', 'if')] ----> the UE shall apply this value until a new value is received with integrity protection or a new PLMN is selected
>> The default value of T3402 is also used by the UE if, the network indicates that the timer is "deactivated";
[('if , the network indicates that the timer is " deactivated "', 'if')] ----> The default value of T3402 also used by the UE
>> The default value of T3402 is also used by the UE if, the UE does not have a stored value for this timer;
[('if , the UE does not have a stored value for this timer', 'if')] ----> The default value of T3402 also used by the UE
>> The default value of T3402 is also used by the UE if, a new PLMN which is not in the list of equivalent PLMNs has been entered, the tracking area updating fails and the tracking area updating attempt counter is equal to 5;
[('a new PLMN which is not in the list of equivalent PLMNs entered', 'if'), ('the tracking area updating', 'if'), ('the tracking area updating attempt counter is equal to 5', 'if')] ----> The default value of T3402 also used by the UE
>> The default value of T3402 is also used by the UE if, a new PLMN which is not in the list of equivalent PLMNs has been entered, the attach procedure fails, the attach attempt counter is equal to 5 and no ATTACH REJECT message was received from the new PLMN.
[('a new PLMN which is not in the list of equivalent PLMNs entered', 'if'), ('the attach procedure fails', 'if'), ('the attach attempt counter is equal to 5', 'if'), ('no ATTACH REJECT message received from the new PLMN', 'if')] ----> The default value of T3402 also used by the UE
>> The Local Emergency Numbers List can be updated with EMM procedures if the UE is in S1 mode, with GMM and MM procedures if the UE is in A/Gb or Iu mode, and with 5GMM procedures, as specified in 3GPP TS 24.501 [54], if UE is in N1 mode.
[('if UE is in N1 mode', 'if')] ----> The Local Emergency Numbers List can updated with EMM procedures if the UE is in S1 mode , with GMM and MM procedures if the UE is in A/Gb or Iu mode , and with 5GMM procedures , as specified in 3GPP TS 24.501 [ 54 ] ,
>> The Extended Local Emergency Numbers List can be updated with EMM procedures if the UE is in S1 mode and with 5GMM procedures, as specified in 3GPP TS 24.501 [54], if UE is in N1 mode.
[('if the UE is in S1 mode and with 5GMM procedures', 'if'), ('if UE is in N1 mode', 'if')] ----> The Extended Local Emergency Numbers List can updated with EMM procedures as specified in 3GPP TS 24.501 [ 54 ]
>> If the UE determines that the number dialled is an emergency number, the procedures specified in 3GPP TS 23.167 [45] and 3GPP TS 24.229 [13D] are utilised to select a domain for the emergency session attempt.
[('If the UE determines that the number dialled is an emergency number', 'if')] ----> the procedures specified in 3GPP TS 23.167 [ 45 ] and 3GPP TS 24.229 [ 13D ] utilised to select a domain for the emergency session attempt
>> If the domain selected for the emergency session attempt is the PS domain, then the UE shall perform the session establishment procedures specified in 3GPP TS 24.229 [13D] to initiate an emergency session.
[('If the domain selected for the emergency session attempt is the PS domain', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall perform the session establishment procedures specified in 3GPP TS 24.229 [ 13D ] to initiate an emergency session
>> If the domain selected for the emergency session attempt is the CS domain, then the UE shall use the stored Local Emergency Numbers List, in addition to the emergency numbers stored on the USIM and the ME, to determine if, the UE is to send an EXTENDED SERVICE REQUEST message, for CS fallback, indicating "mobile originating CS fallback or 1xCS fallback";
[('If the domain selected for the emergency session attempt is the CS domain', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall use the stored Local Emergency Numbers List , in addition to the emergency numbers stored on the USIM and the ME to determine if , the UE is to send an EXTENDED SERVICE REQUEST message , for CS fallback , indicating " mobile originating CS fallback or 1x CS fallback "
>> If the domain selected for the emergency session attempt is the CS domain, then the UE shall use the stored Local Emergency Numbers List, in addition to the emergency numbers stored on the USIM and the ME, to determine if, the UE is to send an EXTENDED SERVICE REQUEST message, for CS fallback for emergency call, indicating "mobile originating CS fallback emergency call or 1xCS fallback emergency call";
[('If the domain selected for the emergency session attempt is the CS domain', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall use the stored Local Emergency Numbers List , in addition to the emergency numbers stored on the USIM and the ME to determine if , the UE is to send an EXTENDED SERVICE REQUEST message , for CS fallback for emergency call , indicating " mobile originating CS fallback emergency call or 1x CS fallback emergency call "
>> If the domain selected for the emergency session attempt is the CS domain, then the UE shall use the stored Local Emergency Numbers List, in addition to the emergency numbers stored on the USIM and the ME, to determine if, the call control entity of the UE specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [13] is to send an EMERGENCY SETUP message or a SETUP message to the network.
[('If the domain selected for the emergency session attempt is the CS domain', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall use the stored Local Emergency Numbers List , in addition to the emergency numbers stored on the USIM and the ME to determine if , the call control entity of the UE specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [ 13 ] is to send an EMERGENCY SETUP message or a SETUP message to the network
>> If no Local Emergency Numbers List is contained in the ATTACH ACCEPT or in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message, then the stored Local Emergency Numbers List in the user equipment shall be kept, except if the user equipment has successfully registered to a PLMN in a country different from that of the PLMN that sent the list.
[('If no Local Emergency Numbers List is contained in the ATTACH ACCEPT or in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message', 'if')] ----> then the stored Local Emergency Numbers List in the user equipment shall kept except if the user equipment has successfully registered to a PLMN in a country different from that of the PLMN that sent the list
>> The emergency number received in the Extended emergency number list IE are valid only in, networks in the same country as the PLMN from which this IE is received, if the Extended Emergency Number List Validity field within the Extended emergency number list IE indicates "Extended Local Emergency Numbers List is valid in the country of the PLMN from which this IE is received";
[('if the Extended Emergency Number List Validity field within the Extended emergency number list IE indicates " Extended Local Emergency Numbers List is valid in the country of the PLMN from which this IE is received "', 'if')] ----> The emergency number received in the Extended emergency number list IE are valid only in , networks in the same country as the PLMN from which this IE is received
>> The emergency number received in the Extended emergency number list IE are valid only in, the PLMN from which this IE is received, if the EENLV field within the Extended emergency number list IE indicates "Extended Local Emergency Numbers List is valid only in the PLMN from which this IE is received".
[('if the EENLV field within the Extended emergency number list IE indicates " Extended Local Emergency Numbers List is valid only in the PLMN from which this IE is received "', 'if')] ----> The emergency number received in the Extended emergency number list IE are valid only in , the PLMN from which this IE is received
>> If no Extended Local Emergency Numbers List is contained in the ATTACH ACCEPT or in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message, and the registered PLMN has not changed, then the stored Extended Local Emergency Numbers List in the user equipment shall be kept.
[('If no Extended Local Emergency Numbers List is contained in the ATTACH ACCEPT or in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message , and the registered PLMN has not changed', 'if')] ----> then the stored Extended Local Emergency Numbers List in the user equipment shall kept
>> If no Extended Local Emergency Numbers List is contained in the ATTACH ACCEPT or in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message, but the registered PLMN has changed, then, if the last received indication in the EENLV field within the Extended emergency number list IE indicates "Extended Local Emergency Numbers List is valid in the country of the PLMN from which this IE is received" the list shall be kept except if the user equipment has successfully registered to a PLMN in a country different from that of the PLMN that sent the list.
[('if the last received indication in the EENLV field within the Extended emergency number list', 'if')] ----> IE indicates " Extended Local Emergency Numbers List is valid in the country of the PLMN from which this IE is received "
>> When the UE adds a PLMN identity to the "forbidden PLMN list", the "forbidden PLMNs for attach in S101 mode" list, or the "forbidden PLMNs for GPRS service" list or sets the USIM as invalid for non-EPS services or EPS services or both, and timer T3245 is not running, the UE shall start timer T3245 as specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [13], subclause 4.1.1.6.
[('forbidden PLMNs', 'when'), ('timer T3245 not running', 'when'), ('forbidden PLMNs', 'when')] ----> the UE shall start timer T3245 as specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [ 13 ] , subclause 4.1.1.6
>> When the UE adds a PLMN identity to the "forbidden PLMN list", the "forbidden PLMNs for attach in S101 mode" list, or the "forbidden PLMNs for GPRS service" list or sets the USIM as invalid for non-EPS services or EPS services or both, and timer T3245 is not running, the UE shall start timer T3245 as specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [13], subclause 4.1.1.6.
[('forbidden PLMNs', 'when'), ('timer T3245 not running', 'when'), ('When the UE adds a PLMN identity to the " forbidden PLMN list "', 'when')] ----> the UE shall start timer T3245 as specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [ 13 ] , subclause 4.1.1.6
>> Upon expiry of the timer T3245, the UE shall erase the "forbidden PLMN list", the "forbidden PLMNs for GPRS service" list, and the "forbidden PLMNs for attach in S101 mode" list and set the USIM to valid for non-EPS and EPS services.
[('Upon expiring of the timer T3245', 'upon')] ----> the UE shall erase the " forbidden PLMN list " , the " forbidden PLMNs for GPRS service " list , and the " forbidden PLMNs for attach in S101 mode " list
>> Upon expiry of the timer T3245, the UE shall erase the "forbidden PLMN list", the "forbidden PLMNs for GPRS service" list, and the "forbidden PLMNs for attach in S101 mode" list and set the USIM to valid for non-EPS and EPS services.
[('Upon expiring of the timer T3245', 'upon')] ----> the UE shall set the USIM to valid for non-EPS and EPS services
>> If the UE is switched off when the timer T3245 is running, the UE shall behave as follows when the UE is switched on and the USIM in the UE remains the same:
[('If the UE is switched off when the timer T3245 is running', 'if'), ('the UE switched', 'when'), ('the USIM in the UE remains the same', 'when')] ----> the UE shall behave as follows
>> If t1 is greater than t, then the timer shall be restarted with the value t1 – t. If t1 is equal to or less than t, then the UE will follow the behaviour as defined in the paragraph above upon expiry of the timer T3245.
[('upon expiring of the timer T3245', 'upon'), ('If t1 is equal to or less than t', 'if')] ----> then the UE will follow the behaviour as defined in the paragraph above
>> If t1 is greater than t, then the timer shall be restarted with the value t1 – t. If t1 is equal to or less than t, then the UE will follow the behaviour as defined in the paragraph above upon expiry of the timer T3245.
[('If t1 is greater than t', 'if')] ----> then the timer shall restarted with the value t1 – t
>> If the UE is not capable of determining t, then the UE shall restart the timer with the value t1.
[('If the UE is not capable of determining t', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall restart the timer with the value t1
>> If the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT, TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT or SERVICE REJECT message without integrity protection with EMM cause value #3, #6, #7, #8, #11, #12, #13, #14, #15, #31 or #35 before the network has established secure exchange of NAS messages for the NAS signalling connection, the UE shall start timer T3247 with a random value uniformly drawn from the range between 30 minutes and 60 minutes, if the timer is not running.
[('if the timer is not running', 'if'), ('the network established secure exchange of NAS messages', 'if')] ----> for the NAS signalling connection the UE shall start timer T3247 with a random value uniformly drawn from the range between 30 minutes and 60 minutes
>> If the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT, TRACKING AREA UPDATE REJECT or SERVICE REJECT message without integrity protection with EMM cause value #3, #6, #7, #8, #11, #12, #13, #14, #15, #31 or #35 before the network has established secure exchange of NAS messages for the NAS signalling connection, the UE shall start timer T3247 with a random value uniformly drawn from the range between 30 minutes and 60 minutes, if the timer is not running.
[('if the timer is not running', 'if'), ('the UE receives an ATTACH REJECT', 'if')] ----> for the NAS signalling connection the UE shall start timer T3247 with a random value uniformly drawn from the range between 30 minutes and 60 minutes
>> if the EMM cause value received is #3, #6, #7 or #8, and if the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services" events and the counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value, the UE shall, set the EPS update status to EU3 ROAMING NOT ALLOWED and shall delete any GUTI, last visited registered TAI, TAI list and eKSI;
[('the EMM cause value received is # 3 , # 6 , # 7 or # 8', 'if'), ('the UE maintains a counter for " SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services " events', 'if'), ('the counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value', 'if')] ----> the UE shall set the EPS update status to EU3 ROAMING NOT ALLOWED
>> if the EMM cause value received is #3, #6, #7 or #8, and if the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services" events and the counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value, the UE shall, set the EPS update status to EU3 ROAMING NOT ALLOWED and shall delete any GUTI, last visited registered TAI, TAI list and eKSI;
[('the EMM cause value received is # 3 , # 6 , # 7 or # 8', 'if'), ('the UE maintains a counter for " SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services " events', 'if'), ('the counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value', 'if')] ----> the UE shall delete any GUTI , last visited registered TAI , TAI list and eKSI
>> if the EMM cause value received is #3, #6, #7 or #8, and if the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services" events and the counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value, the UE shall, delete the list of equivalent PLMNs;
[('the EMM cause value received is # 3 , # 6 , # 7 or # 8', 'if'), ('the UE maintains a counter for " SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services " events', 'if'), ('the counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value', 'if')] ----> the UE shall delete the list of equivalent PLMNs
>> if the EMM cause value received is #3, #6, #7 or #8, and if the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services" events and the counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value, the UE shall, increment the counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services" events;
[('the EMM cause value received is # 3 , # 6 , # 7 or # 8', 'if'), ('the UE maintains a counter for " SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services " events', 'if'), ('the counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value', 'if')] ----> the UE shall increment the counter for " SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services " events
>> if the EMM cause value received is #3, #6, #7 or #8, and if the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services" events and the counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value, the UE shall, if an attach or tracking area updating procedure was performed, reset the attach attempt counter or the tracking area updating attempt counter, respectively;
[('if an attach or tracking area updating procedure was performed', 'if'), ('the EMM cause value received is # 3 , # 6 , # 7 or # 8', 'if'), ('the UE maintains a counter for " SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services " events', 'if'), ('the counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value', 'if')] ----> the UE shall reset the attach attempt counter or the tracking area updating attempt counter respectively
>> if the EMM cause value received is #3, #6, #7 or #8, and if the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services" events and the counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value, the UE shall, if A/Gb mode or Iu mode is supported by the UE, handle the GMM parameters GPRS attach attempt counter or routing area updating attempt counter, GMM state, GPRS update status, P-TMSI, P-TMSI signature, RAI, GPRS ciphering key sequence number as specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [13] for the case when the GPRS attach or routing area updating procedure is rejected with the GMM cause of the same value in a NAS message without integrity protection;
[('if the EMM cause value received is # 3 , # 6 , # 7 or # 8', 'if'), ('if A/Gb mode or Iu mode is supported by the UE', 'if'), ('the UE maintains a counter for " SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services " events', 'if'), ('the counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value', 'if')] ----> the UE shall handle the GMM parameters GPRS attach attempt counter or routing area updating attempt counter ,
>> if the EMM cause value received is #3, #6, #7 or #8, and if the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services" events and the counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value, the UE shall:
[('the EMM cause value received is # 3 , # 6 , # 7 or # 8', 'if'), ('the UE maintains a counter for " SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services " events', 'if'), ('the counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value', 'if')] ----> the UE shall
>> If the UE is operating in single-registration mode, the UE shall in addition handle the 5GMM parameters 5GMM state, 5GS update status, 5G-GUTI, TAI list, ngKSI as specified in 3GPP TS 24.501 [54] for the case when the registration request procedure performed over 3GPP access is rejected with the 5GMM cause with the same value in a NAS message without integrity protection.
[('If the UE is operating in single-registration mode', 'if')] ----> the UE shall in addition handle the 5GMM parameters 5GMM state , 5GS update status , 5G-GUTI , TAI list , ngKSI as specified in 3GPP TS 24.501 for the case when the registration request procedure performed over 3GPP access is rejected with the 5GMM cause with the same value in a NAS message without integrity protection
>> if the EMM cause value received is #3, #6, #7 or #8, and if the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services" events and the counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value, the UE shall, store the current TAI in the list of "forbidden tracking areas for roaming", memorize the current TAI was stored in the list of "forbidden tracking areas for roaming" for non-integrity protected NAS reject message and enter the state EMM-DEREGISTERED.LIMITED-SERVICE;
[('the EMM cause value received is # 3 , # 6 , # 7 or # 8', 'if'), ('the UE maintains a counter for " SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services " events', 'if'), ('the counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value', 'if')] ----> the UE shall store the current TAI in the list of " forbidden tracking areas for roaming "
>> if the EMM cause value received is #3, #6, #7 or #8, and if the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services" events and the counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value, the UE shall, store the current TAI in the list of "forbidden tracking areas for roaming", memorize the current TAI was stored in the list of "forbidden tracking areas for roaming" for non-integrity protected NAS reject message and enter the state EMM-DEREGISTERED.LIMITED-SERVICE;
[('the EMM cause value received is # 3 , # 6 , # 7 or # 8', 'if'), ('the UE maintains a counter for " SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services " events', 'if'), ('the counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value', 'if')] ----> the UE shall enter the state EMM-DEREGISTERED.LIMITED-SERVICE
>> if the EMM cause value received is #3, #6, #7 or #8, and if the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services" events and the counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value, the UE shall, store the current TAI in the list of "forbidden tracking areas for roaming", memorize the current TAI was stored in the list of "forbidden tracking areas for roaming" for non-integrity protected NAS reject message and enter the state EMM-DEREGISTERED.LIMITED-SERVICE;
[('the EMM cause value received is # 3 , # 6 , # 7 or # 8', 'if'), ('the UE maintains a counter for " SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services " events', 'if'), ('the counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value', 'if')] ----> the UE shall memorize the current TAI was stored in the list of " forbidden tracking areas for roaming " for non-integrity protected NAS reject message
>> if the EMM cause value received is #3, #6, #7 or #8, and if the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services" events and the counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value, the UE shall, search for a suitable cell in another tracking area or in another location area according to 3GPP TS 36.304 [21];
[('the EMM cause value received is # 3 , # 6 , # 7 or # 8', 'if'), ('the UE maintains a counter for " SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services " events', 'if'), ('the counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value', 'if')] ----> the UE shall search for a suitable cell in another tracking area or in another location area according to 3GPP TS 36.304 [ 21 ]
>> if the EMM cause value received is #3, #6, #7 or #8, and if the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services" events and the counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value, the UE shall, proceed as specified in subclauses 5.5.1, 5.5.3 and 5.6.1;

>> if the EMM cause value received is #3, #6, #7 or #8, and if the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services" events and the counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value, the UE shall, if the EMM cause value received is #3, #6 or #8, and if the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for non-GPRS services" and the counter has a value less than a UE implementation specific maximum value, increment the counter;
[('if the EMM cause value received is # 3 , # 6 , # 7 or #', 'if')] ----> increment the counter
>> if the EMM cause value received is #3, #6, #7 or #8, and else the UE shall proceed as specified in subclauses 5.5.1, 5.5.3 and 5.6.1;

>> if the EMM cause value received is #11, #14 or #35 and the UE is in its HPLMN or EHPLMN, the UE shall set the EPS update status to EU3 ROAMING NOT ALLOWED and shall delete any GUTI, last visited registered TAI, TAI list and eKSI.

>> If t1 is greater than t, then the timer shall be restarted with the value t1 – t. If t1 is equal to or less than t, then the timer need not be restarted.
[('If t1 is equal to or less than t', 'if')] ----> then the timer need not be restarted

[('If t1 is greater than t', 'if')] ----> then the timer shall restarted with the value t1 – t

[('expiring of the timer T3324', 'upon')] ----> the UE may deactivate the AS layer
>> Upon expiry of the timer T3324 or if the T3324 value provided by the network is zero, the UE may deactivate the AS layer and activate PSM by entering the state EMM-REGISTERED.NO-CELL-AVAILABLE if, the UE is in EMM-IDLE mode;
[('by entering the state EMM-REGISTERED.NO-CELL-AVAILABLE if , the UE is in EMM-IDLE mode', 'by'), ('expiring of the timer T3324', 'upon')] ----> the UE may activate PSM
>> Upon expiry of the timer T3324 or if the T3324 value provided by the network is zero, the UE may deactivate the AS layer and activate PSM by entering the state EMM-REGISTERED.NO-CELL-AVAILABLE if, the UE is in EMM-IDLE mode;
[('by entering the state EMM-REGISTERED.NO-CELL-AVAILABLE if , the UE is in EMM-IDLE mode', 'by'), ('the T3324 value provided by the network is zero', 'upon')] ----> the UE may activate PSM
>> Upon expiry of the timer T3324 or if the T3324 value provided by the network is zero, the UE may deactivate the AS layer and activate PSM by entering the state EMM-REGISTERED.NO-CELL-AVAILABLE if, the UE is in EMM-IDLE mode;
[('the T3324 value provided by the network is zero', 'upon')] ----> the UE may deactivate the AS layer
>> Upon expiry of the timer T3324 or if the T3324 value provided by the network is zero, the UE may deactivate the AS layer and activate PSM by entering the state EMM-REGISTERED.NO-CELL-AVAILABLE if, in the EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE state;
[('by entering the state EMM-REGISTERED.NO-CELL-AVAILABLE if , in the EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE state', 'by'), ('the T3324 value provided by the network is zero', 'upon')] ----> the UE may activate PSM
>> Upon expiry of the timer T3324 or if the T3324 value provided by the network is zero, the UE may deactivate the AS layer and activate PSM by entering the state EMM-REGISTERED.NO-CELL-AVAILABLE if, in the EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE state;
[('by entering the state EMM-REGISTERED.NO-CELL-AVAILABLE if , in the EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE state', 'by'), ('expiring of the timer T3324', 'upon')] ----> the UE may activate PSM
>> Upon expiry of the timer T3324 or if the T3324 value provided by the network is zero, the UE may deactivate the AS layer and activate PSM by entering the state EMM-REGISTERED.NO-CELL-AVAILABLE if, in the EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE state;
[('the T3324 value provided by the network is zero', 'upon')] ----> the UE may deactivate the AS layer
>> Upon expiry of the timer T3324 or if the T3324 value provided by the network is zero, the UE may deactivate the AS layer and activate PSM by entering the state EMM-REGISTERED.NO-CELL-AVAILABLE if, in the EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE state;
[('expiring of the timer T3324', 'upon')] ----> the UE may deactivate the AS layer
>> Upon expiry of the timer T3324 or if the T3324 value provided by the network is zero, the UE may deactivate the AS layer and activate PSM by entering the state EMM-REGISTERED.NO-CELL-AVAILABLE if, the UE is not attached for access to RLOS.
[('Upon expiring of the timer T3324', 'upon'), ('entering the state EMM-REGISTERED.NO-CELL-AVAILABLE if', 'by'), ('the UE not attached for access to RLOS', 'by')] ----> or if the T3324 value provided by the network is zero the UE may activate PSM
>> Upon expiry of the timer T3324 or if the T3324 value provided by the network is zero, the UE may deactivate the AS layer and activate PSM by entering the state EMM-REGISTERED.NO-CELL-AVAILABLE if, the UE is not attached for access to RLOS.
[('Upon expiring of the timer T3324', 'upon')] ----> or if the T3324 value provided by the network is zero the UE may deactivate the AS layer
>> A UE that has already been allocated timer T3324 with a value different from "deactivated" and the timer T3324 has expired, may activate PSM if it receives an "Extended wait time" from lower layers.
[('if it receives an " Extended wait time " from lower layers', 'if')] ----> A UE that has already been allocated timer T3324 with a value different from " deactivated " and the timer T3324 has expired may activate PSM
>> If the UE is attached for emergency bearer services or has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services, the UE shall not activate PSM.
[('the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services', 'if')] ----> the UE shall not activate PSM
>> If the UE is attached for emergency bearer services or has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services, the UE shall not activate PSM.
[('the UE attached for emergency bearer services', 'if')] ----> the UE shall not activate PSM
>> If the UE is attached for access to RLOS, the UE shall not activate PSM.
[('If the UE is attached for access to RLOS', 'if')] ----> the UE shall not activate PSM
>> Upon deactivating PSM, the UE may initiate EMM procedures.
[('Upon deactivating PSM', 'upon')] ----> the UE may initiate EMM procedures
>> The network accepts the request to use the eDRX by providing the extended DRX parameters IE when accepting the attach or the tracking area updating procedure.
[('by providing the extended DRX parameters IE when accepting the attach or the tracking area updating procedure', 'by')] ----> The network accepts the request to use the eDRX
>> If the UE received the extended DRX parameters IE during the last attach or tracking area updating procedure, upon successful completion of the PDN disconnect procedure of the PDN connection for emergency bearer services or EPS bearer context deactivation procedure of the EPS bearer context for emergency, the UE shall resume eDRX.
[('upon successful completion of the PDN disconnect procedure of the PDN connection for emergency bearer services or EPS bearer context deactivation procedure of the EPS bearer context for emergency', 'upon'), ('If the UE received the extended DRX parameters IE during the last attach or tracking area updating procedure', 'if')] ----> the UE shall resume eDRX
>> If the network has provided the extended DRX parameters IE during the last attach or tracking area updating procedure, upon successful completion of the PDN disconnect procedure of the PDN connection for emergency bearer services or EPS bearer context deactivation procedure of the EPS bearer context for emergency, the network shall resume eDRX.
[('upon successful completion of the PDN disconnect procedure of the PDN connection for emergency bearer services or EPS bearer context deactivation procedure of the EPS bearer context for emergency', 'upon'), ('If the network has provided the extended DRX parameters IE during the last attach or tracking area updating procedure', 'if')] ----> the network shall resume eDRX
>> If the UE or the network locally releases the PDN connection for emergency bearer service, the UE or the network shall not use eDRX until the UE receives eDRX parameters during a tracking area updating procedure with EPS bearer context synchronization or upon successful completion of a service request procedure.
[('If the UE or the network locally releases the PDN connection for emergency bearer service', 'if')] ----> the UE or the network shall not use eDRX until the UE receives eDRX parameters during a tracking area updating procedure with EPS bearer context synchronization or upon successful completion of a service request procedure
>> If the UE did not receive the extended eDRX parameters IE, or if the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services, the UE shall use the stored UE specific DRX parameter, if available.
[('if available', 'if'), ('the UE not receive the extended eDRX parameters IE', 'if')] ----> the UE shall use the stored UE specific DRX parameter
>> If the UE did not receive the extended eDRX parameters IE, or if the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services, the UE shall use the stored UE specific DRX parameter, if available.
[('if available', 'if'), ('the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services', 'if')] ----> the UE shall use the stored UE specific DRX parameter
>> If the network did not accept the request to use eDRX, or if the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services, the network shall use the stored UE specific DRX parameter, if available.
[('if available', 'if'), ('the network not accept the request to use eDRX', 'if')] ----> the network shall use the stored UE specific DRX parameter
>> If the network did not accept the request to use eDRX, or if the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services, the network shall use the stored UE specific DRX parameter, if available.
[('if available', 'if'), ('the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services', 'if')] ----> the network shall use the stored UE specific DRX parameter
>> If the network provided the extended DRX parameters IE which was different from the one requested by the UE and also assigned a new GUTI for the UE as described in subclause 5.5.3.2.4 during the last tracking area updating procedure, the network shall use the stored UE specific DRX parameter, if available, with the old GUTI and use the eDRX provided by the network with the new GUTI until the old GUTI can be considered as invalid by the network.
[('the network provided the extended DRX parameters IE which was different from the one requested by the UE', 'if'), ('the network also assigned a new GUTI for the UE as described in subclause 5.5.3.2.4 during the last tracking area updating procedure', 'if')] ----> the network shall use the eDRX provided by the network with the new GUTI until the old GUTI can be considered as invalid by the network
>> If the network provided the extended DRX parameters IE which was different from the one requested by the UE and also assigned a new GUTI for the UE as described in subclause 5.5.3.2.4 during the last tracking area updating procedure, the network shall use the stored UE specific DRX parameter, if available, with the old GUTI and use the eDRX provided by the network with the new GUTI until the old GUTI can be considered as invalid by the network.
[('if available', 'if'), ('the network provided the extended DRX parameters IE which was different from the one requested by the UE', 'if'), ('the network also assigned a new GUTI for the UE as described in subclause 5.5.3.2.4 during the last tracking area updating procedure', 'if')] ----> the network shall use the stored UE specific DRX parameter with the old GUTI
>> If the network accepts the use of both PSM and eDRX, the extended DRX parameters IE provided to the UE should allow for multiple paging occasions before the active timer expires.
[('If the network accepts the use of both PSM and eDRX', 'if')] ----> the extended DRX parameters IE provided to the UE should allow for multiple paging occasions before the active timer expires
>> When the network rejects mobility management signalling requests due to dedicated core network, the mechanism for general NAS level mobility management congestion control as specified in subclause 5.3.9 shall be followed.

>> If the use of enhanced coverage is restricted, the UE shall not use enhanced coverage in the registered PLMN and in any PLMN which is in the list of equivalent PLMNs.

>> If the network supports service gap control feature and the service gap time value is available in the EMM context of the UE, the MME shall consider SGC as active for the UE.

>> If the UE supports service gap control and the the SGC is active for the UE, the MME shall include service gap timer T3447 value in the ATTACH ACCEPT message and TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message.

>> The UE shall start the SGC timer T3447 when the NAS signalling connection is released and if, the UE supports SGC feature, and the service gap timer value is available in the UE and does not indicate zero;

>> The UE shall start the SGC timer T3447 when the NAS signalling connection is released and if, the NAS signalling connection released was not established for, paging;
[('when the NAS signalling connection is released', 'when'), ('if , the NAS signalling connection released was not established for , paging', 'if')] ----> The UE shall start the SGC timer T3447 and
>> The UE shall start the SGC timer T3447 when the NAS signalling connection is released and if, the NAS signalling connection released was not established for, attach requests without PDN connection request;
[('when the NAS signalling connection is released', 'when')] ----> The UE shall start the SGC timer T3447
>> The UE shall start the SGC timer T3447 when the NAS signalling connection is released and if, the NAS signalling connection released was not established for, attach requests without PDN connection request;
[('if , the NAS signalling connection released was not established for', 'if')] ----> attach requests without PDN connection request

[('when the NAS signalling connection is released', 'when')] ----> The UE shall start the SGC timer T3447
>> If the SGC is active in the network, after the UE transitions from EMM-CONNECTED mode to EMM-IDLE mode except when the UE was in EMM-CONNECTED mode due to, attach requests without PDN connection request;
[('If the SGC is active in the network', 'if')] ----> attach requests without PDN connection request
>> the network shall start the SGC timer T3447, with the service gap time value available in the EMM context minus 4 minutes, if the UE supports SGC feature and the service gap time value has been sent to the UE with a non-zero value;
[('if the UE supports SGC feature and the service gap time value has been sent to the UE with a non-zero value', 'if')] ----> the network shall start the SGC timer T3447 with the service gap time value available in the EMM context minus 4 minutes
>> the network shall start the SGC timer T3447, with the service gap time value available in the EMM context if the UE does not support SGC feature.
[('if the UE does not support SGC feature', 'if')] ----> the network shall start the SGC timer T3447 with the service gap time value available in the EMM context
>> When the SGC timer T3447 is running, the network allows, requests for emergency bearer services;
[('When the SGC timer T3447 is running', 'when')] ----> the network allows requests for emergency bearer services
>> When the SGC timer T3447 is running, the network allows, requests for exception data reporting;-	attach requests without PDN connection request;
[('When the SGC timer T3447 is running', 'when')] ----> the network allows requests for exception data reporting;-	attach requests without PDN connection request
>> When the SGC timer T3447 is running, the network allows, tracking area update requests without "active" or "signalling active" flag set;
[('When the SGC timer T3447 is running', 'when')] ----> the network allows tracking area update requests without " active " or " signalling active " flag set
>> When the SGC timer T3447 is running, the network allows, requests from UEs that were received via NAS signalling connections established with RRC establishment cause "High priority access AC 11 – 15";
[('When the SGC timer T3447 is running', 'when')] ----> the network allows requests from UEs that were received via NAS signalling connections established with RRC establishment cause " High priority access AC 11 – 15 "
>> When the SGC timer T3447 is running, the network allows, mobile terminated service requests triggered by paging and subsequent MO signalling or MO data, if any, until the UE enters EMM-IDLE mode.
[('When the SGC timer T3447 is running', 'when')] ----> the network allows mobile terminated service requests triggered by paging and subsequent MO signalling or MO data , if any , until the UE enters EMM-IDLE mode
>> If the MME determines that the UE operating in single-registration mode has performed an inter-system change from S1 mode to N1 mode and the timer T3447 is running in the MME, the MME stops the T3447.
[('the MME determines that the UE operating in single-registration mode has performed an inter-system change from S1 mode to N1 mode and the timer T3447 is running in the MME', 'if'), ('If the MME determines that the UE operating in single-registration mode has performed an inter-system change from the timer T3447 running in the MME', 'if')] ----> the MME stops the T3447
>> Upon inter-system change from N1 mode to S1 mode, if the UE supports service gap control, T3447 is running in the UE, and the T3447 value is included in the ATTACH ACCEPT message or TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message received from the MME, the UE shall keep T3447 running.
[('Upon inter-system change from N1 mode', 'upon')] ----> message received from the MME the UE shall keep running
>> Upon expiry of the running T3447 timer, the UE shall use the new value when starting T3447 again.
[('Upon expiring of the running T3447 timer', 'upon'), ('when starting T3447 again', 'when')] ----> the UE shall use the new value
>> The UE or the network with a running service gap timer shall keep the timer running when the UE transits from EMM-IDLE mode to EMM-CONNECTED mode.
[('when the UE transits from EMM-IDLE mode to EMM-CONNECTED mode', 'when')] ----> The UE or the network with a running service gap timer shall keep running
>> If the timer T3447 is running when the UE enters state EMM-DEREGISTERED, the UE remains switched on, and the USIM in the UE remains the same, then timer T3447 is kept running until it expires.
[('the timer T3447 running when the UE enters state EMM-DEREGISTERED', 'if'), ('the UE remains switched on', 'if'), ('the USIM in the UE remains the same', 'if')] ----> kept running until it expires
>> If the UE is switched off when the timer T3447 is running, the UE shall behave as follows when the UE is switched on and the USIM in the UE remains the same:
[('If the UE is switched off when the timer T3447 is running', 'if'), ('the UE switched', 'when'), ('the USIM in the UE remains the same', 'when')] ----> the UE shall behave as follows
>> The UE requests access to RLOS during the attach procedure by setting the attach type to "EPS RLOS attach" in the ATTACH REQUEST message.
[('by setting the attach type to " EPS RLOS attach " in the ATTACH REQUEST message', 'by')] ----> The UE requests access to RLOS during the attach procedure
>> Subject to regulation and local operator policy, if the MME is configured to support access to RLOS, the MME accepts the UE's attach request regardless of the authentication result or skips the authentication procedure.
[('if the MME is configured to support access to RLOS', 'if')] ----> Subject to regulation and local operator policy the MME accepts the UE's attach request regardless of the authentication result or skips the authentication procedure
>> When the UE requests the lower layer to establish an RRC connection for access to RLOS, the UE indicates in the RRC signalling that the RRC connection is for access to RLOS to the lower layers.
[('When the UE requests the lower layer to establish an RRC connection for access to RLOS', 'when')] ----> the UE indicates in the RRC signalling that the RRC connection is for access to RLOS to the lower layers
>> The UE shall not attempt to request access to RLOS if the serving PLMN does not support access to RLOS.
[('if the serving PLMN does not support access to RLOS', 'if')] ----> The UE shall not attempt to request access to RLOS
>> If the serving PLMN supports access to RLOS and the UE is in limited service state, the UE shall verify that the MCC of the PLMN ID of the serving PLMN is present in the list of access to RLOS allowed MCCs configured in the UE before requesting access to RLOS.
[('the serving PLMN supports access to RLOS', 'if'), ('the UE is in limited service state', 'if')] ----> the UE shall verify that the MCC of the PLMN ID of the serving PLMN is present in the list of access to RLOS allowed MCCs configured in the UE before requesting access to RLOS
>> If the UE has a valid USIM, the UE shall additionally verify that the MCC part of the IMSI configured in the USIM is present in the list of RLOS allowed MCCs before requesting access to RLOS.
[('If the UE has a valid USIM', 'if')] ----> the UE shall additionally verify that the MCC part of the IMSI configured in the USIM is present in the list of RLOS allowed MCCs before requesting access to RLOS
>> If a UE attached for access to RLOS needs to initiate an emergency call, the UE shall first perform a local detach prior to initiating an attach procedure for emergency bearer services.
[('If a UE attached for access to RLOS needs to initiate an emergency call', 'if')] ----> the UE shall first perform a local detach prior to initiating an attach procedure for emergency bearer services
>> RACS works by assigning an identifier to represent a set of UE radio capabilities.
[('by assigning an identifier to represent a set of UE radio capabilities', 'by')] ----> RACS works
>> If the UE supports RACS, the UE shall indicate support for RACS by setting the RACS bit to "RACS supported" in the UE network capability IE of the ATTACH REQUEST and TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST messages;
[('If the UE supports RACS', 'if'), ('by setting the RACS bit to " RACS supported " in the UE network capability IE of the ATTACH REQUEST and TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST messages', 'by')] ----> the UE shall indicate support for RACS
>> If the UE supports RACS, if the UE performs an attach procedure and the UE has an applicable UE radio capability ID for the current UE radio configuration in the selected network, the UE shall include the UE radio capability ID availability IE in the ATTACH REQUEST message and set the IE to "UE radio capability ID available";
[('If the UE supports RACS', 'if'), ('the UE performs an attach procedure', 'if'), ('the UE has an applicable UE radio capability ID for the current UE radio configuration in the selected network', 'if')] ----> the UE shall include the UE radio capability ID availability IE in the ATTACH REQUEST message
>> If the UE supports RACS, if the UE performs an attach procedure and the UE has an applicable UE radio capability ID for the current UE radio configuration in the selected network, the UE shall include the UE radio capability ID availability IE in the ATTACH REQUEST message and set the IE to "UE radio capability ID available";
[('If the UE supports RACS', 'if'), ('the UE performs an attach procedure', 'if'), ('the UE has an applicable UE radio capability ID for the current UE radio configuration in the selected network', 'if')] ----> the UE shall set the IE to " UE radio capability ID available "
>> If the UE supports RACS, if the UE performs a tracking area updating procedure and the UE has an applicable UE radio capability ID for the current UE radio configuration in the selected network, the UE shall include the UE radio capability ID availability IE in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message and set the IE to "UE radio capability ID available";
[('If the UE supports RACS', 'if'), ('the UE performs a tracking area updating procedure', 'if'), ('the UE has an applicable UE radio capability ID for the current UE radio configuration in the selected network', 'if')] ----> the UE shall set the IE to " UE radio capability ID available "
>> If the UE supports RACS, if the UE performs a tracking area updating procedure and the UE has an applicable UE radio capability ID for the current UE radio configuration in the selected network, the UE shall include the UE radio capability ID availability IE in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message and set the IE to "UE radio capability ID available";
[('If the UE supports RACS', 'if'), ('the UE performs a tracking area updating procedure', 'if'), ('the UE has an applicable UE radio capability ID for the current UE radio configuration in the selected network', 'if')] ----> the UE shall include the UE radio capability ID availability IE in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message
>> If the UE is requested to provide its UE radio capability ID by the network during a security mode control procedure, the UE shall include its UE radio capability ID in the UE radio capability ID IE of the SECURITY MODE COMPLETE message.
[('If the UE is requested to provide its UE radio capability ID by the network during a security mode control procedure', 'if')] ----> the UE shall include its UE radio capability ID in the UE radio capability ID IE of the SECURITY MODE COMPLETE message
>> If both a network-assigned UE radio capability ID and a manufacturer-assigned UE radio capability ID are applicable, the UE shall include the network-assigned UE radio capability ID in the SECURITY MODE COMPLETE message;
[('If both a network-assigned UE radio capability ID and a manufacturer-assigned UE radio capability ID are applicable', 'if')] ----> the UE shall include the network-assigned UE radio capability ID in the SECURITY MODE COMPLETE message
