>> If the UE supports RACS, if the radio configuration at the UE changes then, if the UE has an applicable UE radio capability ID for the new UE radio configuration, the UE shall initiate a tracking area updating procedure, include a UE radio capability information update needed IE in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message and include a UE radio capability ID availability IE set to "UE radio capability ID available" in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message.
[('If the UE supports RACS', 'if'), ('if the radio configuration at the UE changes', 'if'), ('if the UE has an applicable UE radio capability ID for the new UE radio configuration', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall include a UE radio capability information update needed IE in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message
>> If the UE supports RACS, if the radio configuration at the UE changes then, if the UE has an applicable UE radio capability ID for the new UE radio configuration, the UE shall initiate a tracking area updating procedure, include a UE radio capability information update needed IE in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message and include a UE radio capability ID availability IE set to "UE radio capability ID available" in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message.
[('If the UE supports RACS', 'if'), ('if the radio configuration at the UE changes', 'if'), ('if the UE has an applicable UE radio capability ID for the new UE radio configuration', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall include a UE radio capability ID availability IE set to " UE radio capability ID available " in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message
>> If the UE supports RACS, if the radio configuration at the UE changes then, if the UE has an applicable UE radio capability ID for the new UE radio configuration, the UE shall initiate a tracking area updating procedure, include a UE radio capability information update needed IE in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message and include a UE radio capability ID availability IE set to "UE radio capability ID available" in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message.
[('If the UE supports RACS', 'if'), ('if the radio configuration at the UE changes', 'if'), ('if the UE has an applicable UE radio capability ID for the new UE radio configuration', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall initiate a tracking area updating procedure
>> If both a network-assigned UE radio capability ID and a manufacturer-assigned UE Radio Capability ID are applicable, the UE shall include the network-assigned UE radio capability ID in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message;
[('If both a network-assigned UE radio capability ID and a manufacturer-assigned UE Radio Capability ID are applicable', 'if')] ----> the UE shall include the network-assigned UE radio capability ID in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message
>> If the UE supports RACS, if the radio configuration at the UE changes then, if the UE does not have an applicable UE radio capability ID for the new UE radio configuration, the UE shall initiate a tracking area updating procedure and shall include a UE radio capability information update needed IE in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message;
[('If the UE supports RACS', 'if'), ('if the radio configuration at the UE changes', 'if'), ('if the UE does not have an applicable UE radio capability ID for the new UE radio configuration', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall include a UE radio capability information update needed IE in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message
>> If the UE supports RACS, if the radio configuration at the UE changes then, if the UE does not have an applicable UE radio capability ID for the new UE radio configuration, the UE shall initiate a tracking area updating procedure and shall include a UE radio capability information update needed IE in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message;
[('If the UE supports RACS', 'if'), ('if the radio configuration at the UE changes', 'if'), ('if the UE does not have an applicable UE radio capability ID for the new UE radio configuration', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall initiate a tracking area updating procedure
>> If the UE supports RACS, upon receiving a network-assigned UE radio capability ID in the ATTACH ACCEPT message or the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message, the UE shall store the network-assigned UE radio capability ID and the PLMN ID of the serving network along with a mapping to the current UE radio configuration in its non-volatile memory as specified in annex C. The UE shall be able to store at least the last 16 received network-assigned UE radio capability IDs with the associated PLMN ID and the mapping to the corresponding UE radio configuration;
[('upon receiving a network-assigned UE radio capability ID in the ATTACH ACCEPT message or the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message', 'upon'), ('If the UE supports RACS', 'if')] ----> the UE shall store the network-assigned UE radio capability ID and the PLMN ID of the serving network along with a mapping to the current UE radio configuration in its non-volatile memory as specified in annex C
>> If the UE supports RACS, the UE shall not use a network-assigned UE radio capability ID in PLMNs equivalent to the PLMN which assigned it;
[('If the UE supports RACS', 'if')] ----> the UE shall not use a network-assigned UE radio capability ID in PLMNs equivalent to the PLMN which assigned it
>> If the UE supports RACS, upon receiving a UE radio capability ID deletion indication IE set to "delete network-assigned UE radio capability IDs" in the ATTACH ACCEPT message or the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message, the UE shall delete all network-assigned UE radio capability IDs stored at the UE for the serving network and initiate a tracking area updating procedure.
[('upon receiving a UE radio capability ID deletion indication IE set to " delete network-assigned UE radio capability IDs " in the ATTACH ACCEPT message or the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message', 'upon'), ('If the UE supports RACS', 'if')] ----> the UE shall delete all network-assigned UE radio capability IDs stored at the UE for the serving network
>> If the UE supports RACS, upon receiving a UE radio capability ID deletion indication IE set to "delete network-assigned UE radio capability IDs" in the ATTACH ACCEPT message or the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message, the UE shall delete all network-assigned UE radio capability IDs stored at the UE for the serving network and initiate a tracking area updating procedure.
[('upon receiving a UE radio capability ID deletion indication IE set to " delete network-assigned UE radio capability IDs " in the ATTACH ACCEPT message or the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message', 'upon'), ('If the UE supports RACS', 'if')] ----> the UE shall initiate a tracking area updating procedure
>> If the UE has an applicable manufacturer-assigned UE radio capability ID for the current UE radio configuration in the selected network, the UE shall include a UE radio capability ID availability IE set to "UE radio capability ID available" in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message.
[('If the UE has an applicable manufacturer-assigned UE radio capability ID for the current UE radio configuration in the selected network', 'if')] ----> the UE shall include a UE radio capability ID availability IE set to " UE radio capability ID available " in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message
>> If the network supports RACS, if the UE has included the UE radio capability ID availability IE in the ATTACH REQUEST message and set the IE to "UE radio capability ID available", the network shall initiate a security mode control procedure to retrieve the UE radio capability ID from the UE;
[('If the network supports RACS', 'if'), ('the UE included the UE radio capability ID availability IE in the ATTACH REQUEST message', 'if'), ('the UE set the IE to " UE radio capability ID available "', 'if')] ----> the network shall initiate a security mode control procedure to retrieve the UE radio capability ID from the UE
>> If the network supports RACS, if the UE has included the UE radio capability ID availability IE in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message and set the IE to "UE radio capability ID available", the network may initiate a security mode control procedure to retrieve the UE radio capability ID from the UE;
[('If the network supports RACS', 'if'), ('the UE included the UE radio capability ID availability IE in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message', 'if'), ('the UE set the IE to " UE radio capability ID available "', 'if')] ----> the network may initiate a security mode control procedure to retrieve the UE radio capability ID from the UE
>> If the network supports RACS, if the UE has included the UE radio capability ID availability IE in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message, set the URCIDA bit to "UE radio capability ID available" in the UE radio capability ID availability IE and no UE radio capability ID is available in the UE context in the MME, the network shall initiate a security mode control procedure to retrieve the UE radio capability ID from the UE;
[('If the network supports RACS', 'if'), ('if the UE has included the UE radio capability ID availability IE in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message set the URCIDA bit to " UE radio capability ID available " in the UE radio capability ID availability IE', 'if'), ('no UE radio capability ID is available in the UE context in the MME', 'if')] ----> the network shall initiate a security mode control procedure to retrieve the UE radio capability ID from the UE
>> If the network supports RACS, the network may assign a network-assigned UE radio capability ID to a UE which supports RACS by including a UE radio capability ID IE in the ATTACH ACCEPT message, in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message or in the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message;
[('If the network supports RACS', 'if')] ----> the network may assign a network-assigned UE radio capability ID to a UE which supports RACS by including a UE radio capability ID IE in the ATTACH ACCEPT message , in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message or in the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message
>> If the network supports RACS, the network may trigger the UE to delete all network-assigned UE radio capability IDs stored at the UE for the serving network by including a UE radio capability ID deletion indication IE set to "delete network-assigned UE radio capability IDs" in the ATTACH ACCEPT message, in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message or in the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message.
[('If the network supports RACS', 'if')] ----> the network may trigger the UE to delete all network-assigned UE radio capability IDs stored at the UE for the serving network by including a UE radio capability ID deletion indication IE set to " delete network-assigned UE radio capability IDs " in the ATTACH ACCEPT message , in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE ACCEPT message or in the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message
>> If the UE is not attached for emergency bearer services and the network accepts the use of the WUS assistance for the UE, the network determines the negotiated UE paging probability information for the UE based on the requested UE paging probability information, if any, local configuration or previous statistical information for the UE, and then indicates the negotiated UE paging probability information in the Negotiated WUS assistance information IE to the UE when accepting the attach or the tracking area updating procedure.
[('when accepting the attach or the tracking area updating procedure', 'when'), ('the UE not attached for emergency bearer services', 'if'), ('the network accepts the use of the WUS assistance for the UE', 'if')] ----> the network then indicates the negotiated UE paging probability information in the Negotiated WUS assistance information IE to the UE
>> If the UE is not attached for emergency bearer services and the network accepts the use of the WUS assistance for the UE, the network determines the negotiated UE paging probability information for the UE based on the requested UE paging probability information, if any, local configuration or previous statistical information for the UE, and then indicates the negotiated UE paging probability information in the Negotiated WUS assistance information IE to the UE when accepting the attach or the tracking area updating procedure.
[('the UE not attached for emergency bearer services', 'if'), ('the network accepts the use of the WUS assistance for the UE', 'if')] ----> the network determines the negotiated UE paging probability information for the UE based on the requested UE paging probability information , if any , local configuration or previous statistical information for the UE
>> If the UE did not receive the Negotiated WUS assistance information IE during the last attach or tracking area updating procedure, the UE shall not use WUS assistance.
[('If the UE did not receive the Negotiated WUS assistance information IE during the last attach or tracking area updating procedure', 'if')] ----> the UE shall not use WUS assistance
>> If the network did not accept the request to use WUS assistance, the network shall delete the stored negotiated UE paging probability information for the UE, if available.
[('If the network did not accept the request to use WUS assistance', 'if'), ('if available', 'if')] ----> the network shall delete the stored negotiated UE paging probability information for the UE
>> When a PDN connection for emergency bearer service is successfully established after the UE received the Negotiated WUS assistance information IE during the last attach or tracking area updating procedure, the UE and the network shall not use WUS assistance information until, the successful completion of the PDN disconnect procedure of the PDN connection for emergency bearer services or EPS bearer context deactivation procedure of the EPS bearer context for emergency, or
[('When a PDN connection for emergency bearer service is successfully established after the UE received the Negotiated WUS assistance information IE during the last attach or tracking area updating procedure', 'when')] ----> the UE and the network shall not use WUS assistance information until , the successful completion of the PDN disconnect procedure of the PDN connection for emergency bearer services or EPS bearer context deactivation procedure of the EPS bearer context for emergency , or
>> When a PDN connection for emergency bearer service is successfully established after the UE received the Negotiated WUS assistance information IE during the last attach or tracking area updating procedure, the UE and the network shall not use WUS assistance information until, the UE receives WUS assistance information during a tracking area updating procedure with EPS bearer context synchronization or upon successful completion of a service request procedure, if the UE or the network locally releases the PDN connection for emergency bearer service.
[('When a PDN connection for emergency bearer service is successfully established after the UE received the Negotiated WUS assistance information IE during the last attach or tracking area updating procedure', 'when')] ----> the UE and the network shall not use WUS assistance information until
>> The MME shall initiate the GUTI reallocation procedure by sending a GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message to the UE and starting the timer T3450.
[('sending a GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message to the UE', 'by'), ('starting the timer T3450', 'by')] ----> The MME shall initiate the GUTI reallocation procedure
>> Upon receipt of the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message, the UE shall, store the GUTI;
[('Upon receiving of the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message', 'upon')] ----> the UE shall store the GUTI
>> Upon receipt of the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message, the UE shall, store the TAI list, if provided;
[('Upon receiving of the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message', 'upon'), ('if provided', 'if')] ----> the UE shall store the TAI list
>> Upon receipt of the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message, the UE shall, store the DCN-ID, if provided;
[('Upon receiving of the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message', 'upon'), ('if provided', 'if')] ----> the UE shall store the DCN-ID
>> Upon receipt of the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message, the UE shall, in WB-S1 mode, if the UE supports RACS and the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message includes, a UE radio capability ID deletion indication IE set to "Network-assigned UE radio capability IDs deletion requested", delete any network-assigned UE radio capability IDs associated with the registered PLMN stored at the UE, then the UE shall, after the completion of the ongoing GUTI reallocation procedure, initiate a tracking area updating procedure as specified in subclause 5.5.3.
[('Upon receiving of the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message', 'upon'), ('the UE supports RACS', 'if'), ('the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message includes a UE radio capability ID deletion indication IE set to " Network-assigned UE radio capability IDs deletion requested', 'if'), ('a UE radio capability ID deletion indication IE set to " Network-assigned UE radio capability IDs deletion requested "', 'if')] ----> shall in WB-S1 mode delete any network-assigned UE radio capability IDs associated with the registered PLMN stored at the UE then the UE shall after the completion of the ongoing GUTI reallocation procedure initiate a tracking area updating procedure as specified in subclause 5.5.3
>> If the UE has an applicable manufacturer-assigned UE radio capability ID for the current UE radio configuration, the UE shall include the UE radio capability ID availability IE set to "UE radio capability ID available" in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message;
[('If the UE has an applicable manufacturer-assigned UE radio capability ID for the current UE radio configuration', 'if')] ----> the UE shall include the UE radio capability ID availability IE set to " UE radio capability ID available " in the TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message
>> Upon receipt of the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message, the UE shall, in WB-S1 mode, if the UE supports RACS and the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message includes, a UE radio capability ID IE, store the UE radio capability ID as specified in annex C;
[('Upon receiving of the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message', 'upon'), ('if the UE supports RACS', 'if')] ----> the UE shall in WB-S1 mode store the UE radio capability ID as specified in annex C
>> Upon receipt of the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message, the UE shall, send a GUTI REALLOCATION COMPLETE message to the MME.
[('Upon receiving of the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message', 'upon')] ----> the UE shall send a GUTI REALLOCATION COMPLETE message to the MME
>> If the UE receives a new TAI list in the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message, the UE shall consider the new TAI list as valid and the old TAI list as invalid; otherwise, the UE shall consider the old TAI list as valid.
[('If the UE receives a new TAI list in the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message', 'if')] ----> the UE shall consider the new TAI list as valid the old as invalid
>> If the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message contains the DCN-ID IE, then the UE shall store the included DCN-ID value together with the PLMN code of the registered PLMN in a DCN-ID list in a non-volatile memory in the ME as specified in annex C.
[('If the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message contains the DCN-ID IE', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall store the included DCN-ID value together with the PLMN code of the registered PLMN in a DCN-ID list in a non-volatile memory in the ME as specified in annex C
>> Upon receipt of the GUTI REALLOCATION COMPLETE message, the MME shall stop the timer T3450 and consider the new GUTI as valid and the old GUTI as invalid.
[('Upon receiving of the GUTI REALLOCATION COMPLETE message', 'upon')] ----> the MME shall consider the new GUTI as valid
>> Upon receipt of the GUTI REALLOCATION COMPLETE message, the MME shall stop the timer T3450 and consider the new GUTI as valid and the old GUTI as invalid.
[('Upon receiving of the GUTI REALLOCATION COMPLETE message', 'upon')] ----> the MME shall stop the timer T3450
>> If a new TAI list is provided in the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message, the MME shall consider the new TAI list as valid and the old TAI list as invalid.
[('If a new TAI list is provided in the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message', 'if')] ----> the MME shall consider the new TAI list as valid the old TAI list
>> If the current TAI is still part of the TAI list, it is up to the UE implementation how to re-run the ongoing procedure that triggered the GUTI reallocation procedure.
[('If the current TAI is still part of the TAI list', 'if')] ----> is up to the UE implementation how to re-run the ongoing procedure that triggered the GUTI reallocation procedure
>> If a lower layer failure is detected before the GUTI REALLOCATION COMPLETE message is received, the old and the new GUTI shall be considered as valid until the old GUTI can be considered as invalid by the network.
[('If a lower layer failure is detected before the GUTI REALLOCATION COMPLETE message is received', 'if')] ----> the old and the new GUTI shall considered as valid until the old GUTI can be considered as invalid by the network
>> If a new TAI list was provided in the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message, the old and new TAI list shall also be considered as valid until the old TAI list can be considered as invalid by the network.
[('If a new TAI list was provided in the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message', 'if')] ----> the old and new TAI list shall also considered as valid until the old TAI list can be considered as invalid by the network
>> If a new TAI list was provided with old GUTI in the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message, the new TAI list should also be used for paging.
[('If a new TAI list was provided with old GUTI in the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message', 'if')] ----> the new TAI list should also used for paging
>> If the response is received from a tracking area within the old and new TAI list, the network shall re-initiate the GUTI reallocation.
[('If the response is received from a tracking area within the old and new TAI list', 'if')] ----> the network shall re-initiate the GUTI reallocation
>> If no response is received to the paging attempts, the network may use the new S-TMSI from the new GUTI for paging for an implementation dependent number of paging attempts.
[('no response received', 'if'), ('paging attempts', 'if')] ----> the network may use the new S-TMSI from the new GUTI for paging for an implementation dependent number of paging attempts
>> In this case, if a new TAI list was provided with new GUTI in the GUTI REALLOCAITON COMMAND message, the new TAI list shall be used instead of the old TAI list.
[('if a new TAI list was provided with new GUTI in the GUTI REALLOCAITON COMMAND message', 'if')] ----> In this case the new TAI list shall used instead of the old TAI list
>> If no response is received to the paging attempts, the network may use the IMSI for paging for an implementation dependent number of paging attempts;
[('no response received', 'if'), ('paging attempts', 'if')] ----> the network may use the IMSI for paging for an implementation dependent number of paging attempts
>> During this period the network, may use the identification procedure followed by a new GUTI reallocation if the UE uses the old GUTI;
[('if the UE uses the old GUTI', 'if')] ----> During this period the network may use the identification procedure followed by a new GUTI reallocation
>> During this period the network, if the network accepted to use eDRX for the UE, may determine the next paging window from both old GUTI and new GUTI, and may first use the S-TMSI from the GUTI which led the first eDRX for paging.
[('if the network accepted to use eDRX for the UE', 'if')] ----> During this period the network may determine the next paging window from both old GUTI and new GUTI
>> During this period the network, if the network accepted to use eDRX for the UE, may determine the next paging window from both old GUTI and new GUTI, and may first use the S-TMSI from the GUTI which led the first eDRX for paging.
[('if the network accepted to use eDRX for the UE', 'if')] ----> During this period the network may first use the S-TMSI from the GUTI which led the first eDRX for paging
>> If no response is received to the paging attempts for the first eDRX, the network may use the other S-TMSI from the other GUTI which led the second eDRX for paging.
[('If no response is received to the paging attempts for the first eDRX', 'if')] ----> the network may use the other S-TMSI from the other GUTI which led the second eDRX for paging
>> If the network receives an ATTACH REQUEST message before the ongoing GUTI reallocation procedure has been completed the network shall proceed with the attach procedure after deletion of the EMM context.
[('If the network receives an ATTACH REQUEST message before the ongoing GUTI reallocation procedure has been completed', 'if')] ----> the network shall proceed with the attach procedure after deletion of the EMM context
>> If the network receives a DETACH REQUEST message before the ongoing GUTI reallocation procedure has been completed, the network shall abort the GUTI reallocation procedure and shall progress the detach procedure.
[('If the network receives a DETACH REQUEST message before the ongoing GUTI reallocation procedure has been completed', 'if')] ----> the network shall progress the detach procedure
>> If the network receives a DETACH REQUEST message before the ongoing GUTI reallocation procedure has been completed, the network shall abort the GUTI reallocation procedure and shall progress the detach procedure.
[('If the network receives a DETACH REQUEST message before the ongoing GUTI reallocation procedure has been completed', 'if')] ----> the network shall abort the GUTI reallocation procedure
>> If the network receives a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message before the ongoing GUTI reallocation procedure has been completed, the network shall abort the GUTI reallocation procedure and shall progress the tracking area updating procedure.
[('If the network receives a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message before the ongoing GUTI reallocation procedure has been completed', 'if')] ----> the network shall progress the tracking area updating procedure
>> If the network receives a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message before the ongoing GUTI reallocation procedure has been completed, the network shall abort the GUTI reallocation procedure and shall progress the tracking area updating procedure.
[('If the network receives a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message before the ongoing GUTI reallocation procedure has been completed', 'if')] ----> the network shall abort the GUTI reallocation procedure
>> If the network receives an EXTENDED SERVICE REQUEST message for CS fallback or 1xCS fallback before the ongoing GUTI reallocation procedure has been completed, the network shall progress both procedures.
[('If the network receives an EXTENDED SERVICE REQUEST message for CS fallback or 1x CS fallback before the ongoing GUTI reallocation procedure has been completed', 'if')] ----> the network shall progress both procedures
>> If the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message could not be delivered due to an intra MME handover and the target TA is included in the TAI list, then upon successful completion of the intra MME handover the MME shall retransmit the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message.
[('upon successful completion of the intra MME handover', 'upon'), ('If the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message could not be delivered due to an intra MME handover and the target TA is included in the TAI list', 'if')] ----> then the MME shall retransmit the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message
>> If a failure of the handover procedure is reported by the lower layer and the S1 signalling connection exists, the MME shall retransmit the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message.
[('a failure of the handover procedure reported by the lower layer', 'if'), ('the S1 signalling connection exists', 'if')] ----> the MME shall retransmit the GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message
>> If there is a different new GUTI and optionally a new TAI list included in a subsequent GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message, the UE always regards the newest GUTI and the newest TAI list as valid for the recovery time.
[('If there is a different new GUTI and optionally a new TAI list included in a subsequent GUTI REALLOCATION COMMAND message', 'if')] ----> the UE always regards the newest GUTI and the newest TAI list as valid for the recovery time
>> A partial native EPS security context is established in the UE and the network when an EPS authentication is successfully performed.
[('when an EPS authentication is successfully performed', 'when')] ----> A partial native EPS security context established in the UE and the network
>> When a NAS signalling connection exists, the network can initiate an authentication procedure at any time.
[('When a NAS signalling connection exists', 'when')] ----> the network can initiate an authentication procedure at any time
>> The network initiates the authentication procedure by sending an AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message to the UE and starting the timer T3460.
[('sending an AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message to the UE', 'by'), ('starting the timer T3460', 'by')] ----> The network initiates the authentication procedure
>> If an eKSI is contained in an initial NAS message during an EMM procedure, the network shall include a different eKSI value in the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message when it initiates an authentication procedure.
[('when it initiates an authentication procedure', 'when'), ('If an eKSI is contained in an initial NAS message during an EMM procedure', 'if')] ----> the network shall include a different eKSI value in the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message
>> Upon a successful EPS authentication challenge, the UE shall determine the PLMN identity to be used for the calculation of the new KASME from the authentication challenge data according to the following rules:
[('Upon a successful EPS authentication challenge', 'upon')] ----> the UE shall determine the PLMN identity to be used for the calculation of the new KASME from the authentication challenge data according to the following rules
>> When the UE moves from EMM-IDLE mode to EMM-CONNECTED mode, until the first handover, the UE shall use the PLMN identity of the selected PLMN;
[('When the UE moves from EMM-IDLE mode to EMM-CONNECTED mode', 'when')] ----> until the first handover the UE shall use the PLMN identity of the selected PLMN
>> After handover or inter-system handover to S1 mode, if the target cell is not a shared network cell, the UE shall use the PLMN identity received as part of the broadcast system information;
[('if the target cell is not a shared network cell', 'if')] ----> After handover or inter-system handover to S1 mode the UE shall use the PLMN identity received as part of the broadcast system information
>> After handover or inter-system handover to S1 mode, if the target cell is a shared network cell and the UE has a valid GUTI, the UE shall use the PLMN identity that is part of the GUTI;
[('the target cell is a shared network cell', 'if'), ('the UE has a valid GUTI', 'if')] ----> After handover or inter-system handover to S1 mode the UE shall use the PLMN identity that is part of the GUTI
>> In order to avoid a synchronisation failure, when the UE receives an AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message, the UE shall store the received RAND together with the RES returned from the USIM in the volatile memory of the ME.
[('when the UE receives an AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message', 'when')] ----> In order to avoid a synchronisation failure the UE shall store the received RAND together with the RES returned from the USIM in the volatile memory of the ME
>> When the UE receives a subsequent AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message, if the stored RAND value is equal to the new received value in the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message, then the ME shall not pass the RAND to the USIM, but shall send the AUTHENTICATION RESPONSE message with the stored RES.
[('When the UE receives a subsequent AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message', 'when'), ('if the stored RAND value is equal to the new received value in the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message', 'if')] ----> then the ME shall send the AUTHENTICATION RESPONSE message with the stored RES
>> When the UE receives a subsequent AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message, if the stored RAND value is equal to the new received value in the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message, then the ME shall not pass the RAND to the USIM, but shall send the AUTHENTICATION RESPONSE message with the stored RES.
[('When the UE receives a subsequent AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message', 'when'), ('if the stored RAND value is equal to the new received value in the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message', 'if')] ----> then the ME shall not pass the RAND to the USIM
>> If there is no valid stored RAND in the ME or the stored RAND is different from the new received value in the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message, the ME shall pass the RAND to the USIM, shall override any previously stored RAND and RES with the new ones and start, or reset and restart timer T3416.
[('If there is no valid stored RAND in the ME or the stored RAND is different from the new received value in the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message', 'if')] ----> the ME shall pass the RAND to the USIM
>> The RAND and RES values stored in the ME shall be deleted and timer T3416, if running, shall be stopped, upon receipt of a
[('upon receiving of a', 'upon')] ----> timer T3416 , if running shall stopped
>> The RAND and RES values stored in the ME shall be deleted and timer T3416, if running, shall be stopped, upon expiry of timer T3416;
[('upon expiring of timer T3416', 'upon'), ('if running', 'if')] ----> timer T3416 shall stopped
>> The RAND and RES values stored in the ME shall be deleted and timer T3416, if running, shall be stopped, if the UE enters the EMM state EMM-DEREGISTERED or EMM-NULL;
[('if running', 'if'), ('if the UE enters the EMM state EMM-DEREGISTERED or EMM-NULL', 'if')] ----> timer T3416 shall stopped
>> The RAND and RES values stored in the ME shall be deleted and timer T3416, if running, shall be stopped, if the UE enters EMM-IDLE mode.
[('if running', 'if'), ('if the UE enters EMM-IDLE mode', 'if')] ----> timer T3416 shall stopped
>> Upon receipt of an AUTHENTICATION RESPONSE message, the network stops the timer T3460 and checks the correctness of RES.
[('Upon receiving of an AUTHENTICATION RESPONSE message', 'upon')] ----> the network stops the timer T3460
>> Upon receipt of an AUTHENTICATION RESPONSE message, the network stops the timer T3460 and checks the correctness of RES.
[('Upon receiving of an AUTHENTICATION RESPONSE message', 'upon')] ----> the network checks the correctness of RES
>> If the authentication procedure has been completed successfully and the related eKSI is stored in the EPS security context of the network, the network shall include a different eKSI value in the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message when it initiates a new authentication procedure.
[('when it initiates a new authentication procedure', 'when'), ('the authentication procedure completed successfully', 'if'), ('the related eKSI stored in the EPS security context of the network', 'if')] ----> the network shall include a different eKSI value in the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message
>> Upon receipt of an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message, the network stops the timer T3460.
[('Upon receiving of an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message', 'upon')] ----> the network stops the timer T3460
>> If the authentication response returned by the UE is not valid, the network response depends upon the type of identity used by the UE in the initial NAS message, that is, if the GUTI was used;
[('If the authentication response returned by the UE is not valid', 'if')] ----> the network response depends upon the type of identity used by the UE in the initial NAS message , that is , if the GUTI was used
>> If the authentication response returned by the UE is not valid, the network response depends upon the type of identity used by the UE in the initial NAS message, that is, if the IMSI was used.
[('If the authentication response returned by the UE is not valid', 'if')] ----> the network response depends upon the type of identity used by the UE in the initial NAS message , that is , if the IMSI was used
>> If the GUTI was used, the network should initiate an identification procedure.
[('If the GUTI was used', 'if')] ----> the network should initiate an identification procedure
>> If the IMSI given by the UE during the identification procedure differs from the IMSI the network had associated with the GUTI, the authentication should be restarted with the correct parameters.
[('If the IMSI given by the UE during the identification procedure differs from the IMSI the network had associated with the GUTI', 'if')] ----> the authentication should restarted with the correct parameters
>> Otherwise, if the IMSI provided by the UE is the same as the IMSI stored in the network, the network should send an AUTHENTICATION REJECT message to the UE.
[('if the IMSI provided by the UE is the same as the IMSI stored in the network', 'if')] ----> Otherwise the network should send an AUTHENTICATION REJECT message to the UE
>> If the IMSI was used for identification in the initial NAS message, or the network decides not to initiate the identification procedure after an unsuccessful authentication procedure, the network should send an AUTHENTICATION REJECT message to the UE.
[('the network decides not to initiate the identification procedure after an unsuccessful authentication procedure', 'if')] ----> the network should send an AUTHENTICATION REJECT message to the UE
>> If the IMSI was used for identification in the initial NAS message, or the network decides not to initiate the identification procedure after an unsuccessful authentication procedure, the network should send an AUTHENTICATION REJECT message to the UE.
[('the IMSI used for identification in the initial NAS message', 'if')] ----> the network should send an AUTHENTICATION REJECT message to the UE
>> Upon receipt of an AUTHENTICATION REJECT message, if the message has been successfully integrity checked by the NAS, the UE shall set the update status to EU3 ROAMING NOT ALLOWED, delete the stored GUTI, TAI list, last visited registered TAI and KSIASME.
[('Upon receiving of an AUTHENTICATION REJECT message', 'upon'), ('if the message has been successfully integrity checked by the NAS', 'if')] ----> the UE shall set the update status to EU3 ROAMING NOT ALLOWED
>> Upon receipt of an AUTHENTICATION REJECT message, if the message has been successfully integrity checked by the NAS, the UE shall set the update status to EU3 ROAMING NOT ALLOWED, delete the stored GUTI, TAI list, last visited registered TAI and KSIASME.
[('Upon receiving of an AUTHENTICATION REJECT message', 'upon'), ('if the message has been successfully integrity checked by the NAS', 'if')] ----> the UE shall delete the stored GUTI , TAI list , last visited registered TAI and KSIASME
>> If the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services", then the UE shall set this counter to UE implementation-specific maximum value.
[('If the UE maintains a counter for " SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services "', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall set this counter to UE implementation-specific maximum value
>> If the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for non-GPRS services", then the UE shall set this counter to UE implementation-specific maximum value.
[('If the UE maintains a counter for " SIM/USIM considered invalid for non-GPRS services "', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall set this counter to UE implementation-specific maximum value
>> If A/Gb or Iu mode is supported by the UE, the UE shall in addition handle the GMM parameters GMM state, GPRS update status, P-TMSI, P-TMSI signature, RAI and GPRS ciphering key sequence number and the MM parameters update status, TMSI, LAI and ciphering key sequence number as specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [13] for the case when the authentication and ciphering procedure is not accepted by the network;
[('If A/Gb or Iu mode is supported by the UE', 'if')] ----> the UE shall in addition handle the GMM parameters GMM state , GPRS update status , P-TMSI , P-TMSI signature , RAI and GPRS ciphering key sequence number and the MM parameters update status , TMSI , LAI and ciphering key sequence number as specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [ 13 ] for the case when the authentication and ciphering procedure is not accepted by the network
>> Upon receipt of an AUTHENTICATION REJECT message, if the message is received without integrity protection, the UE shall start timer T3247 with a random value uniformly drawn from the range between 30 minutes and 60 minutes, if the timer is not running.
[('Upon receiving of an AUTHENTICATION REJECT message', 'upon'), ('if the message is received without integrity protection', 'if'), ('if the timer is not running', 'if')] ----> the UE shall start timer T3247 with a random value uniformly drawn from the range between 30 minutes and 60 minutes
>> Additionally, the UE shall, if the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services" events and the counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value, proceed as specified in subclause 5.3.7b, list item 1a for the case that the EMM cause value received is #3;
[('the UE maintains a counter for " SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services " events', 'if'), ('the counter has a value less than a UE implementation-specific maximum value', 'if')] ----> Additionally the UE shall proceed as specified in subclause 5.3.7b , list item 1a for the case that the EMM cause value received is # 3
>> If the AUTHENTICATION REJECT message is received by the UE, the UE shall abort any EMM signalling procedure, stop any of the retransmission timers that are running and enter state EMM-DEREGISTERED.
[('If the AUTHENTICATION REJECT message is received by the UE', 'if')] ----> the UE shall stop any of the retransmission timers that are running
>> If the AUTHENTICATION REJECT message is received by the UE, the UE shall abort any EMM signalling procedure, stop any of the retransmission timers that are running and enter state EMM-DEREGISTERED.
[('If the AUTHENTICATION REJECT message is received by the UE', 'if')] ----> the UE shall abort any EMM signalling procedure
>> If the AUTHENTICATION REJECT message is received by the UE, the UE shall abort any EMM signalling procedure, stop any of the retransmission timers that are running and enter state EMM-DEREGISTERED.
[('If the AUTHENTICATION REJECT message is received by the UE', 'if')] ----> the UE shall enter state EMM-DEREGISTERED
>> Depending on local requirements or operator preference for emergency bearer services, if the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established or is establishing a PDN connection for emergency bearer services, the MME need not follow the procedures specified for the authentication failure in the present subclause.
[('the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established', 'if')] ----> Depending on local requirements or operator preference for emergency bearer services the MME need not follow the procedures specified for the authentication failure in the present subclause
>> Depending on local requirements or operator preference for emergency bearer services, if the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established or is establishing a PDN connection for emergency bearer services, the MME need not follow the procedures specified for the authentication failure in the present subclause.
[('the UE establishing a PDN connection for emergency bearer services', 'if')] ----> Depending on local requirements or operator preference for emergency bearer services the MME need not follow the procedures specified for the authentication failure in the present subclause
>> Upon completion of the authentication procedure, if not initiated as part of another procedure, or upon completion of the EMM procedure or PDN connectivity request procedure, the MME shall deactivate all non-emergency EPS bearers, if any, by initiating an EPS bearer context deactivation procedure.
[('Upon completion of the authentication procedure', 'upon'), ('if not initiated as part of another procedure , or upon completion of the EMM procedure or PDN connectivity request procedure', 'if'), ('by initiating an EPS bearer context deactivation procedure', 'by')] ----> the MME shall deactivate all non-emergency EPS bearers , if any
>> Depending on local regulation and operator policy, if the UE is requesting attach for access to RLOS, the MME need not follow the procedures specified for the authentication failure in the present subclause.
[('if the UE is requesting attach for access to RLOS', 'if')] ----> Depending on local regulation and operator policy the MME need not follow the procedures specified for the authentication failure in the present subclause
>> In an EPS authentication challenge, the UE shall check the authenticity of the core network by means of the AUTN parameter received in the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message.
[('by means of the AUTN parameter received in the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message', 'by')] ----> In an EPS authentication challenge the UE shall check the authenticity of the core network
>> If the UE finds the MAC code to be invalid, the UE shall send an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message to the network, with the EMM cause #20 "MAC failure".
[('If the UE finds the MAC code to be invalid', 'if')] ----> the UE shall send an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message to the network with the EMM cause # 20 " MAC failure "
>> If the UE finds that the "separation bit" in the AMF field of AUTN supplied by the core network is 0, the UE shall send an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message to the network, with the EMM cause #26 "non-EPS authentication unacceptable".
[('If the UE finds that the " separation bit " in the AMF field of AUTN supplied by the core network is 0', 'if')] ----> the UE shall send an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message to the network with the EMM cause # 26 " non-EPS authentication unacceptable
>> If the UE finds the SQN to be out of range, the UE shall send an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message to the network, with the EMM cause #21 "synch failure" and a re-synchronization token AUTS provided by the USIM.
[('If the UE finds the SQN to be out of range', 'if')] ----> the UE shall send an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message to the network with the EMM cause # 21 " synch failure " and a re-synchronization token AUTS provided by the USIM
>> If the UE returns an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message to the network, the UE shall delete any previously stored RAND and RES and shall stop timer T3416, if running.
[('If the UE returns an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message to the network', 'if'), ('if running', 'if')] ----> the UE shall stop timer T3416
>> If the UE returns an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message to the network, the UE shall delete any previously stored RAND and RES and shall stop timer T3416, if running.
[('If the UE returns an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message to the network', 'if')] ----> the UE shall delete any previously stored RAND and RES
>> If the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established or is establishing such a PDN connection, additional UE requirements are specified in subclause 5.4.2.7, under "for items c, d, e".
[('the UE establishing such a PDN connection', 'if')] ----> additional UE requirements specified in subclause 5.4.2.7 under " for items c , d , e "
>> If the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established or is establishing such a PDN connection, additional UE requirements are specified in subclause 5.4.2.7, under "for items c, d, e".
[('the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established', 'if')] ----> additional UE requirements specified in subclause 5.4.2.7 under " for items c , d , e "
>> If the UE is attached for access to RLOS and has a PDN connection for RLOS established or is establishing such a PDN connection, additional UE requirements are specified in subclause 5.4.2.7, under "for items c, d, e".
[('the UE attached for access to RLOS', 'if'), ('the UE has a established such a PDN connection', 'if')] ----> additional UE requirements specified in subclause 5.4.2.7 under " for items c , d , e "
>> If the UE is attached for access to RLOS and has a PDN connection for RLOS established or is establishing such a PDN connection, additional UE requirements are specified in subclause 5.4.2.7, under "for items c, d, e".
[('the UE to RLOS and has a PDN connection for RLOS establishing such a PDN connection', 'if')] ----> additional UE requirements specified in subclause 5.4.2.7 under " for items c , d , e "
>> Upon detection of lower layer failure before the AUTHENTICATION RESPONSE message is received, the network shall abort the procedure.
[('Upon detection of lower layer failure before the AUTHENTICATION RESPONSE message is received', 'upon')] ----> the network shall abort the procedure
>> Upon the first receipt of an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message from the UE with EMM cause #20 "MAC failure", the network may initiate the identification procedure described in subclause 5.4.4.
[('Upon the first receiving of an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message from the UE with EMM cause # 20 " MAC failure "', 'upon')] ----> the network may initiate the identification procedure described in subclause 5.4.4
>> Upon receipt of the IDENTITY REQUEST message from the network, the UE shall send the IDENTITY RESPONSE message.
[('Upon receiving of the IDENTITY REQUEST message from the network', 'upon')] ----> the UE shall send the IDENTITY RESPONSE message
>> If the GUTI/IMSI mapping in the network was incorrect, the network should respond by sending a new AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message to the UE.
[('If the GUTI/IMSI mapping in the network was incorrect', 'if')] ----> the network should respond by sending a new AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message to the UE
>> Upon receiving the new AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message from the network, the UE shall stop the timer T3418, if running, and then process the challenge information as normal.
[('Upon receiving the new AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message from the network', 'upon'), ('if running', 'if')] ----> the UE shall stop the timer T3418
>> Upon receiving the new AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message from the network, the UE shall stop the timer T3418, if running, and then process the challenge information as normal.
[('Upon receiving the new AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message from the network', 'upon')] ----> the UE shall then process the challenge information as normal
>> If the GUTI/IMSI mapping in the network was correct, the network should terminate the authentication procedure by sending an AUTHENTICATION REJECT message.
[('If the GUTI/IMSI mapping in the network was correct', 'if'), ('by sending an AUTHENTICATION REJECT message', 'by')] ----> the network should terminate the authentication procedure
>> If the network is validated successfully, the UE shall send the AUTHENTICATION RESPONSE message to the network and shall start any retransmission timers if they were running and stopped when the UE received the first failed AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message.
[('If the network is validated successfully', 'if'), ('they running', 'if'), ('they stopped when the UE received the first failed AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message', 'if')] ----> the UE shall start any retransmission timers
>> If the network is validated successfully, the UE shall send the AUTHENTICATION RESPONSE message to the network and shall start any retransmission timers if they were running and stopped when the UE received the first failed AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message.
[('If the network is validated successfully', 'if')] ----> the UE shall send the AUTHENTICATION RESPONSE message to the network
>> If the UE receives the second AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message while T3418 is running, and the MAC value cannot be resolved, the UE shall follow the procedure specified in this subclause, item c, starting again from the beginning, or if the message contains a UMTS authentication challenge, the UE shall follow the procedure specified in item d. If the SQN is invalid, the UE shall proceed as specified in item e.
[('if the message contains a UMTS authentication challenge', 'if')] ----> the UE shall follow the procedure specified in item d
>> If the UE receives the second AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message while T3418 is running, and the MAC value cannot be resolved, the UE shall follow the procedure specified in this subclause, item c, starting again from the beginning, or if the message contains a UMTS authentication challenge, the UE shall follow the procedure specified in item d. If the SQN is invalid, the UE shall proceed as specified in item e.
[('If the SQN is invalid', 'if')] ----> the UE shall proceed as specified in item e
>> It can be assumed that the source of the authentication challenge is not genuine if any of the following occur:
[('if any of the following occur', 'if')] ----> can assumed that the source of the authentication challenge is not genuine
>> The authentication challenges shall be considered as consecutive only, if the authentication challenges causing the second and third authentication failure are received by the UE, while the timer T3418 or T3420 started after the previous authentication failure is running.
[('if the authentication challenges causing the second and third authentication failure are received by the UE , while the timer T3418 or T3420 started after the previous authentication failure is running', 'if')] ----> The authentication challenges shall considered as consecutive only
>> The UE shall stop timer T3418, if the timer is running and the UE enters EMM-IDLE mode, e.g. upon detection of a lower layer failure, release of the NAS signalling connection, or as the result of an inter-system handover to A/Gb mode or Iu mode.
[('upon detection of a lower layer failure , release of the NAS signalling connection', 'upon'), ('if the timer is running', 'if')] ----> The UE shall stop timer T3418 enters EMM-IDLE mode result of an inter-system handover to A/Gb mode
>> The UE shall stop timer T3418, if the timer is running and the UE enters EMM-IDLE mode, e.g. upon detection of a lower layer failure, release of the NAS signalling connection, or as the result of an inter-system handover to A/Gb mode or Iu mode.
[('upon detection of a lower layer failure , release of the NAS signalling connection , or as the result of an inter-system handover to A/Gb mode or Iu mode', 'upon')] ----> the UE enters EMM-IDLE mode , e.g .
>> When it has been deemed by the UE that the source of the authentication challenge is not genuine, the UE shall proceed as described in item f.
[('When it has been deemed by the UE that the source of the authentication challenge is not genuine', 'when')] ----> the UE shall proceed as described in item f
>> Upon the first receipt of an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message from the UE with EMM cause #26 "non-EPS authentication unacceptable", the network may initiate the identification procedure described in subclause 5.4.4.
[('Upon the first receiving of an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message from the UE with EMM cause # 26 " non-EPS authentication unacceptable "', 'upon')] ----> the network may initiate the identification procedure described in subclause 5.4.4
>> The UE shall stop timer T3420, if the timer is running and the UE enters EMM-IDLE mode, e.g. upon detection of a lower layer failure, release of the NAS signalling connection, or as the result of an inter-system handover to A/Gb mode or Iu mode.
[('upon detection of a lower layer failure , release of the NAS signalling connection', 'upon'), ('the timer running', 'if'), ('the UE enters EMM-IDLE mode', 'if')] ----> The UE shall stop timer T3420 or as the result of an inter-system handover to A/Gb mode or Iu mode
>> The UE shall stop timer T3420, if the timer is running and the UE enters EMM-IDLE mode, e.g. upon detection of a lower layer failure, release of the NAS signalling connection, or as the result of an inter-system handover to A/Gb mode or Iu mode.
[('upon detection of a lower layer failure , release of the NAS signalling connection , or as the result of an inter-system handover to A/Gb mode or Iu mode', 'upon')] ----> the UE enters EMM-IDLE mode , e.g .
>> Upon the first receipt of an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message from the UE with the EMM cause #21 "synch failure", the network shall use the returned AUTS parameter from the authentication failure parameter IE in the AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message, to re-synchronise.
[('Upon the first receiving of an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message from the UE with the EMM cause # 21 " synch failure "', 'upon')] ----> the network shall use the returned AUTS parameter from the authentication failure parameter IE in the AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message to re-synchronise
>> When re-synchronisation is complete, the network shall initiate the authentication procedure.
[('When re-synchronisation is complete', 'when')] ----> the network shall initiate the authentication procedure
>> Upon receipt of the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message, the UE shall stop the timer T3420, if running.
[('Upon receiving of the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message', 'upon'), ('if running', 'if')] ----> the UE shall stop the timer T3420
>> If the network is validated successfully while T3420 is running, the UE shall send the AUTHENTICATION RESPONSE message to the network and shall start any retransmission timers, if they were running and stopped when the UE received the first failed AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message.
[('If the network is validated successfully while T3420 is running', 'if'), ('they running', 'if'), ('they stopped when the UE received the first failed AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message', 'if')] ----> the UE shall start any retransmission timers
>> If the network is validated successfully while T3420 is running, the UE shall send the AUTHENTICATION RESPONSE message to the network and shall start any retransmission timers, if they were running and stopped when the UE received the first failed AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message.
[('If the network is validated successfully while T3420 is running', 'if')] ----> the UE shall send the AUTHENTICATION RESPONSE message to the network
>> If the UE receives the second AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message while T3420 is running, and the MAC value cannot be resolved, the UE shall follow the procedure specified in item c or if the message contains a UMTS authentication challenge, the UE shall proceed as specified in item d; if the SQN is invalid, the UE shall follow the procedure specified in this subclause, item e, starting again from the beginning.
[('the UE receives the second AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message while T3420 is running', 'if'), ('the MAC value cannot resolved', 'if')] ----> the UE shall follow the procedure specified in item c
>> If the UE receives the second AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message while T3420 is running, and the MAC value cannot be resolved, the UE shall follow the procedure specified in item c or if the message contains a UMTS authentication challenge, the UE shall proceed as specified in item d; if the SQN is invalid, the UE shall follow the procedure specified in this subclause, item e, starting again from the beginning.
[('if the SQN is invalid', 'if')] ----> the UE shall follow the procedure specified in this subclause , item e starting again from the beginning
>> Upon receipt of an AUTHENTICATION REJECT message, the UE shall perform the actions as specified in subclause 5.4.2.5.
[('Upon receiving of an AUTHENTICATION REJECT message', 'upon')] ----> the UE shall perform the actions as specified in subclause 5.4.2.5
>> If the UE deems that the network has failed the authentication check, then it shall request RRC to locally release the RRC connection and treat the active cell as barred.
[('If the UE deems that the network has failed the authentication check', 'if')] ----> then it shall request RRC to locally release the RRC connection and treat the active cell as barred
>> The UE shall start any retransmission timers, if they were running and stopped when the UE received the first AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message containing an incorrect authentication challenge data causing the authentication failure.
[('they running', 'if'), ('they stopped when the UE received the first AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message containing an incorrect authentication challenge data causing the authentication failure', 'if')] ----> The UE shall start any retransmission timers
>> The UE shall stop any of the timers T3418 and T3420, if running, and re-initiate the tracking area updating procedure.
[('if running', 'if')] ----> The UE shall stop any of the timers T3418 and T3420
>> The UE shall stop any of the timers T3418 and T3420, if running.
[('if running', 'if')] ----> The UE shall stop any of the timers T3418 and T3420
>> If the current TAI is still part of the TAI list, it is up to the UE implementation how to re-run the ongoing procedure that triggered the authentication procedure.
[('If the current TAI is still part of the TAI list', 'if')] ----> is up to the UE implementation how to re-run the ongoing procedure that triggered the authentication procedure
>> If the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message could not be delivered due to an intra MME handover and the target TA is included in the TAI list, then upon successful completion of the intra MME handover the MME shall retransmit the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message.
[('upon successful completion of the intra MME handover', 'upon'), ('the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message could not delivered due to an intra MME handover', 'if'), ('the target TA included in the TAI list', 'if')] ----> then the MME shall retransmit the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message
>> If a failure of handover procedure is reported by the lower layer and the S1 signalling connection exists, the MME shall retransmit the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message.
[('a failure of handover procedure reported by the lower layer', 'if'), ('the S1 signalling connection exists', 'if')] ----> the MME shall retransmit the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message
>> If a cell change into a new tracking area that is not in the TAI list occurs before the AUTHENTICATION RESPONSE message is sent, the UE may discard sending the AUTHENTICATION RESPONSE message to the network and continue with the initiation of tracking area updating procedure as described in subclause 5.5.3.
[('If a cell change into a new tracking area that is not in the TAI list occurs before the AUTHENTICATION RESPONSE message is sent', 'if')] ----> the UE may continue with the initiation of tracking area updating procedure as described in subclause 5.5.3
>> If a cell change into a new tracking area that is not in the TAI list occurs before the AUTHENTICATION RESPONSE message is sent, the UE may discard sending the AUTHENTICATION RESPONSE message to the network and continue with the initiation of tracking area updating procedure as described in subclause 5.5.3.
[('If a cell change into a new tracking area that is not in the TAI list occurs before the AUTHENTICATION RESPONSE message is sent', 'if')] ----> the UE may discard sending the AUTHENTICATION RESPONSE message to the network
>> Depending on local requirements or operator preference for emergency bearer services, if the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established or is establishing a PDN connection for emergency bearer services, the MME need not follow the procedures specified for the authentication failure specified in the present subclause.
[('the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established', 'if')] ----> Depending on local requirements or operator preference for emergency bearer services the MME need not follow the procedures specified for the authentication failure specified in the present subclause
>> Depending on local requirements or operator preference for emergency bearer services, if the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established or is establishing a PDN connection for emergency bearer services, the MME need not follow the procedures specified for the authentication failure specified in the present subclause.
[('the UE establishing a PDN connection for emergency bearer services', 'if')] ----> Depending on local requirements or operator preference for emergency bearer services the MME need not follow the procedures specified for the authentication failure specified in the present subclause
>> The MME may respond to the AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message by initiating the security mode control procedure selecting the "null integrity protection algorithm" EIA0, "null ciphering algorithm" EEA0 or may abort the authentication procedure and continue using the current security context, if any.
[('if any', 'if')] ----> The MME may continue using the current security context
>> The MME shall deactivate all non-emergency EPS bearer contexts, if any, by initiating an EPS bearer context deactivation procedure.
[('by initiating an EPS bearer context deactivation procedure', 'by')] ----> The MME shall deactivate all non-emergency EPS bearer contexts , if any
>> If there is an ongoing PDN connectivity procedure, the MME shall deactivate all non-emergency EPS bearer contexts upon completion of the PDN connectivity procedure.
[('upon completion of the PDN connectivity procedure', 'upon'), ('If there is an ongoing PDN connectivity procedure', 'if')] ----> the MME shall deactivate all non-emergency EPS bearer contexts
>> If a UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established or is establishing a PDN connection for emergency bearer services and sends an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message to the MME with the EMM cause appropriate for these cases and receives the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message before the timeout of timer T3418 or T3420, the UE shall deem that the network has passed the authentication check successfully, stop timer T3418 or T3420, respectively, and execute the security mode control procedure.
[('a UE sends an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message to the MME with the EMM cause appropriate for these cases', 'if'), ('If a UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established or is establishing a PDN connection for emergency bearer services receives the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message before the timeout of timer T3418 or T3420', 'if')] ----> the UE shall deem that the network has passed the authentication check successfully , stop timer T3418 or T3420 , respectively , and execute the security mode control procedure
>> If a UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established or is establishing a PDN connection for emergency bearer services when timer T3418 or T3420 expires, the UE shall not deem that the network has failed the authentication check and not behave as described in item f. Instead the UE shall continue using the current security context, if any, deactivate all non-emergency EPS bearer contexts, if any, by initiating UE requested PDN disconnect procedure.
[('a UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established', 'if')] ----> the UE shall not deem that the network has failed the authentication check and not behave as described in item f
>> If a UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established or is establishing a PDN connection for emergency bearer services when timer T3418 or T3420 expires, the UE shall not deem that the network has failed the authentication check and not behave as described in item f. Instead the UE shall continue using the current security context, if any, deactivate all non-emergency EPS bearer contexts, if any, by initiating UE requested PDN disconnect procedure.
[('by initiating UE requested PDN disconnect procedure', 'by')] ----> the UE deactivate all non-emergency EPS bearer contexts , if any
>> If a UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established or is establishing a PDN connection for emergency bearer services when timer T3418 or T3420 expires, the UE shall not deem that the network has failed the authentication check and not behave as described in item f. Instead the UE shall continue using the current security context, if any, deactivate all non-emergency EPS bearer contexts, if any, by initiating UE requested PDN disconnect procedure.
[('a UE establishing a PDN connection for emergency bearer services when timer T3418 or T3420 expires', 'if')] ----> the UE shall not deem that the network has failed the authentication check and not behave as described in item f
>> If there is an ongoing PDN connectivity procedure, the UE shall deactivate all non-emergency EPS bearer contexts upon completion of the PDN connectivity procedure.
[('upon completion of the PDN connectivity procedure', 'upon'), ('If there is an ongoing PDN connectivity procedure', 'if')] ----> the UE shall deactivate all non-emergency EPS bearer contexts
>> The UE shall start any retransmission timers if, they were running and stopped when the UE received the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message and detected an authentication failure;
[('if they running when the UE received the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message and detected an authentication failure', 'if'), ('they stopped when the UE received the AUTHENTICATION REQUEST message and detected an authentication failure', 'if')] ----> The UE shall start any retransmission timers
>> The UE shall start any retransmission timers if, the procedures associated with these timers have not yet been completed.
[('if , the procedures associated with these timers have not yet been completed', 'if')] ----> The UE shall start any retransmission timers
>> Depending on local regulation and operator policy, if the UE has a PDN connection for RLOS established or is establishing a PDN connection for RLOS, the MME need not follow the procedures specified for the authentication failure specified in the present subclause.
[('the UE has a PDN connection for RLOS established', 'if')] ----> Depending on local regulation and operator policy the MME need not follow the procedures specified for the authentication failure specified in the present subclause
>> Depending on local regulation and operator policy, if the UE has a PDN connection for RLOS established or is establishing a PDN connection for RLOS, the MME need not follow the procedures specified for the authentication failure specified in the present subclause.
[('the UE establishing a PDN connection for RLOS', 'if')] ----> Depending on local regulation and operator policy the MME need not follow the procedures specified for the authentication failure specified in the present subclause
>> If a UE has a PDN connection for RLOS established or is establishing a PDN connection for RLOS and sends an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message to the MME with the EMM cause appropriate for these cases and receives the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message before the timeout of timer T3418 or T3420, the UE shall deem that the network has passed the authentication check successfully, stop timer T3418 or T3420, respectively, and execute the security mode control procedure.
[('a UE sends an AUTHENTICATION FAILURE message to the MME with the EMM cause', 'if'), ('If a UE has a PDN connection for RLOS established or is establishing a PDN connection for RLOS receives the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message before the timeout of timer T3418 or T3420', 'if')] ----> the UE shall deem that the network has passed the authentication check successfully , stop timer T3418 or T3420 , respectively , and execute the security mode control procedure
>> If a UE has a PDN connection for RLOS established or is establishing a PDN connection for RLOS when timer T3418 or T3420 expires, the UE shall not deem that the network has failed the authentication check and not behave as described in item f. Instead the UE shall continue using the current security context, if any.
[('a UE has a PDN connection for RLOS established', 'if')] ----> the UE shall not deem that the network has failed the authentication check and not behave as described in item f
>> If a UE has a PDN connection for RLOS established or is establishing a PDN connection for RLOS when timer T3418 or T3420 expires, the UE shall not deem that the network has failed the authentication check and not behave as described in item f. Instead the UE shall continue using the current security context, if any.
[('a UE establishing a PDN connection for RLOS when timer T3418 or T3420 expires', 'if')] ----> the UE shall not deem that the network has failed the authentication check and not behave as described in item f
>> The MME initiates the NAS security mode control procedure by sending a SECURITY MODE COMMAND message to the UE and starting timer T3460.
[('sending a SECURITY MODE COMMAND message to the UE', 'by'), ('starting timer T3460', 'by')] ----> The MME initiates the NAS security mode control procedure
>> The MME shall create a locally generated KASME and send the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message including a KSI value in the NAS key set identifier IE set to "000" and EIA0 and EEA0 as the selected NAS security algorithms only when the security mode control procedure is initiated, during an attach procedure for emergency bearer services if no shared EPS security context is available;

>> The MME shall create a locally generated KASME and send the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message including a KSI value in the NAS key set identifier IE set to "000" and EIA0 and EEA0 as the selected NAS security algorithms only when the security mode control procedure is initiated, after a failed authentication procedure for a UE that has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services or that is establishing a PDN connection for emergency bearer services, if continued usage of a shared security context is not possible;

>> The MME shall create a locally generated KASME and send the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message including a KSI value in the NAS key set identifier IE set to "000" and EIA0 and EEA0 as the selected NAS security algorithms only when the security mode control procedure is initiated, after a failed authentication procedure for a UE that has a PDN connection for access to RLOS or that is establishing a PDN connection for access to RLOS, if continued usage of a valid security context is not possible.
[('if continued usage of a valid security context is not possible', 'if')] ----> The MME shall send the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message including a KSI value in the NAS key set identifier IE set to " 000 " and EIA0 and EEA0 as the selected NAS security algorithms only when the security mode control procedure is initiated , after a failed authentication procedure for a UE that has a PDN connection for access to RLOS or that is establishing a PDN connection for access to RLOS
>> The UE shall process a SECURITY MODE COMMAND message including a KSI value in the NAS key set identifier IE set to "000" and EIA0 and EEA0 as the selected NAS security algorithms and, if accepted, create a locally generated KASME when the security mode control procedure is initiated, during an attach procedure for emergency bearer services;
[('when the security mode control procedure is initiated', 'when'), ('if accepted', 'if')] ----> The UE shall create a locally generated KASME during an attach procedure for emergency bearer services
>> The UE shall process a SECURITY MODE COMMAND message including a KSI value in the NAS key set identifier IE set to "000" and EIA0 and EEA0 as the selected NAS security algorithms and, if accepted, create a locally generated KASME when the security mode control procedure is initiated, during an attach procedure for access to RLOS;
[('when the security mode control procedure is initiated', 'when'), ('if accepted', 'if')] ----> The UE shall create a locally generated KASME during an attach procedure for access to RLOS
>> The UE shall process a SECURITY MODE COMMAND message including a KSI value in the NAS key set identifier IE set to "000" and EIA0 and EEA0 as the selected NAS security algorithms and, if accepted, create a locally generated KASME when the security mode control procedure is initiated, during a tracking area updating procedure when the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services;

>> The UE shall process a SECURITY MODE COMMAND message including a KSI value in the NAS key set identifier IE set to "000" and EIA0 and EEA0 as the selected NAS security algorithms and, if accepted, create a locally generated KASME when the security mode control procedure is initiated, during a tracking area updating procedure when the UE has a PDN connection for access to RLOS;

>> The UE shall process a SECURITY MODE COMMAND message including a KSI value in the NAS key set identifier IE set to "000" and EIA0 and EEA0 as the selected NAS security algorithms and, if accepted, create a locally generated KASME when the security mode control procedure is initiated, during a service request procedure when the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services;

>> The UE shall process a SECURITY MODE COMMAND message including a KSI value in the NAS key set identifier IE set to "000" and EIA0 and EEA0 as the selected NAS security algorithms and, if accepted, create a locally generated KASME when the security mode control procedure is initiated, during a service request procedure when the UE has a PDN connection for access to RLOS;
[('when the security mode control procedure is initiated', 'when'), ('if accepted', 'if')] ----> The UE shall create a locally generated KASME during a service request procedure when the UE has a PDN connection for access to RLOS
>> The UE shall process a SECURITY MODE COMMAND message including a KSI value in the NAS key set identifier IE set to "000" and EIA0 and EEA0 as the selected NAS security algorithms and, if accepted, create a locally generated KASME when the security mode control procedure is initiated, after an authentication procedure when the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services or is establishing a PDN connection for emergency bearer services;

>> The UE shall process a SECURITY MODE COMMAND message including a KSI value in the NAS key set identifier IE set to "000" and EIA0 and EEA0 as the selected NAS security algorithms and, if accepted, create a locally generated KASME when the security mode control procedure is initiated, after an authentication procedure when the UE has a PDN connection for access to RLOS or is establishing a PDN connection for access to RLOS.
