>> Upon receipt of a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message including a GPRS ciphering key sequence number IE, if the MME does not have the valid current EPS security context indicated by the UE, the MME shall either, indicate the use of the new mapped EPS security context to the UE by setting the type of security context flag in the NAS key set identifier IE to "mapped security context" and the KSI value related to the security context of the source system;
[('Upon receiving of a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message including a GPRS ciphering key sequence number IE', 'upon'), ('if the MME does not have the valid current EPS security context indicated by the UE', 'if'), ('setting the type of security context flag in the NAS key set identifier IE', 'by'), ('mapped security context', 'by'), ('the KSI value related to the security context of the source system', 'by')] ----> the MME shall either indicate the use of the new mapped EPS security context to the UE
>> Upon receipt of a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message including a GPRS ciphering key sequence number IE, if the MME does not have the valid current EPS security context indicated by the UE, the MME shall either, set the KSI value "000" in the NAS key set identifier IE if the MME sets EIA0 and EEA0 as the selected NAS security algorithms for a UE that has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services.
[('Upon receiving of a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message including a GPRS ciphering key sequence number IE', 'upon'), ('if the MME does not have the valid current EPS security context indicated by the UE', 'if'), ('if the MME sets EIA0 and EEA0 as the selected NAS security algorithms for a UE that has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services', 'if')] ----> the MME shall either set the KSI value " 000 " in the NAS key set identifier IE
>> While having a current mapped EPS security context with the UE, if the MME wants to take the native EPS security context into use, the MME shall include the eKSI that indicates the native EPS security context in the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message.
[('if the MME wants to take the native EPS security context into use', 'if')] ----> While having a current mapped EPS security context with the UE the MME shall include the eKSI that indicates the native EPS security context in the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message
>> If the MME supports handling of UE additional security capabilities and the UE included a UE additional security capability IE in the message to the network, the MME shall include the replayed additional security capabilities of the UE.
[('the MME supports handling of UE additional security capabilities', 'if'), ('the UE included a UE additional security capability IE in the message to the network', 'if')] ----> the MME shall include the replayed additional security capabilities of the UE
>> The MME shall include both the nonceMME and the nonceUE when creating a mapped EPS security context during inter-system change from A/Gb mode to S1 mode or Iu mode to S1 mode in EMM-IDLE mode.
[('when creating a mapped EPS security context during inter-system change from A/Gb mode to S1 mode or Iu mode to S1 mode in EMM-IDLE mode', 'when')] ----> The MME shall include both the nonceMME and the nonceUE
>> If, during an ongoing attach or tracking area updating procedure, the MME is initiating a SECURITY MODE COMMAND and the ATTACH REQUEST or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message is received without integrity protection or does not successfully pass the integrity check at the MME, the MME shall calculate the HASHMME of the entire plain ATTACH REQUEST or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message as described in 3GPP TS 33.401 [19] and shall include the HASHMME in the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message.
[('If during an ongoing attach or tracking area updating procedure the MME initiating a SECURITY MODE COMMAND', 'if')] ----> the MME shall include the HASHMME in the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message
>> If, during an ongoing attach or tracking area updating procedure, the MME is initiating a SECURITY MODE COMMAND and the ATTACH REQUEST or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message is received without integrity protection or does not successfully pass the integrity check at the MME, the MME shall calculate the HASHMME of the entire plain ATTACH REQUEST or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message as described in 3GPP TS 33.401 [19] and shall include the HASHMME in the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message.
[('the ATTACH REQUEST or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message received without integrity protection', 'if')] ----> the MME shall calculate the HASHMME of the entire plain ATTACH REQUEST or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message as described in 3GPP TS 33.401 [ 19 ]
>> If, during an ongoing attach or tracking area updating procedure, the MME is initiating a SECURITY MODE COMMAND and the ATTACH REQUEST or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message is received without integrity protection or does not successfully pass the integrity check at the MME, the MME shall calculate the HASHMME of the entire plain ATTACH REQUEST or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message as described in 3GPP TS 33.401 [19] and shall include the HASHMME in the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message.
[('the ATTACH REQUEST or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message not successfully pass the integrity check at the MME', 'if')] ----> the MME shall include the HASHMME in the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message
>> If, during an ongoing attach or tracking area updating procedure, the MME is initiating a SECURITY MODE COMMAND and the ATTACH REQUEST or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message is received without integrity protection or does not successfully pass the integrity check at the MME, the MME shall calculate the HASHMME of the entire plain ATTACH REQUEST or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message as described in 3GPP TS 33.401 [19] and shall include the HASHMME in the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message.
[('If during an ongoing attach or tracking area updating procedure the MME initiating a SECURITY MODE COMMAND', 'if')] ----> the MME shall calculate the HASHMME of the entire plain ATTACH REQUEST or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message as described in 3GPP TS 33.401 [ 19 ]
>> If, during an ongoing attach or tracking area updating procedure, the MME is initiating a SECURITY MODE COMMAND and the ATTACH REQUEST or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message is received without integrity protection or does not successfully pass the integrity check at the MME, the MME shall calculate the HASHMME of the entire plain ATTACH REQUEST or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message as described in 3GPP TS 33.401 [19] and shall include the HASHMME in the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message.
[('the ATTACH REQUEST or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message not successfully pass the integrity check at the MME', 'if')] ----> the MME shall calculate the HASHMME of the entire plain ATTACH REQUEST or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message as described in 3GPP TS 33.401 [ 19 ]
>> If, during an ongoing attach or tracking area updating procedure, the MME is initiating a SECURITY MODE COMMAND and the ATTACH REQUEST or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message is received without integrity protection or does not successfully pass the integrity check at the MME, the MME shall calculate the HASHMME of the entire plain ATTACH REQUEST or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message as described in 3GPP TS 33.401 [19] and shall include the HASHMME in the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message.
[('the ATTACH REQUEST or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message received without integrity protection', 'if')] ----> the MME shall include the HASHMME in the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message
>> Upon receipt of the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message, the UE shall check whether the security mode command can be accepted or not.
[('Upon receiving of the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message', 'upon')] ----> the UE shall check whether the security mode command can be accepted or not
>> This is done by performing the integrity check of the message and by checking that the received replayed UE security capabilities, the received replayed UE additional security capabilities, if included in the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message, and the received nonceUE have not been altered compared to the latest values that the UE sent to the network.
[('performing the integrity check of the message', 'by'), ('checking that the received replayed UE security capabilities', 'by'), ('replayed UE additional security capabilities if included in the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message', 'by'), ('the received replayed UE additional security capabilities included in the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message', 'by'), ('the received nonceUE not altered compared to the latest values that the UE sent to the network', 'by')] ----> This done
>> However, the UE is not required to perform the checking of the received nonceUE if the UE does not want to re-generate the K'ASME.
[("if the UE does not want to re-generate the K'ASME", 'if')] ----> However the UE not required to perform the checking of the received nonceUE
>> When the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established or the UE is establishing a PDN connection for emergency bearer services or the UE is requesting attach for access to RLOS, the UE is not required to locally re-generate the KASME.
[('the UE establishing a PDN connection for emergency bearer services', 'when')] ----> the UE not required to locally re-generate the KASME
>> When the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established or the UE is establishing a PDN connection for emergency bearer services or the UE is requesting attach for access to RLOS, the UE is not required to locally re-generate the KASME.
[('the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established', 'when')] ----> the UE not required to locally re-generate the KASME
>> When the UE has a PDN connection for emergency bearer services established or the UE is establishing a PDN connection for emergency bearer services or the UE is requesting attach for access to RLOS, the UE is not required to locally re-generate the KASME.
[('the UE requesting attach for access to RLOS', 'when')] ----> the UE not required to locally re-generate the KASME
>> If the type of security context flag included in the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message is set to "native security context" and if the KSI matches a valid non-current native EPS security context held in the UE while the UE has a mapped EPS security context as the current EPS security context, the UE shall take the non-current native EPS security context into use which then becomes the current native EPS security context and delete the mapped EPS security context.
[('the type of security context flag included in the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message set to " native security context "', 'if'), ('the KSI matches a valid non-current native EPS security context held in the UE while the UE has a mapped EPS security context as the current EPS security context', 'if')] ----> the UE shall take the non-current native EPS security context into use
>> If the type of security context flag included in the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message is set to "native security context" and if the KSI matches a valid non-current native EPS security context held in the UE while the UE has a mapped EPS security context as the current EPS security context, the UE shall take the non-current native EPS security context into use which then becomes the current native EPS security context and delete the mapped EPS security context.
[('the type of security context flag included in the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message set to " native security context "', 'if'), ('the KSI matches a valid non-current native EPS security context held in the UE while the UE has a mapped EPS security context as the current EPS security context', 'if')] ----> the UE shall delete the mapped EPS security context
>> If the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message can be accepted, the UE shall take the EPS security context indicated in the message into use.
[('If the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message can be accepted', 'if')] ----> the UE shall take the EPS security context indicated in the message into use
>> The UE shall in addition reset the uplink NAS COUNT counter if, the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message is received in order to take an EPS security context into use created after a successful execution of the EPS authentication procedure;
[('if , the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message is received in order to take an EPS security context into use created after a successful execution of the EPS authentication procedure', 'if')] ----> The UE shall in addition reset the uplink NAS COUNT counter
>> The UE shall in addition reset the uplink NAS COUNT counter if, the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message received includes the type of security context flag set to "mapped security context" in the NAS key set identifier IE the eKSI does not match the current EPS security context, if it is a mapped EPS security context.
[('if , the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message received includes the type of security context flag set to " mapped security context " in the NAS key set identifier IE the eKSI does not match the current EPS security context , if it is a mapped EPS security context', 'if')] ----> The UE shall in addition reset the uplink NAS COUNT counter
>> If the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message can be accepted and a new EPS security context is taken into use and SECURITY MODE COMMAND message does not indicate the "null integrity protection algorithm" EIA0 as the selected NAS integrity algorithm, the UE shall, if the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message has been successfully integrity checked using an estimated downlink NAS COUNT equal 0, then the UE shall set the downlink NAS COUNT of this new EPS security context to 0;
[('if the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message has been successfully integrity checked using an estimated downlink NAS COUNT equal 0', 'if'), ('the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message can accepted', 'if'), ('a new EPS security context taken into use', 'if'), ('SECURITY MODE COMMAND message not indicate the " null integrity protection algorithm " EIA0 as the selected NAS integrity algorithm', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall set the downlink NAS COUNT of this new EPS security context to 0
>> If the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message can be accepted, the UE shall send a SECURITY MODE COMPLETE message integrity protected with the selected NAS integrity algorithm and the EPS NAS integrity key based on the KASME or mapped K'ASME if the type of security context flag is set to "mapped security context" indicated by the eKSI.
[('If the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message can be accepted', 'if'), ('if the type of security context flag is set to " mapped security context " indicated by the eKSI', 'if')] ----> the UE shall send a SECURITY MODE COMPLETE message integrity protected with the selected NAS integrity algorithm and the EPS NAS integrity key based on the KASME or mapped K'ASME
>> When the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message includes the type of security context flag set to "mapped security context" in the NAS key set identifier IE, the nonceMME and the nonceUE, then the UE shall either, generate K'ASME from both the nonceMME and the nonceUE as indicated in 3GPP TS 33.401 [19];
[('When the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message includes the type of security context flag set to " mapped security context " in the NAS key set identifier IE , the nonceMME and the nonceUE', 'when')] ----> then the UE shall either generate K'ASME from both the nonceMME and the nonceUE as indicated in 3GPP TS 33.401 [ 19
>> When the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message includes the type of security context flag set to "mapped security context" in the NAS key set identifier IE, the nonceMME and the nonceUE, then the UE shall either, check whether the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message indicates the eKSI of the current EPS security context, if it is a mapped EPS security context, in order not to re-generate the K'ASME.
[('When the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message includes the type of security context flag set to " mapped security context " in the NAS key set identifier IE , the nonceMME and the nonceUE', 'when')] ----> then the UE shall either check whether the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message indicates the eKSI of the current EPS security context , if it is a mapped EPS security context in order not to re-generate the K'ASME
>> Furthermore, if the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message can be accepted, the UE shall cipher the SECURITY MODE COMPLETE message with the selected NAS ciphering algorithm and the EPS NAS ciphering key based on the KASME or mapped K'ASME indicated by the eKSI.
[('if the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message can be accepted', 'if')] ----> Furthermore the UE shall cipher the SECURITY MODE COMPLETE message with the selected NAS ciphering algorithm and the EPS NAS ciphering key based on the KASME or mapped K'ASME indicated by the eKSI
>> If the MME indicated in the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message that the IMEISV is requested, the UE shall include its IMEISV in the SECURITY MODE COMPLETE message.
[('If the MME indicated in the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message that the IMEISV is requested', 'if')] ----> the UE shall include its IMEISV in the SECURITY MODE COMPLETE message
>> In WB-S1 mode, if the MME indicated in the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message that the UE radio capability ID is requested, the UE shall, if the UE has an applicable network-assigned UE radio capability ID for the current UE radio configuration in the selected PLMN, include the applicable network-assigned UE radio capability ID in the UE radio capability ID IE of the SECURITY MODE COMPLETE message;
[('if the MME indicated in the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message that the UE radio capability ID is requested', 'if'), ('if the UE has an applicable network-assigned UE radio capability ID for the current UE radio configuration in the selected PLMN', 'if')] ----> In WB-S1 mode the UE shall include the applicable network-assigned UE radio capability ID in the UE radio capability ID IE of the SECURITY MODE COMPLETE message
>> In WB-S1 mode, if the MME indicated in the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message that the UE radio capability ID is requested, the UE shall, if the UE, does not have an applicable network-assigned UE radio capability ID for the current UE radio configuration in the selected PLMN;
[('if the MME indicated in the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message that the UE radio capability ID is requested', 'if'), ('if the UE', 'if')] ----> In WB-S1 mode the UE shall not have an applicable network-assigned UE radio capability ID for the current UE radio configuration in the selected PLMN
>> In WB-S1 mode, if the MME indicated in the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message that the UE radio capability ID is requested, the UE shall, if the UE, has an applicable manufacturer-assigned UE radio capability ID for the current UE radio configuration,
[('if the MME indicated in the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message that the UE radio capability ID is requested', 'if'), ('if the UE', 'if')] ----> In WB-S1 mode the UE shall has an applicable manufacturer-assigned UE radio capability ID for the current UE radio configuration
>> In WB-S1 mode, if the MME indicated in the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message that the UE radio capability ID is requested, the UE shall, if the UE, include the applicable manufacturer-assigned UE radio capability ID in the UE radio capability ID IE of the SECURITY MODE COMPLETE message.
[('if the MME indicated in the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message that the UE radio capability ID is requested', 'if'), ('if the UE', 'if')] ----> In WB-S1 mode the UE shall include the applicable manufacturer-assigned UE radio capability ID in the UE radio capability ID IE of the SECURITY MODE COMPLETE message
>> If, during an ongoing attach or tracking area updating procedure, the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message includes a HASHMME, the UE shall compare HASHMME with a hash value locally calculated as described in 3GPP TS 33.401 [19] from the entire plain ATTACH REQUEST or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message that the UE had sent to initiate the procedure.
[('If , during an ongoing attach or tracking area updating procedure , the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message includes a HASHMME', 'if')] ----> the UE shall compare HASHMME with a hash value locally calculated as described in 3GPP TS 33.401 [ 19 ] from the entire plain ATTACH REQUEST or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message that the UE had sent to initiate the procedure
>> If HASHMME and the locally calculated hash value are different, the UE shall include the complete ATTACH REQUEST or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message which the UE had previously sent in the Replayed NAS message container IE of the SECURITY MODE COMPLETE message.
[('If HASHMME and the locally calculated hash value are different', 'if')] ----> the UE shall include the complete ATTACH REQUEST or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message which the UE had previously sent in the Replayed NAS message container IE of the SECURITY MODE COMPLETE message
>> The MME shall, upon receipt of the SECURITY MODE COMPLETE message, stop timer T3460.
[('upon receiving of the SECURITY MODE COMPLETE message', 'upon')] ----> The MME shall stop timer T3460
>> If the SECURITY MODE COMPLETE message contains a Replayed NAS container message IE with an ATTACH REQUEST or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message, the MME shall complete the ongoing attach or tracking area updating procedure by considering the ATTACH REQUEST or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message contained in the Replayed NAS message container IE as the message that triggered the procedure.
[('If the SECURITY MODE COMPLETE message contains a Replayed NAS container message IE with an ATTACH REQUEST or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message', 'if'), ('by considering the ATTACH REQUEST or TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message contained in the Replayed NAS message container IE as the message that triggered the procedure', 'by')] ----> the MME shall complete the ongoing attach or tracking area updating procedure
>> If the security mode command cannot be accepted, the UE shall send a SECURITY MODE REJECT message.
[('If the security mode command cannot be accepted', 'if')] ----> the UE shall send a SECURITY MODE REJECT message
>> Upon receipt of the SECURITY MODE REJECT message, the MME shall stop timer T3460.
[('Upon receiving of the SECURITY MODE REJECT message', 'upon')] ----> the MME shall stop timer T3460
>> If the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message could not be delivered due to an intra MME handover and the target TA is included in the TAI list, then upon successful completion of the intra MME handover the MME shall retransmit the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message.
[('upon successful completion of the intra MME handover', 'upon'), ('the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message could not delivered due to an intra MME handover', 'if'), ('the target TA included in the TAI list', 'if')] ----> then the MME shall retransmit the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message
>> If a failure of the handover procedure is reported by the lower layer and the S1 signalling connection exists, the MME shall retransmit the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message.
[('a failure of the handover procedure reported by the lower layer', 'if'), ('the S1 signalling connection exists', 'if')] ----> the MME shall retransmit the SECURITY MODE COMMAND message
>> The network initiates the identification procedure by sending an IDENTITY REQUEST message to the UE and starting the timer T3470.
[('sending an IDENTITY REQUEST message to the UE', 'by'), ('starting the timer T3470', 'by')] ----> The network initiates the identification procedure
>> Upon receipt of the IDENTITY REQUEST message the UE shall send an IDENTITY RESPONSE message to the network.
[('Upon receiving of the IDENTITY REQUEST message', 'upon')] ----> the UE shall send an IDENTITY RESPONSE message to the network
>> Upon receipt of the IDENTITY RESPONSE the network shall stop the timer T3470.
[('Upon receiving of the IDENTITY RESPONSE', 'upon')] ----> the network shall stop the timer T3470
>> If the UE cannot encode the requested identity in the IDENTITY RESPONSE message, e.g. because no valid USIM is available, then it shall encode the identity type as "no identity".
[('If the UE cannot encode the requested identity in the IDENTITY RESPONSE message ,', 'if')] ----> e.g because no valid USIM is available then it shall encode the identity type as " no identity "
>> Upon detection of a lower layer failure before the IDENTITY RESPONSE is received, the network shall abort any ongoing EMM procedure.
[('Upon detection of a lower layer failure before the IDENTITY RESPONSE is received', 'upon')] ----> the network shall abort any ongoing EMM procedure
>> If the network receives an ATTACH REQUEST message before the ongoing identification procedure has been completed and no attach procedure is pending on the network, the network shall proceed with the attach procedure.
[('the network receives an ATTACH REQUEST message before the ongoing identification procedure has been completed', 'if'), ('no attach procedure pending on the network', 'if')] ----> the network shall proceed with the attach procedure
>> If one or more of the information elements in the ATTACH REQUEST message differ from the ones received within the previous ATTACH REQUEST message, the network shall proceed with the new attach procedure;
[('If one or more of the information elements in the ATTACH REQUEST message differ from the ones received within the previous ATTACH REQUEST message', 'if')] ----> the network shall proceed with the new attach procedure
>> If the information elements do not differ, then the network shall not treat any further this new ATTACH REQUEST.
[('If the information elements do not differ', 'if')] ----> then the network shall not treat any further this new ATTACH REQUEST
>> If the network receives a DETACH REQUEST message before the ongoing identification procedure has been completed, the network shall abort the identification procedure and shall progress the detach procedure.
[('If the network receives a DETACH REQUEST message before the ongoing identification procedure has been completed', 'if')] ----> the network shall abort the identification procedure
>> If the network receives a DETACH REQUEST message before the ongoing identification procedure has been completed, the network shall abort the identification procedure and shall progress the detach procedure.
[('If the network receives a DETACH REQUEST message before the ongoing identification procedure has been completed', 'if')] ----> the network shall progress the detach procedure
>> If the network receives a DETACH REQUEST message before the ongoing identification procedure has been completed, the network shall complete the identification procedure and shall respond to the detach procedure as described in subclause 5.5.2.
[('If the network receives a DETACH REQUEST message before the ongoing identification procedure has been completed', 'if')] ----> the network shall respond to the detach procedure as described in subclause 5.5.2
>> If the network receives a DETACH REQUEST message before the ongoing identification procedure has been completed, the network shall complete the identification procedure and shall respond to the detach procedure as described in subclause 5.5.2.
[('If the network receives a DETACH REQUEST message before the ongoing identification procedure has been completed', 'if')] ----> the network shall complete the identification procedure
>> If the network receives a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message before the ongoing identification procedure has been completed, the network shall progress both procedures.
[('If the network receives a TRACKING AREA UPDATE REQUEST message before the ongoing identification procedure has been completed', 'if')] ----> the network shall progress both procedures
>> If the network receives an EXTENDED SERVICE REQUEST message for CS fallback or 1xCS fallback before the ongoing identification procedure has been completed, the network shall progress both procedures.
[('If the network receives an EXTENDED SERVICE REQUEST message for CS fallback or 1x CS fallback before the ongoing identification procedure has been completed', 'if')] ----> the network shall progress both procedures
>> If the IDENTITY REQUEST message could not be delivered due to an intra MME handover and the target TA is included in the TAI list, then upon successful completion of the intra MME handover the MME shall retransmit the IDENTITY REQUEST message.
[('upon successful completion of the intra MME handover', 'upon'), ('the IDENTITY REQUEST message could not delivered due to an intra MME handover', 'if'), ('the target TA included in the TAI list', 'if')] ----> then the MME shall retransmit the IDENTITY REQUEST message
>> If a failure of the handover procedure is reported by the lower layer and the S1 signalling connection exists, the MME shall retransmit the IDENTITY REQUEST message.
[('a failure of the handover procedure reported by the lower layer', 'if'), ('the S1 signalling connection exists', 'if')] ----> the MME shall retransmit the IDENTITY REQUEST message
>> The UE may use the received information if the UE supports implementing this message.
[('if the UE supports implementing this message', 'if')] ----> The UE may use the received information
>> If more than one EMM INFORMATION message is sent, the messages need not have the same content.
[('If more than one EMM INFORMATION message is sent', 'if')] ----> the messages need not have the same content
>> When the UE receives an EMM INFORMATION message, it shall accept the message and optionally use the contents to update appropriate information stored within the UE.
[('When the UE receives an EMM INFORMATION message', 'when')] ----> it shall optionally use the contents to update appropriate information stored within the UE
>> When the UE receives an EMM INFORMATION message, it shall accept the message and optionally use the contents to update appropriate information stored within the UE.
[('When the UE receives an EMM INFORMATION message', 'when')] ----> it shall accept the message
>> If the UE does not support the EMM information message the UE shall ignore the contents of the message and return an EMM STATUS message with EMM cause #97 "message type non-existent or not implemented".
[('If the UE does not support the EMM information message', 'if')] ----> the UE shall ignore the contents of the message
>> If the UE does not support the EMM information message the UE shall ignore the contents of the message and return an EMM STATUS message with EMM cause #97 "message type non-existent or not implemented".
[('If the UE does not support the EMM information message', 'if')] ----> the UE shall return an EMM STATUS message with EMM cause #97 " message type non-existent or not implemented "
>> If the EMM INFORMATION message could not be delivered due to an intra MME handover and the target TA is included in the TAI list, then upon successful completion of the intra MME handover the MME shall retransmit the EMM INFORMATION message.
[('upon successful completion of the intra MME handover', 'upon'), ('the EMM INFORMATION message could not delivered due to an intra MME handover', 'if'), ('the target TA included in the TAI list', 'if')] ----> then the MME shall retransmit the EMM INFORMATION message
>> If a failure of the handover procedure is reported by the lower layer and the S1 signalling connection exists, the MME shall retransmit the EMM INFORMATION message.
[('a failure of the handover procedure reported by the lower layer', 'if'), ('the S1 signalling connection exists', 'if')] ----> the MME shall retransmit the EMM INFORMATION message
>> This information is taken into account when deciding whether to initiate attach for emergency bearer services in WB-S1 mode.
[('when deciding whether to initiate attach for emergency bearer services in WB-S1 mode', 'when')] ----> This information taken into account
>> If the MME does not support an attach for emergency bearer services, the MME shall reject any request to attach with an attach type set to "EPS emergency attach".
[('If the MME does not support an attach for emergency bearer services', 'if')] ----> the MME shall reject any request to attach with an attach type set to " EPS emergency attach "
>> This information is taken into account when deciding whether to initiate attach for access to RLOS in WB-S1 mode.
[('when deciding whether to initiate attach for access to RLOS in WB-S1 mode', 'when')] ----> This information taken into account
>> Furthermore, if the UE requested PDN connectivity, a default bearer is established between the UE and the PDN GW, thus enabling always-on IP connectivity to the UE.
[('if the UE requested PDN connectivity', 'if')] ----> Furthermore a default bearer established between the UE and the PDN GW thus enabling always-on IP connectivity to the UE
>> If the attach request included information to request PDN connectivity, a default bearer is also established between the UE and the PDN.
[('If the attach request included information to request PDN connectivity', 'if')] ----> a default bearer also established between the UE and the PDN
>> If EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection is supported by the UE and the MME, a default bearer need not be requested by the UE during the attach procedure.
[('If EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection is supported by the UE and the MME', 'if')] ----> a default bearer need not be requested by the UE during the attach procedure
>> If EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection is not supported by the UE or the MME, then the UE shall request establishment of a default bearer.
[('If EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection is not supported by the UE or the MME', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall request establishment of a default bearer
>> Whenever an ATTACH REJECT message with the EMM cause #11 "PLMN not allowed" is received by the UE, the chosen PLMN identity shall be stored in the "forbidden PLMN list" and if the UE is configured to use timer T3245 then the UE shall start timer T3245 and proceed as described in subclause 5.3.7a.
[('if the UE is configured to use timer T3245', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall proceed as described in subclause 5.3.7a
>> Whenever an ATTACH REJECT message with the EMM cause #11 "PLMN not allowed" is received by the UE, the chosen PLMN identity shall be stored in the "forbidden PLMN list" and if the UE is configured to use timer T3245 then the UE shall start timer T3245 and proceed as described in subclause 5.3.7a.
[('if the UE is configured to use timer T3245', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall start timer T3245
>> Whenever an ATTACH REJECT message with the EMM cause #14 "EPS services not allowed in this PLMN" is received by the UE, the chosen PLMN identity shall be stored in the "forbidden PLMNs for GPRS service" and if the UE is configured to use timer T3245 then the UE shall start timer T3245 and proceed as described in subclause 5.3.7a.
[('if the UE is configured to use timer T3245', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall proceed as described in subclause 5.3.7a
>> Whenever an ATTACH REJECT message with the EMM cause #14 "EPS services not allowed in this PLMN" is received by the UE, the chosen PLMN identity shall be stored in the "forbidden PLMNs for GPRS service" and if the UE is configured to use timer T3245 then the UE shall start timer T3245 and proceed as described in subclause 5.3.7a.
[('if the UE is configured to use timer T3245', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall start timer T3245
>> The attach attempt counter shall be reset when, a GPRS attach or combined GPRS attach procedure is successfully completed in A/Gb or Iu mode;
[('when , a GPRS attach or combined GPRS attach procedure is successfully completed in A/Gb or Iu mode', 'when')] ----> The attach attempt counter shall be reset
>> The attach attempt counter shall be reset when, a registration procedure for initial registration performed over 3GPP access is successfully completed in N1 mode and the UE is operating in single-registration mode;
[('when a registration procedure for initial registration performed over 3GPP access successfully completed in N1 mode', 'when'), ('the UE operating in single-registration mode', 'when')] ----> The attach attempt counter shall be reset

[('when the UE is in substate EMM-DEREGISTERED.ATTEMPTING-TO-ATTACH', 'when'), ('timer T3402 expires', 'when')] ----> Additionally the attach attempt counter shall be reset

[('When the UE initiates the attach procedure for normal service', 'when')] ----> the UE shall indicate " EPS attach " in the EPS attach type IE

>> If timer T3402 is currently running, the UE shall stop timer T3402.
[('If timer T3402 is currently running', 'if')] ----> the UE shall stop timer T3402
>> If timer T3411 is currently running, the UE shall stop timer T3411.
[('If timer T3411 is currently running', 'if')] ----> the UE shall stop timer T3411
>> The UE shall include the IMSI in the EPS mobile identity IE in the ATTACH REQUEST message if the selected PLMN is neither the registered PLMN nor in the list of equivalent PLMNs and, the UE is configured for "AttachWithIMSI" as specified in 3GPP TS 24.368 [15A] or 3GPP TS 31.102 [17];
[('if the selected PLMN is neither the registered PLMN nor in the list of equivalent PLMNs', 'if')] ----> The UE shall include the IMSI in the EPS mobile identity IE in the ATTACH REQUEST message

>> if the UE operating in the single-registration mode is performing an inter-system change from N1 mode to S1 mode or the UE was previously registered in N1 mode before entering state 5GMM-DEREGISTERED and, the UE has received the interworking without N26 interface indicator set to "interworking without N26 interface supported" from the network and, if the UE holds a valid GUTI, the UE shall include the valid GUTI into the EPS mobile identity IE, include Old GUTI type IE with GUTI type set to "native GUTI" and include the UE status IE with a 5GMM registration status set to "UE is in 5GMM-REGISTERED state" if the UE is in 5GMM-REGISTERED state;

>> if the UE operating in the single-registration mode is performing an inter-system change from N1 mode to S1 mode or the UE was previously registered in N1 mode before entering state 5GMM-DEREGISTERED and, the UE has received the interworking without N26 interface indicator set to "interworking without N26 interface not supported" from the network and, if the UE holds a valid GUTI and does not hold a valid 5G-GUTI, the UE shall indicate the GUTI in the EPS mobile identity IE and include Old GUTI type IE with GUTI type set to "native GUTI";

>> if the UE operating in the single-registration mode is performing an inter-system change from N1 mode to S1 mode or the UE was previously registered in N1 mode before entering state 5GMM-DEREGISTERED and, the UE has received the interworking without N26 interface indicator set to "interworking without N26 interface not supported" from the network and, if the UE holds neither a valid GUTI nor a vaild 5G-GUTI, the UE shall include the IMSI in the EPS mobile identity IE;

>> If the UE supports A/Gb mode or Iu mode or both and, if the TIN indicates "GUTI" or "RAT-related TMSI" and the UE holds a valid GUTI, the UE shall indicate the GUTI in the EPS mobile identity IE, and include Old GUTI type IE with GUTI type set to "native GUTI";

>> If the UE supports A/Gb mode or Iu mode or both and, if the TIN is deleted and, the UE holds a valid GUTI, the UE shall indicate the GUTI in the EPS mobile identity IE, and include Old GUTI type IE with GUTI type set to "native GUTI";
[('If the UE supports A/Gb mode or Iu mode or both and , if the TIN is deleted and , the UE holds a valid GUTI', 'if')] ----> the UE shall indicate the GUTI in the EPS mobile identity IE
>> If the UE supports A/Gb mode or Iu mode or both and, if the TIN is deleted and, the UE holds a valid GUTI, the UE shall indicate the GUTI in the EPS mobile identity IE, and include Old GUTI type IE with GUTI type set to "native GUTI";
[('If the UE supports A/Gb mode or Iu mode or both and , if the TIN is deleted and , the UE holds a valid GUTI', 'if')] ----> the UE shall include Old GUTI type IE with GUTI type set to " native GUTI "
>> If a P-TMSI signature is associated with the P-TMSI, the UE shall include it in the Old P-TMSI signature IE;
[('If a P-TMSI signature is associated with the P-TMSI', 'if')] ----> the UE shall include it in the Old P-TMSI signature IE
>> If the UE supports A/Gb mode or Iu mode or both and, if the TIN is deleted and, the UE does not hold a valid GUTI, P-TMSI or RAI, the UE shall include the IMSI in the EPS mobile identity IE;
[('the UE supports A/Gb mode or Iu mode or both', 'if'), ('the TIN deleted', 'if'), ('the UE not hold a valid GUTI , P-TMSI or RAI', 'if')] ----> the UE shall include the IMSI in the EPS mobile identity IE
>> If the UE supports A/Gb mode or Iu mode or both and, otherwise the UE shall include the IMSI in the EPS mobile identity IE.
[('If the UE supports A/Gb mode or Iu mode or both and', 'if')] ----> otherwise the UE shall include the IMSI in the EPS mobile identity IE
>> If the UE is operating in the dual-registration mode and it is in 5GMM state 5GMM-REGISTERED, the UE shall include the UE status IE with the 5GMM registration status set to "UE is in 5GMM-REGISTERED state".
[('the UE operating in the dual-registration mode', 'if'), ('it is in 5GMM state 5GMM-REGISTERED', 'if')] ----> the UE shall include the UE status IE with the 5GMM registration status set to " UE is in 5GMM-REGISTERED state "
>> If the UE is attaching for emergency bearer services and does not hold a valid GUTI, P-TMSI or IMSI as described above, the IMEI shall be included in the EPS mobile identity IE.
[('the UE attaching for emergency bearer services', 'if'), ('the UE not hold a valid GUTI , P-TMSI or IMSI as described above', 'if')] ----> the IMEI shall included in the EPS mobile identity IE
>> If the UE in limited service state is attaching for access to RLOS and does not hold a valid GUTI, P-TMSI or IMSI as described above, the IMEI shall be included in the EPS mobile identity IE.
[('the UE in limited service state attaching for access to RLOS', 'if'), ('the UE in limited service state not hold a valid GUTI , P-TMSI or IMSI as described above', 'if')] ----> the IMEI shall included in the EPS mobile identity IE
>> If the UE supports A/Gb mode or Iu mode or if the UE needs to indicate its UE specific DRX parameter to the network, the UE shall include the UE specific DRX parameter in the DRX parameter IE in the ATTACH REQUEST message.
[('the UE supports A/Gb mode or Iu mode', 'if')] ----> the UE shall include the UE specific DRX parameter in the DRX parameter IE
>> If the UE supports A/Gb mode or Iu mode or if the UE needs to indicate its UE specific DRX parameter to the network, the UE shall include the UE specific DRX parameter in the DRX parameter IE in the ATTACH REQUEST message.
[('the UE needs to indicate its UE specific DRX parameter to the network', 'if')] ----> the UE shall include the UE specific DRX parameter in the DRX parameter IE
>> If the UE in NB-S1 mode needs to indicate the UE specific DRX parameter in NB-S1 mode to the network, it shall include the UE specific DRX parameter in NB-S1 mode in the DRX parameter in NB-S1 mode IE in the ATTACH REQUEST message.
[('If the UE in NB-S1 mode needs to indicate the UE specific DRX parameter in NB-S1 mode to the network', 'if')] ----> it shall include the UE specific DRX parameter in NB-S1 mode in the DRX parameter in NB-S1 in the ATTACH REQUEST message
>> If the UE supports eDRX and requests the use of eDRX, the UE shall include the extended DRX parameters IE in the ATTACH REQUEST message.
[('the UE supports eDRX', 'if'), ('the UE requests the use of eDRX', 'if')] ----> the UE shall include the extended DRX parameters IE in the ATTACH REQUEST message
>> If the UE supports WUS assistance, then the UE shall set the WUSA bit to "WUS assistance supported" in the UE network capability IE, and if the UE is not attaching for emergency bearer services, the UE may include its UE paging probability information in the Requested WUS assistance information IE of the ATTACH REQUEST message.
[('If the UE supports WUS assistance', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall set the WUSA bit to " WUS assistance supported " in the UE network capability IE
>> If the UE supports WUS assistance, then the UE shall set the WUSA bit to "WUS assistance supported" in the UE network capability IE, and if the UE is not attaching for emergency bearer services, the UE may include its UE paging probability information in the Requested WUS assistance information IE of the ATTACH REQUEST message.
[('if the UE is not attaching for emergency bearer services', 'if')] ----> the UE may include its UE paging probability information in the Requested WUS assistance information IE of the ATTACH REQUEST message
>> If the UE supports SRVCC to GERAN/UTRAN, the UE shall set the SRVCC to GERAN/UTRAN capability bit to "SRVCC from UTRAN HSPA or E-UTRAN to GERAN/UTRAN supported".
[('If the UE supports SRVCC to GERAN/UTRAN', 'if')] ----> the UE shall set the SRVCC to GERAN/UTRAN capability to " SRVCC from UTRAN HSPA or E-UTRAN to GERAN/UTRAN supported
>> If the UE supports vSRVCC from S1 mode to Iu mode, then the UE shall set the H.245 after handover capability bit to "H.245 after SRVCC handover capability supported" and additionally set the SRVCC to GERAN/UTRAN capability bit to "SRVCC from UTRAN HSPA or E-UTRAN to GERAN/UTRAN supported" in the ATTACH REQUEST message.
[('If the UE supports vSRVCC from S1 mode to Iu mode', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall set the H.245 after handover capability bit to " H.245 after SRVCC handover capability supported "
>> If the UE supports vSRVCC from S1 mode to Iu mode, then the UE shall set the H.245 after handover capability bit to "H.245 after SRVCC handover capability supported" and additionally set the SRVCC to GERAN/UTRAN capability bit to "SRVCC from UTRAN HSPA or E-UTRAN to GERAN/UTRAN supported" in the ATTACH REQUEST message.
[('If the UE supports vSRVCC from S1 mode to Iu mode', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall additionally set the SRVCC to GERAN/UTRAN capability bit to " SRVCC from UTRAN HSPA or E-UTRAN to GERAN/UTRAN supported in the ATTACH REQUEST message
>> If the UE supports PSM and requests the use of PSM, then the UE shall include the T3324 value IE with a requested timer value in the ATTACH REQUEST message.
[('the UE supports PSM', 'if'), ('the UE requests the use of PSM', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall include the T3324 value IE with a requested timer value in the ATTACH REQUEST message
>> When the UE includes the T3324 value IE and the UE indicates support for extended periodic timer value in the MS network feature support IE, it may also include the T3412 extended value IE to request a particular T3412 value to be allocated.

>> If EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection is not supported by the UE or the MME, or if the UE wants to request PDN connection with the attach procedure, the UE shall send the ATTACH REQUEST message together with a PDN CONNECTIVITY REQUEST message contained in the ESM message container IE.

>> In WB-S1 mode, if the UE supports RACS, the UE shall, if the UE has an applicable UE radio capability ID for the current UE radio configuration in the selected PLMN, set the URCIDA bit to "UE radio capability ID available" in the UE radio capability ID availability IE of the ATTACH REQUEST message.

>> If the attach procedure is initiated following an inter-system change from N1 mode to S1 mode in EMM-IDLE mode or the UE which was previously registered in N1 mode before entering state 5GMM-DEREGISTERED initiates the attach procedure:

>> if the UE has received an "interworking without N26 interface not supported" indication from the network and a valid 5G NAS security context exists in the UE, the UE shall integrity protect the ATTACH REQUEST message combined with the message included in the ESM message container IE using the 5G NAS security context;
[('if the UE has received an " interworking without N26 interface not supported " indication from the network and a valid 5G NAS security context exists in the UE', 'if')] ----> the UE shall integrity protect the ATTACH REQUEST message combined with the message included in the ESM message container IE using the 5G NAS security context
>> otherwise, if a valid EPS security context exists, the UE shall integrity protect the ATTACH REQUEST message combined with the message included in the ESM message container IE using the EPS security context;
[('if a valid EPS security context exists', 'if')] ----> otherwise the UE shall integrity protect the ATTACH REQUEST message combined with the message included in the ESM message container IE using the EPS security context
>> otherwise, if the UE does not have a valid EPS security context, the ATTACH REQUEST message combined with the message included in the ESM message container IE is not integrity protected.
[('if the UE does not have a valid EPS security context', 'if')] ----> otherwise the ATTACH REQUEST message combined with the message included in the ESM message container IE not integrity protected
>> If the network receives an ATTACH REQUEST message containing the Old GUTI type IE and the EPS mobile identity IE with type of identity indicating "GUTI", and the network does not follow the use of the most significant bit of the <MME group id> as specified in 3GPP TS 23.003 [2], subclause 2.8.2.2.2, the network shall use the Old GUTI type IE to determine whether the mobile identity included in the EPS mobile identity IE is a native GUTI or a mapped GUTI.
[('the network receives an ATTACH REQUEST message containing the Old GUTI type IE and the EPS mobile identity IE with type of identity indicating " GUTI "', 'if'), ('the network not follow the use of the most significant bit of the < MME group id > as specified in 3GPP TS 23.003 [ 2 ] , subclause 2.8.2.2.2', 'if')] ----> the network shall use the Old GUTI type IE to determine whether the mobile identity included in the EPS mobile identity IE is a native GUTI or a mapped GUTI
>> During an attach for emergency bearer services, if not restricted by local regulations, the MME shall not check for mobility and access restrictions, regional restrictions, subscription restrictions, or perform CSG access control when processing the ATTACH REQUEST message.
[('when processing the ATTACH REQUEST message', 'when'), ('if not restricted by local regulations', 'if')] ----> During an attach for emergency bearer services the MME shall not perform CSG access control
>> During an attach for emergency bearer services, if not restricted by local regulations, the MME shall not check for mobility and access restrictions, regional restrictions, subscription restrictions, or perform CSG access control when processing the ATTACH REQUEST message.
[('if not restricted by local regulations', 'if')] ----> During an attach for emergency bearer services the MME shall not check for mobility and access restrictions , regional restrictions , subscription restrictions
>> During an attach for access to RLOS, the MME shall not check for access restrictions, regional restrictions and subscription restrictions when processing the ATTACH REQUEST message.
[('when processing the ATTACH REQUEST message', 'when')] ----> During an attach for access to RLOS the MME shall not check for access restrictions , regional restrictions and subscription restrictions
>> If the attach request is accepted by the network, the MME shall send an ATTACH ACCEPT message to the UE and start timer T3450.

[('If the attach request is accepted by the network', 'if')] ----> the MME shall start timer T3450
>> If the attach request included the PDN CONNECTIVITY REQUEST message in the ESM message container information element to request PDN connectivity, the MME when accepting the attach request shall, send the ATTACH ACCEPT message together with an ESM DUMMY MESSAGE contained in the ESM message container information element and discard the ESM message container information element included in the attach request if, the UE indicated support of EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection in the UE network capability IE of the ATTACH REQUEST message;

>> If the attach request included the PDN CONNECTIVITY REQUEST message in the ESM message container information element to request PDN connectivity, the MME when accepting the attach request shall, send the ATTACH ACCEPT message together with an ESM DUMMY MESSAGE contained in the ESM message container information element and discard the ESM message container information element included in the attach request if, the UE indicated support of EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection in the UE network capability IE of the ATTACH REQUEST message;
[('when accepting the attach request', 'when'), ('If the attach request included the PDN CONNECTIVITY REQUEST message in the ESM message container information element to request PDN connectivity', 'if'), ('if , the UE indicated support of EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection in the UE network capability IE of the ATTACH REQUEST message', 'if')] ----> the MME shall discard the ESM message container information element included in the attach request
>> If the attach request included the PDN CONNECTIVITY REQUEST message in the ESM message container information element to request PDN connectivity, the MME when accepting the attach request shall, send the ATTACH ACCEPT message together with an ESM DUMMY MESSAGE contained in the ESM message container information element and discard the ESM message container information element included in the attach request if, the MME supports EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection and PDN connection is restricted according to the user's subscription data;
