>> If the attach request included the PDN CONNECTIVITY REQUEST message in the ESM message container information element to request PDN connectivity, the MME when accepting the attach request shall, send the ATTACH ACCEPT message together with an ESM DUMMY MESSAGE contained in the ESM message container information element and discard the ESM message container information element included in the attach request if, the MME supports EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection and PDN connection is restricted according to the user's subscription data;
[('when accepting the attach request', 'when'), ('If the attach request included the PDN CONNECTIVITY REQUEST message in the ESM message container information element to request PDN connectivity', 'if'), ('the MME supports EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection', 'if'), ("PDN connection restricted according to the user's subscription data", 'if')] ----> the MME shall discard the ESM message container information element included in the attach request
>> If the attach request included the PDN CONNECTIVITY REQUEST message in the ESM message container information element to request PDN connectivity, the MME when accepting the attach request shall, send the ATTACH ACCEPT message together with an ESM DUMMY MESSAGE contained in the ESM message container information element and discard the ESM message container information element included in the attach request if, the attach type is not set to "EPS emergency attach" or "EPS RLOS attach";
[('when accepting the attach request', 'when'), ('If the attach request included the PDN CONNECTIVITY REQUEST message in the ESM message container information element to request PDN connectivity', 'if')] ----> the MME shall send the ATTACH ACCEPT message together with an ESM DUMMY MESSAGE contained in the ESM message container information element
>> If the attach request included the PDN CONNECTIVITY REQUEST message in the ESM message container information element to request PDN connectivity, the MME when accepting the attach request shall, send the ATTACH ACCEPT message together with an ESM DUMMY MESSAGE contained in the ESM message container information element and discard the ESM message container information element included in the attach request if, the attach type is not set to "EPS emergency attach" or "EPS RLOS attach";
[('when accepting the attach request', 'when'), ('If the attach request included the PDN CONNECTIVITY REQUEST message in the ESM message container information element to request PDN connectivity', 'if'), ('if , the attach type is not set to " EPS emergency attach " or " EPS RLOS attach "', 'if')] ----> the MME shall discard the ESM message container information element included in the attach request
>> If the attach request included the PDN CONNECTIVITY REQUEST message in the ESM message container information element to request PDN connectivity, the MME when accepting the attach request shall, send the ATTACH ACCEPT message together with an ESM DUMMY MESSAGE contained in the ESM message container information element and discard the ESM message container information element included in the attach request if, the request type of the UE requested PDN connection is not set to "emergency" or "RLOS";
[('when accepting the attach request', 'when'), ('If the attach request included the PDN CONNECTIVITY REQUEST message in the ESM message container information element to request PDN connectivity', 'if')] ----> the MME shall send the ATTACH ACCEPT message together with an ESM DUMMY MESSAGE contained in the ESM message container information element
>> If the attach request included the PDN CONNECTIVITY REQUEST message in the ESM message container information element to request PDN connectivity, the MME when accepting the attach request shall, send the ATTACH ACCEPT message together with an ESM DUMMY MESSAGE contained in the ESM message container information element and discard the ESM message container information element included in the attach request if, the request type of the UE requested PDN connection is not set to "emergency" or "RLOS";
[('when accepting the attach request', 'when'), ('If the attach request included the PDN CONNECTIVITY REQUEST message in the ESM message container information element to request PDN connectivity', 'if'), ('if , the request type of the UE requested PDN connection is not set to " emergency " or " RLOS "', 'if')] ----> the MME shall discard the ESM message container information element included in the attach request
>> If the attach request included the PDN CONNECTIVITY REQUEST message in the ESM message container information element to request PDN connectivity, the MME when accepting the attach request shall, otherwise, send the ATTACH ACCEPT message together with an ACTIVATE DEFAULT EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST message contained in the ESM message container information element to activate the default bearer.
[('when accepting the attach request', 'when'), ('If the attach request included the PDN CONNECTIVITY REQUEST message in the ESM message container information element to request PDN connectivity', 'if')] ----> the MME shall otherwise send the ATTACH ACCEPT message together with an ACTIVATE DEFAULT EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST message contained in the ESM message container information element to activate the default bearer
>> In WB-S1 mode, the network may also initiate the activation of dedicated bearers towards the UE by invoking the dedicated EPS bearer context activation procedure.
[('by invoking the dedicated EPS bearer context activation procedure', 'by')] ----> In WB-S1 mode the network may also initiate the activation of dedicated bearers towards the UE
>> If EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection is supported by the UE and the MME, and the UE included an ESM DUMMY MESSAGE in the ESM message container information element of the ATTACH REQUEST message, the MME shall send the ATTACH ACCEPT message together with an ESM DUMMY MESSAGE contained in the ESM message container information element.
[('If EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection is supported by the UE and the MME , and the UE included an ESM DUMMY MESSAGE in the ESM message container information element of the ATTACH REQUEST message', 'if')] ----> the MME shall send the ATTACH ACCEPT message together with an ESM DUMMY MESSAGE contained in the ESM message container information element
>> If the attach request is accepted by the network, the MME shall delete the stored UE radio capability information or the UE radio capability ID, if any.
[('If the attach request is accepted by the network', 'if'), ('if any', 'if')] ----> the MME shall delete the stored UE radio capability information or the UE radio capability ID
>> In NB-S1 mode, if the attach request is accepted by the network, the MME shall set the EMC BS bit to zero in the EPS network feature support IE included in the ATTACH ACCEPT message to indicate that support of emergency bearer services in NB-S1 mode is not available.
[('if the attach request is accepted by the network', 'if')] ----> In NB-S1 mode the MME shall set the EMC BS bit to zero in the EPS network feature support IE included in the ATTACH ACCEPT message to indicate that support of emergency bearer services in NB-S1 mode is not available
>> If the UE has included the UE network capability IE or the MS network capability IE or both in the ATTACH REQUEST message, the MME shall store all octets received from the UE, up to the maximum length defined for the respective information element.
[('If the UE has included the UE network capability IE or the MS network capability IE or both in the ATTACH REQUEST message', 'if')] ----> the MME shall store all octets received from the UE , up to the maximum length defined for the respective information element
>> If the UE specific DRX parameter was included in the DRX Parameter IE in the ATTACH REQUEST message, the MME shall replace any stored UE specific DRX parameter with the received parameter and use it for the downlink transfer of signalling and user data in WB-S1 mode.
[('If the UE specific DRX parameter was included in the DRX Parameter IE in the ATTACH REQUEST message', 'if')] ----> the MME shall replace any stored UE specific DRX parameter with the received parameter
>> If the UE specific DRX parameter was included in the DRX Parameter IE in the ATTACH REQUEST message, the MME shall replace any stored UE specific DRX parameter with the received parameter and use it for the downlink transfer of signalling and user data in WB-S1 mode.
[('If the UE specific DRX parameter was included in the DRX Parameter IE in the ATTACH REQUEST message', 'if')] ----> the MME shall use it for the downlink transfer of signalling and user data in WB-S1 mode
>> In NB-S1 mode, if the DRX parameter in NB-S1 mode IE was included in the ATTACH REQUEST message, the MME shall provide to the UE the Negotiated DRX parameter in NB-S1 mode IE in the ATTACH ACCEPT message.
[('if the DRX parameter in NB-S1 mode IE was included in the ATTACH REQUEST message', 'if')] ----> In NB-S1 mode the MME shall provide to the UE the Negotiated DRX parameter in NB-S1 mode IE in the ATTACH ACCEPT message
>> In NB-S1 mode, if the UE requested "SMS only" in the Additional update type IE, supports NB-S1 mode only and the MME decides to accept the attach request for EPS services and "SMS only", the MME shall indicate "SMS only" in the Additional update result IE and shall set the EPS attach result IE to "EPS only" in the ATTACH ACCEPT message.
[('if the UE requested "SMS only" in the Additional update type IE supports NB-S1 mode only', 'if'), ('the MME decides to accept the attach request for EPS services and "SMS only"', 'if')] ----> In NB-S1 mode the MME shall indicate "SMS only" in the Additional update result IE
>> In NB-S1 mode, if the UE requested "SMS only" in the Additional update type IE, supports NB-S1 mode only and the MME decides to accept the attach request for EPS services and "SMS only", the MME shall indicate "SMS only" in the Additional update result IE and shall set the EPS attach result IE to "EPS only" in the ATTACH ACCEPT message.
[('if the UE requested "SMS only" in the Additional update type IE supports NB-S1 mode only', 'if'), ('the MME decides to accept the attach request for EPS services and "SMS only"', 'if')] ----> In NB-S1 mode the MME shall set the EPS attach result IE to " EPS only " in the ATTACH ACCEPT message
>> then the MME shall determine the negotiated UE paging probability information for the UE, store it in the EMM context of the UE, and if the UE is not attaching for emergency bearer services, the MME shall include it in the Negotiated WUS assistance information IE in the ATTACH ACCEPT message.
[('if the UE is not attaching for emergency bearer services', 'if')] ----> the MME shall include it in the Negotiated WUS assistance information IE in the ATTACH ACCEPT message
>> The UE, upon receiving an ATTACH ACCEPT message, shall delete its old TAI list and store the received TAI list.
[('upon receiving an ATTACH ACCEPT message', 'upon')] ----> The UE shall delete its old TAI list
>> The UE, upon receiving an ATTACH ACCEPT message, shall delete its old TAI list and store the received TAI list.
[('upon receiving an ATTACH ACCEPT message', 'upon')] ----> The UE shall store the received TAI list
>> If the MME supports and accepts the use of PSM, and the UE included the T3412 extended value IE in the ATTACH REQUEST message, then the MME shall take into account the T3412 value requested when providing the T3412 value IE and the T3412 extended value IE in the ATTACH ACCEPT message.
[('the MME supports the use of PSM', 'if'), ('the MME accepts the use of PSM', 'if'), ('the UE included the T3412 extended value IE in the ATTACH REQUEST message', 'if')] ----> then the MME shall take into account the T3412 value requested when providing the T3412 value IE and the T3412 extended value IE in the ATTACH ACCEPT message
>> If the UE indicates support for EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection in the ATTACH REQUEST message and the MME supports EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection, the MME shall indicate support for EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection in the EPS network feature support IE of the ATTACH ACCEPT message.
[('If the UE indicates support for EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection in the ATTACH REQUEST message and the MME supports EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection', 'if')] ----> the MME shall indicate support for EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection in the EPS network feature support IE of the ATTACH ACCEPT message
>> If the UE requests "control plane CIoT EPS optimization" in the Additional update type IE, indicates support of control plane CIoT EPS optimization in the UE network capability IE and the MME decides to accept the requested CIoT EPS optimization and the attach request, the MME shall indicate "control plane CIoT EPS optimization supported" in the EPS network feature support IE.
[('If the UE requests " control plane CIoT EPS optimization " in the Additional update type IE indicates support of control plane CIoT EPS optimization in the UE network capability IE', 'if'), ('the MME decides to accept the requested CIoT EPS optimization and the attach request', 'if')] ----> the MME shall indicate " control plane CIoT EPS optimization supported " in the EPS network feature support IE
>> If the MME supports NB-S1 mode, Non-IP or Ethernet PDN type, inter-system change with 5GS or the network wants to enforce the use of DNS over TLS, then the MME shall support the extended protocol configuration options IE.
[('the MME supports NB-S1 mode , Non-IP or Ethernet PDN type', 'if')] ----> then the MME shall support the extended protocol configuration options IE
>> If the MME supports NB-S1 mode, Non-IP or Ethernet PDN type, inter-system change with 5GS or the network wants to enforce the use of DNS over TLS, then the MME shall support the extended protocol configuration options IE.
[('the network wants to enforce the use of DNS over TLS', 'if')] ----> then the MME shall support the extended protocol configuration options IE
>> If the MME supports the extended protocol configuration options IE and the UE indicated support of the extended protocol configuration options IE, then the MME shall set the ePCO bit to "extended protocol configuration options supported" in the EPS network feature support IE of the ATTACH ACCEPT message.
[('the MME supports the extended protocol configuration options IE', 'if'), ('the UE indicated support of the extended protocol configuration options IE', 'if')] ----> then the MME shall set the ePCO bit to " extended protocol configuration options supported " in the EPS network feature support IE of the ATTACH ACCEPT message
>> If the UE indicates support for restriction on use of enhanced coverage in the ATTACH REQUEST message, and the network decides to restrict the use of enhanced coverage for the UE, then the MME shall set the RestrictEC bit to "Use of enhanced coverage is restricted" in the EPS network feature support IE of the ATTACH ACCEPT message.
[('the UE indicates support for restriction on use of enhanced coverage in the ATTACH REQUEST message', 'if'), ('the network decides to restrict the use of enhanced coverage for the UE', 'if')] ----> then the MME shall set the RestrictEC bit to " Use of enhanced coverage is restricted " in the EPS network feature
>> If the UE has indicated support for the control plane data back-off timer, and the MME decides to activate the congestion control for transport of user data via the control plane, then the MME shall include the T3448 value IE in the ATTACH ACCEPT message.
[('the UE indicated support for the control plane data back-off timer', 'if'), ('the MME decides to activate the congestion control for transport of user data via the control plane', 'if')] ----> then the MME shall include the T3448 value IE in the ATTACH ACCEPT message
>> If the UE indicates support for dual connectivity with NR in the ATTACH REQUEST message, and the MME decides to restrict the use of dual connectivity with NR for the UE, then the MME shall set the RestrictDCNR bit to "Use of dual connectivity with NR is restricted" in the EPS network feature support IE of the ATTACH ACCEPT message.
[('the UE indicates support for dual connectivity with NR in the ATTACH REQUEST message', 'if'), ('the MME decides to restrict the use of dual connectivity with NR for the UE', 'if')] ----> then the MME shall set the RestrictDCNR bit to " Use of dual connectivity with NR is restricted " in the EPS network feature support IE of the ATTACH ACCEPT message
>> If the UE indicates support for N1 mode in the ATTACH REQUEST message and the MME supports inter-system interworking with 5GS, the MME may set the IWK N26 bit to "interworking without N26 interface not supported" if the MME supports N26 interface in the EPS network feature support IE in the ATTACH ACCEPT message.
[('if the MME supports N26 interface in the EPS network feature support IE in the ATTACH ACCEPT message', 'if'), ('the UE indicates support for N1 mode in the ATTACH REQUEST message', 'if'), ('the MME supports inter-system interworking with 5GS', 'if')] ----> the MME may set the IWK N26 bit to " interworking without N26 interface not supported "
>> If the UE indicates support for N1 mode in the ATTACH REQUEST message and the MME supports inter-system interworking with 5GS, the MME may set the IWK N26 bit to "interworking without N26 interface supported" if the MME does not support N26 interface in the EPS network feature support IE in the ATTACH ACCEPT message.
[('if the MME does not support N26 interface in the EPS network feature support IE in the ATTACH ACCEPT message', 'if'), ('the UE indicates support for N1 mode in the ATTACH REQUEST message', 'if'), ('the MME supports inter-system interworking with 5GS', 'if')] ----> the MME may set the IWK N26 bit to " interworking without N26 interface supported "
>> If the UE requests ciphering keys for ciphered broadcast assistance data in the ATTACH REQUEST message and the MME has valid ciphering key data applicable to the UE's subscription, then the MME shall include the ciphering key data in the Ciphering key data IE of the ATTACH ACCEPT message.
[('ciphering keys', 'if'), ("the MME has valid ciphering key data applicable to the UE's subscription", 'if')] ----> then the MME shall include the ciphering key data in the Ciphering key data IE of the ATTACH ACCEPT message
>> If due to operator policies unsecured redirection to a GERAN cell is not allowed in the current PLMN, the MME shall set the redir-policy bit to "Unsecured redirection to GERAN not allowed" in the Network policy IE of the ATTACH ACCEPT message.
[('If due to operator policies unsecured redirection to a GERAN cell is not allowed in the current PLMN', 'if')] ----> the MME shall set the redir-policy bit to " Unsecured redirection to GERAN not allowed "
>> The MME may include the T3447 value IE set to the service gap time value in the ATTACH ACCEPT message if, the UE has indicated support for service gap control;
[('if , the UE has indicated support for service gap control', 'if')] ----> The MME may include the T3447 value IE set to the service gap time value in the ATTACH ACCEPT message
>> The MME may include the T3447 value IE set to the service gap time value in the ATTACH ACCEPT message if, a service gap time value is available in the EMM context.
[('if , a service gap time value is available in the EMM context', 'if')] ----> The MME may include the T3447 value IE set to the service gap time value in the ATTACH ACCEPT message
>> If the network supports signalling for a maximum number of 15 EPS bearer contexts and the UE indicated support of signalling for a maximum number of 15 EPS bearer contexts in the ATTACH REQUEST message, then the MME shall set the 15 bearers bit to "Signalling for a maximum number of 15 EPS bearer contexts supported" in the EPS network feature support IE of the ATTACH ACCEPT message.
[('the network supports signalling for a maximum number of 15 EPS bearer contexts', 'if'), ('the UE indicated support of signalling for a maximum number of 15 EPS bearer contexts', 'if')] ----> then the MME shall set the 15 bearers bit to " Signalling for a maximum number of 15 EPS bearer contexts supported " in the EPS network feature support IE of the ATTACH ACCEPT message
>> Upon receiving the ATTACH ACCEPT message, the UE shall stop timer T3410.
[('Upon receiving the ATTACH ACCEPT message', 'upon')] ----> the UE shall stop timer T3410
>> When the ATTACH REQUEST message includes the IMSI or IMEI, or the MME considers the GUTI provided by the UE is invalid, or the GUTI provided by the UE was assigned by another MME, the MME shall allocate a new GUTI to the UE.
[('the GUTI provided by the UE assigned by another MME', 'when')] ----> the MME shall allocate a new GUTI to the UE
>> When the ATTACH REQUEST message includes the IMSI or IMEI, or the MME considers the GUTI provided by the UE is invalid, or the GUTI provided by the UE was assigned by another MME, the MME shall allocate a new GUTI to the UE.
[('the ATTACH REQUEST message includes the IMSI or IMEI', 'when')] ----> the MME shall allocate a new GUTI to the UE
>> When the ATTACH REQUEST message includes the IMSI or IMEI, or the MME considers the GUTI provided by the UE is invalid, or the GUTI provided by the UE was assigned by another MME, the MME shall allocate a new GUTI to the UE.
[('the MME considers the GUTI provided by the UE is invalid', 'when')] ----> the MME shall allocate a new GUTI to the UE
>> If the ATTACH ACCEPT message contains a GUTI, the UE shall use this GUTI as the new temporary identity.
[('If the ATTACH ACCEPT message contains a GUTI', 'if')] ----> the UE shall use this GUTI as the new temporary identity
>> If no GUTI has been included by the MME in the ATTACH ACCEPT message, the old GUTI, if any available, shall be kept.
[('If no GUTI has been included by the MME in the ATTACH ACCEPT message', 'if'), ('if any available', 'if')] ----> the old GUTI shall kept
>> If A/Gb mode or Iu mode is supported in the UE, the UE shall set its TIN to "GUTI" when receiving the ATTACH ACCEPT message.
[('when receiving the ATTACH ACCEPT message', 'when'), ('If A/Gb mode or Iu mode is supported in the UE', 'if')] ----> the UE shall set its TIN to " GUTI "
>> If the ATTACH ACCEPT message contains the T3412 extended value IE, then the UE shall use the value in T3412 extended value IE as periodic tracking area update timer.
[('If the ATTACH ACCEPT message contains the T3412 extended value IE', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall use the value in T3412 extended value IE as periodic tracking area update timer
>> If the ATTACH ACCEPT message does not contain T3412 extended value IE, then the UE shall use the value in T3412 value IE as periodic tracking area update timer.
[('If the ATTACH ACCEPT message does not contain T3412 extended value IE', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall use the value in T3412 value IE as periodic tracking area update timer
>> If the ATTACH ACCEPT message contains the T3324 value IE, then the UE shall use the included timer value for T3324 as specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [13], subclause 4.7.2.8.
[('If the ATTACH ACCEPT message contains the T3324 value IE', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall use the included timer value for T3324 as specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [ 13 ] , subclause 4.7.2.8
>> If the ATTACH ACCEPT message contains the DCN-ID IE, then the UE shall store the included DCN-ID value together with the PLMN code of the registered PLMN in a DCN-ID list in a non-volatile memory in the ME as specified in annex C.
[('If the ATTACH ACCEPT message contains the DCN-ID IE', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall store the included DCN-ID value together with the PLMN code of the registered PLMN in a DCN-ID list in a non-volatile memory in the ME as specified in annex C
>> The UE shall store the list as provided by the network, and if the attach procedure is neither for emergency bearer services nor for access to RLOS, the UE shall remove from the list any PLMN code that is already in the list of "forbidden PLMNs" or in the list of "forbidden PLMNs for GPRS service".
[('if the attach procedure is neither for emergency bearer services nor for access to RLOS', 'if')] ----> the UE shall remove from the list any PLMN code that is already in the list of " forbidden PLMNs " or in the list of " forbidden PLMNs for GPRS service "
>> If the ATTACH ACCEPT message does not contain a list, then the UE shall delete the stored list.
[('If the ATTACH ACCEPT message does not contain a list', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall delete the stored list
>> If the attach procedure is neither for emergency bearer services nor for access to RLOS, and if the PLMN identity of the registered PLMN is a member of the list of "forbidden PLMNs" or the list of "forbidden PLMNs for GPRS service", any such PLMN identity shall be deleted from the corresponding list.
[('the attach procedure is neither for emergency bearer services nor for access to RLOS', 'if'), ('the PLMN identity of the registered PLMN is a member of the list of " forbidden PLMNs " or the list of " forbidden PLMNs for GPRS service', 'if')] ----> any such PLMN identity shall deleted from the corresponding list
>> When initiating an emergency call, the upper layers also take both the IMS voice over PS session indicator and the emergency bearer services indicator into account for the access domain selection.
[('When initiating an emergency call', 'when')] ----> the upper layers also take both the IMS voice over PS session indicator and the emergency bearer services indicator into account for the access domain selection
>> When MO-LR procedure is triggered by the UE's application, those indicators are taken into account as specified in 3GPP TS 24.171 [13C].
[("When MO-LR procedure is triggered by the UE's application", 'when')] ----> those indicators taken into account as specified in 3GPP TS 24.171 [ 13C ]
>> If the RestrictDCNR bit is set to "Use of dual connectivity with NR is restricted" in the EPS network feature support IE of the ATTACH ACCEPT message, the UE shall provide the indication that dual connectivity with NR is restricted to the upper layers.
[('If the RestrictDCNR bit is set to " Use of dual connectivity with NR is restricted " in the EPS network feature support IE of the ATTACH ACCEPT message', 'if')] ----> the UE shall provide the indication that dual connectivity with NR is restricted to the upper layers
>> if the IWK N26 bit in the EPS network feature support IE is set to "interworking without N26 interface not supported", the UE shall operate in single-registration mode;
[('if the IWK N26 bit in the EPS network feature support IE is set to " interworking without N26 interface not supported "', 'if')] ----> the UE shall operate in single-registration mode
>> if the IWK N26 bit in the EPS network feature support IE is set to "interworking without N26 interface supported" and the UE supports dual-registration mode, the UE may operate in dual-registration mode;
[('if the IWK N26 bit in the EPS network feature support IE set to " interworking without N26 interface supported "', 'if'), ('the UE supports dual-registration mode', 'if')] ----> the UE may operate in dual-registration mode
>> if the IWK N26 bit in the EPS network feature support IE is set to "interworking without N26 interface supported" and the UE only supports single-registration mode, the UE shall operate in single-registration mode.
[('if the IWK N26 bit in the EPS network feature support IE set to " interworking without N26 interface supported "', 'if'), ('the UE only supports single-registration mode', 'if')] ----> the UE shall operate in single-registration mode
>> If the redir-policy bit is set to "Unsecured redirection to GERAN not allowed" in the Network policy IE of the ATTACH ACCEPT message, the UE shall set the network policy on unsecured redirection to GERAN for the current PLMN to "Unsecured redirection to GERAN not allowed" and indicate to the lower layers that unsecured redirection to a GERAN cell is not allowed.
[('If the redir-policy bit is set to " Unsecured redirection to GERAN not allowed " in the Network policy IE of the ATTACH ACCEPT message', 'if')] ----> the UE shall set the network policy on unsecured redirection to GERAN for the current PLMN to " Unsecured redirection to GERAN not allowed
>> If the redir-policy bit is set to "Unsecured redirection to GERAN not allowed" in the Network policy IE of the ATTACH ACCEPT message, the UE shall set the network policy on unsecured redirection to GERAN for the current PLMN to "Unsecured redirection to GERAN not allowed" and indicate to the lower layers that unsecured redirection to a GERAN cell is not allowed.
[('If the redir-policy bit is set to " Unsecured redirection to GERAN not allowed " in the Network policy IE of the ATTACH ACCEPT message', 'if')] ----> the UE shall indicate to the lower layers that unsecured redirection to a GERAN cell is not allowed
>> If the redir-policy bit is set to "Unsecured redirection to GERAN allowed" or if the Network policy IE is not included in the ATTACH ACCEPT message, the UE shall set the network policy for the current PLMN to "Unsecured redirection to GERAN allowed" and indicate to the lower layers that unsecured redirection to a GERAN cell is allowed.
[('the Network policy IE not included in the ATTACH ACCEPT message', 'if')] ----> the UE shall set the network policy for the current PLMN to " Unsecured redirection to GERAN allowed
>> If the redir-policy bit is set to "Unsecured redirection to GERAN allowed" or if the Network policy IE is not included in the ATTACH ACCEPT message, the UE shall set the network policy for the current PLMN to "Unsecured redirection to GERAN allowed" and indicate to the lower layers that unsecured redirection to a GERAN cell is allowed.
[('the Network policy IE not included in the ATTACH ACCEPT message', 'if')] ----> the UE shall indicate to the lower layers that unsecured redirection to a GERAN cell is allowed
>> If the redir-policy bit is set to "Unsecured redirection to GERAN allowed" or if the Network policy IE is not included in the ATTACH ACCEPT message, the UE shall set the network policy for the current PLMN to "Unsecured redirection to GERAN allowed" and indicate to the lower layers that unsecured redirection to a GERAN cell is allowed.
[('the redir-policy bit set to " Unsecured redirection to GERAN allowed', 'if')] ----> the UE shall indicate to the lower layers that unsecured redirection to a GERAN cell is allowed
>> If the redir-policy bit is set to "Unsecured redirection to GERAN allowed" or if the Network policy IE is not included in the ATTACH ACCEPT message, the UE shall set the network policy for the current PLMN to "Unsecured redirection to GERAN allowed" and indicate to the lower layers that unsecured redirection to a GERAN cell is allowed.
[('the redir-policy bit set to " Unsecured redirection to GERAN allowed', 'if')] ----> the UE shall set the network policy for the current PLMN to " Unsecured redirection to GERAN allowed
>> The UE shall set the network policy on unsecured redirection to GERAN to "Unsecured redirection to GERAN not allowed" and indicate this to the lower layers when, the UE initiates an EPS attach or tracking area updating procedure in a PLMN different from the PLMN where the UE performed the last successful EPS attach or tracking area updating procedure;
[('when , the UE initiates an EPS attach or tracking area updating procedure in a PLMN different from the PLMN where the UE performed the last successful EPS attach or tracking area updating procedure', 'when')] ----> The UE shall indicate this to the lower layers
>> The UE shall set the network policy on unsecured redirection to GERAN to "Unsecured redirection to GERAN not allowed" and indicate this to the lower layers when, the UE is switched on;
[('when , the UE is switched on', 'when')] ----> The UE shall indicate this to the lower layers
>> The UE shall set the network policy on unsecured redirection to GERAN to "Unsecured redirection to GERAN not allowed" and indicate this to the lower layers when, the UICC containing the USIM is removed.
[('when , the UICC containing the USIM is removed', 'when')] ----> The UE shall indicate this to the lower layers
>> If the UE has initiated the attach procedure due to manual CSG selection and receives an ATTACH ACCEPT message; and the UE sent the ATTACH REQUEST message in a CSG cell, the UE shall check if the CSG ID and associated PLMN identity of the cell are contained in the Allowed CSG list.
[('the UE initiated the attach procedure due to manual CSG selection', 'if'), ('the UE receives an ATTACH ACCEPT message', 'if'), ('the UE sent the ATTACH REQUEST message in a CSG cell', 'if')] ----> the UE shall check if the CSG ID and associated PLMN identity of the cell are contained in the Allowed CSG list
>> If not, the UE shall add that CSG ID and associated PLMN identity to the Allowed CSG list and the UE may add the HNB Name to the Allowed CSG list if the HNB Name is present in neither the Operator CSG list nor the Allowed CSG list.
[('If not', 'if')] ----> the UE shall add that CSG ID and associated PLMN identity to the Allowed CSG list
>> If not, the UE shall add that CSG ID and associated PLMN identity to the Allowed CSG list and the UE may add the HNB Name to the Allowed CSG list if the HNB Name is present in neither the Operator CSG list nor the Allowed CSG list.
[('if the HNB Name is present in neither the Operator CSG list nor the Allowed CSG list', 'if')] ----> the UE may add the HNB Name to the Allowed CSG list
>> When the UE receives the ATTACH ACCEPT message combined with the ACTIVATE DEFAULT EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST message, and if the UE has requested PDN connectivity the UE shall forward the ACTIVATE DEFAULT EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST message to the ESM sublayer.
[('When the UE receives the ATTACH ACCEPT message combined with the ACTIVATE DEFAULT EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST message', 'when'), ('if the UE has requested PDN connectivity', 'if')] ----> the UE shall forward the ACTIVATE DEFAULT EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST message to the ESM sublayer
>> Upon receipt of an indication from the ESM sublayer that the default EPS bearer context has been activated, the UE shall send an ATTACH COMPLETE message together with an ACTIVATE DEFAULT EPS BEARER CONTEXT ACCEPT message contained in the ESM message container information element to the network.
[('Upon receiving of an indication from the ESM sublayer that the default EPS bearer context has been activated', 'upon')] ----> the UE shall send an ATTACH COMPLETE message together with an ACTIVATE DEFAULT EPS BEARER CONTEXT ACCEPT message contained in the ESM message container information element to the network
>> If EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection is supported by the UE and the MME, and the UE receives the ATTACH ACCEPT message combined with an ESM DUMMY MESSAGE, the UE shall send an ATTACH COMPLETE message together with an ESM DUMMY MESSAGE contained in the ESM message container information element to the network.
[('EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection supported by the UE and the MME', 'if'), ('the UE receives the ATTACH ACCEPT message combined with an ESM DUMMY MESSAGE', 'if')] ----> the UE shall send an ATTACH COMPLETE message together with an ESM DUMMY MESSAGE contained in the ESM message container information element to the network
>> If the UE receives the ATTACH ACCEPT message from a PLMN for which a PLMN-specific attempt counter or PLMN-specific PS-attempt counter is maintained, then the UE shall reset these counters.
[('the UE receives the ATTACH ACCEPT message from a PLMN for which a PLMN-specific attempt counter or PLMN-specific PS-attempt counter is maintained', 'if'), ('If the UE receives the ATTACH ACCEPT message from a PLMN for which a PLMN-specific attempt counter or PLMN-specific PS-attempt counter maintained', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall reset these counters
>> If the UE maintains a counter for "SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services", then the UE shall reset this counter.
[('If the UE maintains a counter for " SIM/USIM considered invalid for GPRS services "', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall reset this counter
>> When the UE receives any ACTIVATE DEDICATED EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST messages during the attach procedure, and if the UE has requested PDN connectivity the UE shall forward the ACTIVATE DEDICATED EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST message to the ESM sublayer.
[('When the UE receives any ACTIVATE DEDICATED EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST messages during the attach procedure', 'when'), ('if the UE has requested PDN connectivity', 'if')] ----> the UE shall forward the to the ESM sublayer
>> If the attach procedure was initiated in S101 mode, the lower layers are informed about the successful completion of the procedure.
[('If the attach procedure was initiated in S101 mode', 'if')] ----> the lower layers informed about the successful completion of the procedure
>> Upon receiving an ATTACH COMPLETE message, the MME shall stop timer T3450, enter state EMM-REGISTERED and consider the GUTI sent in the ATTACH ACCEPT message as valid.
[('Upon receiving an ATTACH COMPLETE message', 'upon')] ----> the MME shall consider the GUTI sent in the ATTACH ACCEPT message as valid
>> Upon receiving an ATTACH COMPLETE message, the MME shall stop timer T3450, enter state EMM-REGISTERED and consider the GUTI sent in the ATTACH ACCEPT message as valid.
[('Upon receiving an ATTACH COMPLETE message', 'upon')] ----> the MME shall enter state EMM-REGISTERED
>> Upon receiving an ATTACH COMPLETE message, the MME shall stop timer T3450, enter state EMM-REGISTERED and consider the GUTI sent in the ATTACH ACCEPT message as valid.
[('Upon receiving an ATTACH COMPLETE message', 'upon')] ----> the MME shall stop timer T3450
>> If the T3448 value IE is present in the received ATTACH ACCEPT message, the UE shall, stop timer T3448 if it is running;
[('if it is running', 'if'), ('the T3448 value IE is present in the received', 'if'), ('received message', 'if')] ----> the UE shall stop timer T3448
>> If the T3448 value IE is present in the received ATTACH ACCEPT message, the UE shall, start timer T3448 with the value provided in the T3448 value IE.
[('the T3448 value IE is present in the received', 'if'), ('received message', 'if')] ----> the UE shall start timer T3448 with the value provided in the T3448 value IE
>> If the UE has indicated "service gap control supported" in the ATTACH REQUEST message and, the ATTACH ACCEPT message contains the T3447 value IE, then the UE shall store the new T3447 value, erase any previous stored T3447 value if exists and use the new T3447 value with the T3447 timer next time it is started;
[('If the UE has indicated " service gap control supported " in the ATTACH REQUEST message and , the ATTACH ACCEPT message contains the T3447 value IE', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall store the new T3447 value
>> If the UE has indicated "service gap control supported" in the ATTACH REQUEST message and, the ATTACH ACCEPT message contains the T3447 value IE, then the UE shall store the new T3447 value, erase any previous stored T3447 value if exists and use the new T3447 value with the T3447 timer next time it is started;
[('If the UE has indicated " service gap control supported " in the ATTACH REQUEST message and , the ATTACH ACCEPT message contains the T3447 value IE', 'if'), ('if exists', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall erase any previous stored T3447 value
>> If the UE has indicated "service gap control supported" in the ATTACH REQUEST message and, the ATTACH ACCEPT message contains the T3447 value IE, then the UE shall store the new T3447 value, erase any previous stored T3447 value if exists and use the new T3447 value with the T3447 timer next time it is started;
[('If the UE has indicated " service gap control supported " in the ATTACH REQUEST message and , the ATTACH ACCEPT message contains the T3447 value IE', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall use the new T3447 value with the T3447 timer next time it is started
>> If the UE has indicated "service gap control supported" in the ATTACH REQUEST message and, the ATTACH ACCEPT message does not contain the T3447 value IE, then the UE shall erase any previous stored T3447 value if exists and stop the T3447 timer if running.
[('If the UE has indicated " service gap control supported " in the ATTACH REQUEST message and , the ATTACH ACCEPT message does not contain the T3447 value IE', 'if'), ('if running', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall stop the T3447 timer
>> If the UE has indicated "service gap control supported" in the ATTACH REQUEST message and, the ATTACH ACCEPT message does not contain the T3447 value IE, then the UE shall erase any previous stored T3447 value if exists and stop the T3447 timer if running.
[('If the UE has indicated " service gap control supported " in the ATTACH REQUEST message and , the ATTACH ACCEPT message does not contain the T3447 value IE', 'if'), ('if exists', 'if')] ----> then the UE shall erase any previous stored T3447 value
>> In WB-S1 mode, if the UE has set the RACS bit to "RACS supported" in the UE network capability IE of the ATTACH REQUEST message, the MME may include a UE radio capability ID IE or a UE radio capability ID deletion indication IE in the ATTACH ACCEPT message.
[('if the UE has set the RACS bit to " RACS supported " in the UE network capability IE of the ATTACH REQUEST message', 'if')] ----> In WB-S1 mode the MME may include a UE radio capability ID IE or a UE radio capability ID deletion indication IE in the ATTACH ACCEPT message
>> In WB-S1 mode, if the UE has set the RACS bit to "RACS supported" in the UE network capability IE of the ATTACH REQUEST message and the ATTACH ACCCEPT message includes, a UE radio capability ID IE, the UE shall store the UE radio capability ID as specified in annex C.

>> In NB-S1 mode, if the UE requested "SMS only" in the Additional update type IE and supports NB-S1 mode only, the MME decides to accept the attach request for EPS services only and, the location update for non-EPS services is not accepted by the VLR as specified in 3GPP TS 29.118 [16A];
[('the UE requested "SMS only" in the Additional update type IE', 'if'), ('the UE supports NB-S1 mode only', 'if')] ----> In NB-S1 mode the MME decides to accept the attach request for EPS services only
>> In NB-S1 mode, if the UE requested "SMS only" in the Additional update type IE and supports NB-S1 mode only, the MME decides to accept the attach request for EPS services only and, the MME decides to not accept the attach request for "SMS only",
[('the UE requested "SMS only" in the Additional update type IE', 'if'), ('the UE supports NB-S1 mode only', 'if')] ----> In NB-S1 mode the MME decides to accept the attach request for EPS services only
>> The UE shall stop timer T3410 if still running, shall reset the tracking area updating attempt counter, shall set the EPS update status to EU1 UPDATED and shall enter state EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE.
[('if still running', 'if')] ----> The UE shall stop timer T3410
>> The UE shall stop timer T3410 if still running.
[('if still running', 'if')] ----> The UE shall stop timer T3410
>> If the tracking area updating attempt counter is less than 5, the UE shall start timer T3411, shall set the EPS update status to EU1 UPDATED and shall enter state EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE.
[('If the tracking area updating attempt counter is less than 5', 'if')] ----> the UE shall start timer T3411
>> If the tracking area updating attempt counter is less than 5, the UE shall start timer T3411, shall set the EPS update status to EU1 UPDATED and shall enter state EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE.
[('If the tracking area updating attempt counter is less than 5', 'if')] ----> the UE shall set the EPS update status
>> If the tracking area updating attempt counter is less than 5, the UE shall start timer T3411, shall set the EPS update status to EU1 UPDATED and shall enter state EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE.
[('If the tracking area updating attempt counter is less than 5', 'if')] ----> the UE shall enter state EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE
>> If the tracking area updating attempt counter is equal to 5, the UE shall start timer T3402, shall set the EPS update status to EU1 UPDATED and shall enter state EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE.
[('If the tracking area updating attempt counter is equal to 5', 'if')] ----> the UE shall start timer T3402
>> If the tracking area updating attempt counter is equal to 5, the UE shall start timer T3402, shall set the EPS update status to EU1 UPDATED and shall enter state EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE.
[('If the tracking area updating attempt counter is equal to 5', 'if')] ----> the UE shall enter state EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE
>> If the tracking area updating attempt counter is equal to 5, the UE shall start timer T3402, shall set the EPS update status to EU1 UPDATED and shall enter state EMM-REGISTERED.NORMAL-SERVICE.
[('If the tracking area updating attempt counter is equal to 5', 'if')] ----> the UE shall set the EPS update status
>> When timer T3402 expires the normal tracking area updating procedure for EPS services and "SMS only" or the combined tracking area updating procedure for EPS services and "SMS only" is triggered.
[('When timer T3402 expires', 'when')] ----> the normal tracking area updating procedure for EPS services and "SMS only" or the combined tracking area updating procedure for EPS services and "SMS only" triggered
>> The UE shall stop the timer T3410 if still running.
[('if still running', 'if')] ----> The UE shall stop the timer T3410
>> If the attach request cannot be accepted by the network, the MME shall send an ATTACH REJECT message to the UE including an appropriate EMM cause value.

>> If EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection is not supported by the UE or the MME, the attach request included a PDN CONNECTIVITY REQUEST message, the attach procedure fails due to, a default EPS bearer setup failure;

>> If the attach request is rejected due to incompatibility between the CIoT EPS optimizations supported by the UE and what the network supports and the network sets the EMM cause value to #15 "no suitable cells in tracking area", the network may additionally include the Extended EMM cause IE with value "requested EPS optimization not supported".

>> Additionally, the UE shall enter the state EMM-DEREGISTERED.LIMITED-SERVICE and, if the UE is in WB-S1 mode and the Extended EMM cause IE with value "E-UTRAN not allowed" is included in the ATTACH REJECT message, the UE supports "E-UTRA Disabling for EMM cause #15", and the "E-UTRA Disabling Allowed for EMM cause #15" parameter as specified in 3GPP TS 24.368 [15A] or 3GPP TS 31.102 [17] is present and set to enabled; then the UE shall disable the E-UTRA capability as specified in subclause 4.5 and search for a suitable cell in GERAN, UTRAN or NG-RAN radio access technology;

>> Additionally, the UE shall enter the state EMM-DEREGISTERED.LIMITED-SERVICE and, if the UE is in NB-S1 mode and the Extended EMM cause IE with value "NB-IoT not allowed" is included in the ATTACH REJECT message, then the UE may disable the NB-IoT capability as specified in subclause 4.9 and search for a suitable cell in E-UTRAN radio access technology;
[('the UE is in NB-S1 mode', 'if'), ('the Extended EMM cause IE with value " NB-IoT not allowed " included in the ATTACH REJECT message', 'if')] ----> then the UE may disable the NB-IoT capability as specified in subclause 4.9
>> The UE shall stop timer T3346 if it is running.
[('if it is running', 'if')] ----> The UE shall stop timer T3346
>> If the ATTACH REJECT message is integrity protected, the UE shall start timer T3346 with the value provided in the T3346 value IE.
[('If the ATTACH REJECT message is integrity protected', 'if')] ----> the UE shall start timer T3346 with the value provided in the T3346 value IE
>> If the ATTACH REJECT message is not integrity protected, the UE shall start timer T3346 with a random value from the default range specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [13].
[('If the ATTACH REJECT message is not integrity protected', 'if')] ----> the UE shall start timer T3346 with a random value from the default range specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [ 13 ]
>> The attach procedure is started if still needed when timer T3346 expires or is stopped.
[('if still needed', 'if'), ('when timer T3346 expires', 'when')] ----> The attach procedure started
>> The attach procedure is started if still needed when timer T3346 expires or is stopped.
[('if still needed', 'if'), ('when timer T3346 stopped', 'when')] ----> The attach procedure started
>> If A/Gb mode or Iu mode is supported by the UE, the UE shall in addition handle the GMM parameters GMM state, GPRS update status and GPRS attach attempt counter as specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [13] for the case when the normal attach procedure is rejected with the GMM cause with the same value.
[('If A/Gb mode or Iu mode is supported by the UE', 'if')] ----> the UE shall in addition handle the GMM parameters GMM state , GPRS update status and GPRS attach attempt counter for the case when the normal attach procedure is rejected with the GMM cause with the same value
>> If the UE is operating in single-registration mode, the UE shall in addition handle the 5GMM parameters 5GMM state, 5GS update status and registration attempt counter as specified in 3GPP TS 24.501 [54] for the case when the initial registration procedure performed over 3GPP access is rejected with the 5GMM cause with the same value.
[('If the UE is operating in single-registration mode', 'if')] ----> the UE shall in addition handle the 5GMM parameters 5GMM state , 5GS update status and registration attempt counter as specified in 3GPP TS 24.501 [ 54 ] for the case when the initial registration procedure performed over 3GPP access is rejected with the 5GMM cause with the same value
>> EMM cause #25 is only applicable when received from a CSG cell.
[('when received from a CSG cell', 'when')] ----> EMM cause # 25 is only applicable
>> If the CSG ID and associated PLMN identity of the cell where the UE has sent the ATTACH REQUEST message are contained in the Allowed CSG list, the UE shall remove the entry corresponding to this CSG ID and associated PLMN identity from the Allowed CSG list.
[('If the CSG ID and associated PLMN identity of the cell where the UE has sent the ATTACH REQUEST message are contained in the Allowed CSG list', 'if')] ----> the UE shall remove the entry corresponding to this CSG ID and associated PLMN identity from the Allowed CSG list
>> If the CSG ID and associated PLMN identity of the cell where the UE has sent the ATTACH REQUEST message are contained in the Operator CSG list, the UE shall apply the procedures defined in 3GPP TS 23.122 [6] subclause 3.1A.
[('If the CSG ID and associated PLMN identity of the cell where the UE has sent the ATTACH REQUEST message are contained in the Operator CSG list', 'if')] ----> the UE shall apply the procedures defined in 3GPP TS 23.122 [ 6 ] subclause 3.1A
>> If the UE is operating in single-registration mode, the UE shall in addition set the 5GMM state to 5GMM-DEREGISTERED and set the 5GS update status to 5U3 ROAMING NOT ALLOWED.
[('If the UE is operating in single-registration mode', 'if')] ----> the UE shall in addition set the 5GMM state to 5GMM-DEREGISTERED
>> If the UE is operating in single-registration mode, the UE shall in addition set the 5GMM state to 5GMM-DEREGISTERED and set the 5GS update status to 5U3 ROAMING NOT ALLOWED.
[('If the UE is operating in single-registration mode', 'if')] ----> the UE shall in addition set the 5GS update status to 5U3 ROAMING NOT ALLOWED
>> If A/Gb mode or Iu mode is supported by the UE, the UE shall in addition set the GMM state to GMM-DEREGISTERED, GPRS update status to GU2 NOT UPDATED, and shall delete the P-TMSI, P-TMSI signature, RAI and GPRS ciphering key sequence number.
[('If A/Gb mode or Iu mode is supported by the UE', 'if')] ----> the UE shall delete the P-TMSI , P-TMSI signature , RAI and GPRS ciphering key sequence number
>> If A/Gb mode or Iu mode is supported by the UE, the UE shall in addition set the GMM state to GMM-DEREGISTERED, GPRS update status to GU2 NOT UPDATED, and shall delete the P-TMSI, P-TMSI signature, RAI and GPRS ciphering key sequence number.
[('If A/Gb mode or Iu mode is supported by the UE', 'if')] ----> the UE shall in addition set the GMM state to GMM-DEREGISTERED
>> If the UE is operating in single-registration mode, the UE shall in addition set the 5GMM state to 5GMM-DEREGISTERED, 5GS update status to 5U2 NOT UPDATED, and shall delete any 5G-GUTI, last visited registered TAI, TAI list and ngKSI.
[('If the UE is operating in single-registration mode', 'if')] ----> the UE in addition shall delete any 5G-GUTI , last visited registered TAI , TAI list and ngKSI
>> If the UE is operating in single-registration mode, the UE shall in addition set the 5GMM state to 5GMM-DEREGISTERED, 5GS update status to 5U2 NOT UPDATED, and shall delete any 5G-GUTI, last visited registered TAI, TAI list and ngKSI.
[('If the UE is operating in single-registration mode', 'if')] ----> the UE shall in addition set the 5GMM state to 5GMM-DEREGISTERED
>> The UE shall enable N1 mode capability for 3GPP access if it was disabled and disable the E-UTRA capability and enter state EMM-DEREGISTERED.NO-CELL-AVAILABLE.
[('if it was disabled', 'if')] ----> The UE shall enable N1 mode capability for 3GPP access
>> In WB-S1 mode, if access is barred for "originating signalling", the attach procedure shall not be started.
[('if access is barred for " originating signalling "', 'if')] ----> In WB-S1 mode the attach procedure shall not started
>> In NB-S1 mode, if access is barred for "originating signalling", the attach procedure shall not be started.
[('if access is barred for " originating signalling "', 'if')] ----> In NB-S1 mode the attach procedure shall not started
>> In NB-S1 mode, if access is barred for "originating signalling", a request for an exceptional event is received from the upper layers, then the attach procedure shall be started.
[('if access is barred for " originating signalling "', 'if')] ----> a request for an exceptional event received from the upper layers
>> If access is barred because of access class barring for "originating signalling", ACDC is applicable to the request from the upper layers and the UE supports ACDC, then the attach procedure shall be started.
[('access barred because of access class barring for " originating signalling "', 'if'), ('If ACDC is applicable to the request from the upper layers', 'if'), ('the UE supports ACDC', 'if')] ----> then the attach procedure shall started
>> If access is barred for a certain ACDC category, a request with a higher ACDC category is received from the upper layers and the UE supports ACDC, then the attach procedure shall be started.
[('If access is barred for a certain ACDC category', 'if')] ----> a request with a higher ACDC category is received from the upper layers and the UE supports ACDC then the attach procedure shall started
>> The NAS signalling connection, if any, shall be released locally.
[('if any', 'if')] ----> The NAS signalling connection shall released locally
>> Upon reception of the EMM cause #19 "ESM failure", if the UE is not configured for NAS signalling low priority and the ESM cause value received in the PDN CONNECTIVITY REJECT message is not #54 "PDN connection does not exist", the UE may set the attach attempt counter to 5.

>> If the attach request is neither for emergency bearer services nor for initiating a PDN connection for emergency bearer services with attach type not set to "EPS emergency attach", upon reception of the EMM causes #95, #96, #97, #99 and #111 the UE should set the attach attempt counter to 5.

[('If the current TAI is still in the TAI list', 'if')] ----> is up to the UE implementation how to re-run the ongoing procedure
>> If EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection is not supported by the UE or the MME, and the ACTIVATE DEFAULT BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST message combined with the ATTACH ACCEPT is not accepted by the UE due to failure in the UE ESM sublayer, then the UE shall initiate the detach procedure by sending a DETACH REQUEST message to the network.

>> If EMM-REGISTERED without PDN connection is supported by the UE and the MME, and the ACTIVATE DEFAULT BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST message combined with the ATTACH ACCEPT is not accepted by the UE due to failure in the UE ESM sublayer, then the UE shall either send an ATTACH COMPLETE message together with an ACTIVATE DEFAULT EPS BEARER CONTEXT REJECT contained in the ESM message container information element to the network or initiate the detach procedure by sending a DETACH REQUEST message.

>> If the ATTACH REQUEST message contained the low priority indicator set to "MS is configured for NAS signalling low priority", the UE shall start timer T3346 with the "Extended wait time" value and reset the attach attempt counter.

>> If the ATTACH REQUEST message did not contain the low priority indicator set to "MS is configured for NAS signalling low priority", the UE is operating in NB-S1 mode and the UE is not a UE configured to use AC11 – 15 in selected PLMN, then the UE shall start timer T3346 with the "Extended wait time" value and reset the attach attempt counter.

>> If the attach attempt counter is equal to 5, the UE shall delete any GUTI, TAI list, last visited registered TAI, list of equivalent PLMNs and KSI, shall set the update status to EU2 NOT UPDATED, and shall start timer T3402.
[('If the attach attempt counter is equal to 5', 'if')] ----> the UE shall start timer T3402
>> If the attach attempt counter is equal to 5, the UE shall delete any GUTI, TAI list, last visited registered TAI, list of equivalent PLMNs and KSI, shall set the update status to EU2 NOT UPDATED, and shall start timer T3402.

>> If the attach attempt counter is equal to 5, the UE shall delete any GUTI, TAI list, last visited registered TAI, list of equivalent PLMNs and KSI, shall set the update status to EU2 NOT UPDATED, and shall start timer T3402.
[('If the attach attempt counter is equal to 5', 'if')] ----> the UE shall delete any GUTI , TAI list , last visited registered TAI , list of equivalent PLMNs and KSI
>> If the attach attempt counter is equal to 5, if A/Gb mode, Iu mode or N1 mode is supported by the UE, if A/Gb mode or Iu mode is supported by the UE, the UE shall in addition handle the GMM parameters GMM state, GPRS update status, P-TMSI, P-TMSI signature, RAI and GPRS ciphering key sequence number as specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [13] for the abnormal case when a normal attach procedure fails and the attach attempt counter is equal to 5;
[('If the attach attempt counter is equal to 5', 'if'), ('if A/Gb mode , Iu mode or N1 mode is supported by the UE', 'if'), ('if A/Gb mode or Iu mode is supported by the UE', 'if')] ----> the UE shall in addition handle the GMM parameters GMM state , GPRS update status , P-TMSI , P-TMSI signature , RAI and GPRS ciphering key sequence number as specified in 3GPP TS 24.008 [ 13 ] for the abnormal case when a normal attach procedure fails and the attach attempt counter is equal to 5
>> If the attach attempt counter is equal to 5, if A/Gb mode, Iu mode or N1 mode is supported by the UE, if the UE is operating in single-registration mode, the UE shall in addition handle the 5GMM parameters 5GMM state, 5GS update status, 5G-GUTI, last visited registered TAI, TAI list and ngKSI as specified in 3GPP TS 24.501 [54] for the abnormal case when an initial registration procedure performed over 3GPP access fails and the registration attempt counter is equal to 5;
[('If the attach attempt counter is equal to 5', 'if'), ('if A/Gb mode , Iu mode or N1 mode is supported by the UE', 'if'), ('if the UE is operating in single-registration mode', 'if')] ----> the UE shall in addition handle the 5GMM parameters 5GMM state , 5GS update status , 5G-GUTI , last visited registered TAI , TAI list and ngKSI as specified in 3GPP TS 24.501 [ 54 ] for the abnormal case when an initial registration procedure performed over 3GPP access fails and the registration attempt counter is equal to 5
>> If the attach attempt counter is equal to 5, if A/Gb mode, Iu mode or N1 mode is supported by the UE, the UE shall attempt to select GERAN, UTRAN or NG-RAN radio access technology and proceed with appropriate GMM or 5GMM specific procedures.
[('If the attach attempt counter is equal to 5', 'if'), ('if A/Gb mode , Iu mode or N1 mode is supported by the UE', 'if')] ----> the UE shall attempt to select GERAN , UTRAN or NG-RAN radio access technology and proceed with appropriate GMM or 5GMM specific procedures
>> if the attach was successful for EPS services only and the ATTACH ACCEPT message contained a value included in the SMS services status IE not treated in subclause 5.5.1.2.4A or the SMS services status IE is not included in the message, the UE shall proceed as follows:
