>> If the UE receives a BEARER RESOURCE ALLOCATION REJECT message in which the PTI value is an unassigned or reserved value, or an assigned value that does not match any PTI in use, the UE shall ignore the message.
[('If the UE receives a BEARER RESOURCE ALLOCATION REJECT message in which the PTI value is an unassigned or reserved value , or an assigned value that does not match any PTI in use', 'if')] ----> the UE shall ignore the message
>> If the UE receives a BEARER RESOURCE MODIFICATION REJECT message in which the PTI value is an unassigned or reserved value, or an assigned value that does not match any PTI in use, the UE shall ignore the message.
[('If the UE receives a BEARER RESOURCE MODIFICATION REJECT message in which the PTI value is an unassigned or reserved value , or an assigned value that does not match any PTI in use', 'if')] ----> the UE shall ignore the message
>> If the UE receives an ESM INFORMATION REQUEST message in which the PTI value is an unassigned or reserved value, the UE shall ignore the message.
[('If the UE receives an ESM INFORMATION REQUEST message in which the PTI value is an unassigned or reserved value', 'if')] ----> the UE shall ignore the message
>> If the PTI is an assigned value that does not match a PTI in use for a pending UE requested PDN connectivity procedure for which the ESM information transfer flag was set in the PDN CONNECTIVITY REQUEST message, the UE shall respond with an ESM STATUS message including ESM cause #47 "PTI mismatch".
[('If the PTI is an assigned value that does not match a PTI in use for a pending UE requested PDN connectivity procedure for which the ESM information transfer flag was set in the PDN CONNECTIVITY REQUEST message', 'if')] ----> the UE shall respond with an ESM STATUS message including ESM cause # 47 " PTI mismatch "
>> If the UE receives a NOTIFICATION message in which the PTI value is an unassigned value, the UE shall proceed as specified in subclause 7.3.2.
[('If the UE receives a NOTIFICATION message in which the PTI value is an unassigned value', 'if')] ----> the UE shall proceed as specified in subclause 7.3.2
>> If the PTI is a reserved value, the UE shall respond with an ESM STATUS message including ESM cause #81 "invalid PTI value".
[('If the PTI is a reserved value', 'if')] ----> the UE shall respond with an ESM STATUS message including ESM cause # 81 " invalid PTI value "
>> If the PTI is an assigned value that does not match any PTI in use, the UE shall respond with an ESM STATUS message including ESM cause #47 "PTI mismatch".
[('If the PTI is an assigned value that does not match any PTI in use', 'if')] ----> the UE shall respond with an ESM STATUS message including ESM cause # 47 " PTI mismatch "
>> If the UE receives an ACTIVATE DEFAULT EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST message in which the PTI value is an assigned value that does not match any PTI in use, if the UE detects that this request is a network retransmission of an already accepted request the UE shall respond with an ACTIVATE DEFAULT EPS BEARER CONTEXT ACCEPT message.
[('If the UE receives an ACTIVATE DEFAULT EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST message in which the PTI value is an assigned value that does not match any PTI in use', 'if'), ('if the UE detects that this request is a network retransmission of an already accepted request', 'if')] ----> the UE shall respond with an ACTIVATE DEFAULT EPS BEARER CONTEXT ACCEPT message
>> If the UE receives an ACTIVATE DEFAULT EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST message which contains a reserved or unassigned PTI value, the UE shall respond with an ACTIVATE DEFAULT EPS BEARER CONTEXT REJECT message including ESM cause #81 "invalid PTI value".
[('If the UE receives an ACTIVATE DEFAULT EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST message which contains a reserved or unassigned PTI value', 'if')] ----> the UE shall respond with an ACTIVATE DEFAULT EPS BEARER CONTEXT REJECT message including ESM cause # 81 " invalid PTI value "
>> If the UE receives an ACTIVATE DEDICATED EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST message in which the PTI value is an assigned value that does not match any PTI in use, if the UE detects that this request is a network retransmission of an already accepted request the UE shall respond with an ACTIVATE DEDICATED EPS BEARER CONTEXT ACCEPT message.
[('if the UE detects that this request is a network retransmission of an already accepted request', 'if')] ----> the UE shall respond with an ACTIVATE DEDICATED EPS BEARER CONTEXT ACCEPT
>> If the UE receives an ACTIVATE DEDICATED EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST message which contains a reserved PTI value, the UE shall respond with an ACTIVATE DEDICATED EPS BEARER CONTEXT REJECT message including ESM cause #81 "invalid PTI value".
[('If the UE receives an ACTIVATE DEDICATED EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST message which contains a reserved PTI value', 'if')] ----> the UE shall respond with an ACTIVATE DEDICATED EPS BEARER CONTEXT REJECT message including ESM cause # 81 " invalid PTI value "
>> If the UE receives a MODIFY EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST message in which the PTI value is an assigned value that does not match any PTI in use, if the UE detects that this request is a network retransmission of an already accepted request the UE shall respond with a MODIFY EPS BEARER CONTEXT ACCEPT message.
[('If the UE receives a MODIFY EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST message in which the PTI value is an assigned value that does not match any PTI in use', 'if'), ('if the UE detects that this request is a network retransmission of', 'if')] ----> an already accepted request the UE shall respond with a MODIFY EPS BEARER CONTEXT ACCEPT message
>> If the UE receives a MODIFY EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST message which contains a reserved PTI value, the UE shall respond with a MODIFY EPS BEARER CONTEXT REJECT message including ESM cause #81 "invalid PTI value".
[('If the UE receives a MODIFY EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST message which contains a reserved PTI value', 'if')] ----> the UE shall respond with a MODIFY EPS BEARER CONTEXT REJECT message including ESM cause # 81 " invalid PTI value "
>> If the UE receives a DEACTIVATE EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST message in which the PTI value is a reserved value or an assigned value that does not match any PTI in use, the UE shall ignore the message.
[('If the UE receives a DEACTIVATE EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST message in which the PTI value is a reserved value or an assigned value that does not match any PTI in use', 'if')] ----> the UE shall ignore the message
>> If the UE receives an ESM message other than those listed in items a through m with a reserved PTI value or an assigned value that does not match any PTI in use, the UE shall ignore the message.
[('If the UE receives an ESM message other than those listed in items a through m with a reserved PTI value or an assigned value that does not match any PTI in use', 'if')] ----> the UE shall ignore the message
>> If the network receives a PDN CONNECTIVITY REQUEST message which includes an assigned or reserved EPS bearer identity value, the network shall respond with a PDN CONNECTIVITY REJECT message including ESM cause #43 "invalid EPS bearer identity".
[('If the network receives a PDN CONNECTIVITY REQUEST message which includes an assigned or reserved EPS bearer identity value', 'if')] ----> the network shall respond with a PDN CONNECTIVITY REJECT message including ESM cause # 43 " invalid EPS bearer identity "

[('If the network receives an ESM INFORMATION RESPONSE message which includes an assigned or reserved EPS bearer identity value', 'if')] ----> the network shall ignore the message
>> If the network receives an ESM DATA TRANSPORT message which includes a reserved EPS bearer identity value or an assigned value that does not match an existing EPS bearer context, the network shall respond with an ESM STATUS message including ESM cause #43 "invalid EPS bearer identity".

>> If the UE receives a DEACTIVATE EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST message which includes an unassigned or reserved EPS bearer identity value or an assigned EPS bearer identity value that does not match an existing EPS bearer context, the UE shall respond with a DEACTIVATE EPS BEARER CONTEXT ACCEPT message with the EPS bearer identity set to the received EPS bearer identity.
[('If the UE receives a DEACTIVATE EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST message which includes an unassigned or reserved EPS bearer identity value or an assigned EPS bearer identity value that does not match an existing EPS bearer context', 'if')] ----> the UE shall respond with a DEACTIVATE EPS BEARER CONTEXT ACCEPT message with the EPS bearer identity set to the received EPS bearer identity
>> If the UE receives an ESM DATA TRANSPORT message which includes a reserved EPS bearer identity value or an assigned value that does not match an existing EPS bearer context, the UE shall respond with an ESM STATUS message including ESM cause #43 "invalid EPS bearer identity".

>> If the UE receives an ESM message other than those listed in items a through j in which the message includes an unassigned or reserved EPS bearer identity value or a value that does not match an EPS bearer context of an established PDN connection, the UE shall ignore the message.

>> If UE receives an EMM message or ESM message with message type not defined for the protocol discriminator or not implemented by the receiver, it shall return a status message with cause #97 "message type non-existent or not implemented".
[('If UE receives an EMM message or ESM message with message type not defined for the protocol discriminator or not implemented by the receiver', 'if')] ----> it shall return a status message with cause #97 " message type non-existent or not implemented "
>> If the network receives an EMM or ESM message with message type not defined for the PD or not implemented by the receiver in a protocol state where reception of an unsolicited message with the given PD from the UE is not foreseen in the protocol, the network actions are implementation dependent.
[('If the network receives an EMM or ESM message with message type not defined for the PD or not implemented by the receiver in a protocol state where receiving of an unsolicited message with the given PD from the UE is not foreseen in the protocol', 'if')] ----> the network actions are implementation dependent
>> Otherwise, if the network receives a message with message type not defined for the PD or not implemented by the receiver, it shall ignore the message except that it should return a status message with cause #97 "message type non-existent or not implemented".
[('if the network receives a message with message type not defined for the PD or not implemented by the receiver', 'if')] ----> Otherwise it shall ignore the message except that it should return a status message with cause #97 " message type non-existent or not implemented "
>> If the UE receives a message not compatible with the protocol state, the UE shall return a status message with cause #98 "message type not compatible with protocol state".
[('If the UE receives a message not compatible with the protocol state', 'if')] ----> the UE shall return a status message with cause # 98 " message type not compatible with protocol state "
>> If the network receives a message not compatible with the protocol state, the network actions are implementation dependent.
[('If the network receives a message not compatible with the protocol state', 'if')] ----> the network actions are implementation dependent
>> When an “imperative message part” error or a “missing mandatory IE” error is diagnosed on receipt of a message, or when a message containing a syntactically incorrect mandatory IE, an IE unknown in the message but encoded as “comprehension required”, or an out of sequence IE encoded as "comprehension required", the UE and the network shall proceed as follows:
[('an out of sequence IE encoded as " comprehension required', 'when')] ----> the UE and the network shall proceed as follows
>> When an “imperative message part” error or a “missing mandatory IE” error is diagnosed on receipt of a message, or when a message containing a syntactically incorrect mandatory IE, an IE unknown in the message but encoded as “comprehension required”, or an out of sequence IE encoded as "comprehension required", the UE and the network shall proceed as follows:

>> When an “imperative message part” error or a “missing mandatory IE” error is diagnosed on receipt of a message, or when a message containing a syntactically incorrect mandatory IE, an IE unknown in the message but encoded as “comprehension required”, or an out of sequence IE encoded as "comprehension required", the UE and the network shall proceed as follows:
[('a message containing a syntactically incorrect mandatory IE', 'when')] ----> the UE and the network shall proceed as follows
>> If the message is not one of the messages listed in subclause 7.5.3, item a, b, c, or d, the UE shall return a status message with cause #96 "invalid mandatory information";
[('If the message is not one of the messages listed in subclause 7.5.3 , item a , b , c , or d', 'if')] ----> the UE shall return a status message with cause #96 " invalid mandatory information "
>> If the message is not one of the messages listed in subclause 7.5.3, item e, f, g or h, the network shall either, try to treat the message;
[('If the message is not one of the messages listed in subclause 7.5.3 , item e , f , g or h ,', 'if')] ----> the network shall either try to treat the message
>> If the message is not one of the messages listed in subclause 7.5.3, item e, f, g or h, the network shall either, ignore the message except that it should return a status message with cause #96 "invalid mandatory information".
[('If the message is not one of the messages listed in subclause 7.5.3 , item e , f , g or h', 'if')] ----> the network shall either ignore the message except that it should return a status message with cause #96 " invalid mandatory information "
>> If the message is an ACTIVATE DEFAULT EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST, an ACTIVATE DEFAULT EPS BEARER CONTEXT REJECT message with ESM cause #96 "invalid mandatory information", shall be returned.
[('If the message is an ACTIVATE DEFAULT EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST', 'if')] ----> an ACTIVATE DEFAULT EPS BEARER CONTEXT REJECT message with ESM cause #96 " invalid mandatory information " shall returned

[('If the message is an ACTIVATE DEDICATED EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST', 'if')] ----> an ACTIVATE DEDICATED EPS BEARER CONTEXT REJECT message with ESM cause #96 " invalid mandatory information " shall returned

[('If the message is a MODIFY EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST', 'if')] ----> a MODIFY EPS BEARER CONTEXT REJECT message with ESM cause #96 " invalid mandatory information " shall returned
>> If the message is a DEACTIVATE EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST, a DEACTIVATE EPS BEARER CONTEXT ACCEPT message shall be returned.
[('If the message is a DEACTIVATE EPS BEARER CONTEXT REQUEST', 'if')] ----> a DEACTIVATE EPS BEARER CONTEXT ACCEPT message shall returned
>> If the message is a PDN CONNECTIVITY REQUEST, a PDN CONNECTIVITY REJECT message with ESM cause #96 "invalid mandatory information", shall be returned.
[('If the message is a PDN CONNECTIVITY REQUEST', 'if')] ----> a PDN CONNECTIVITY REJECT message with ESM cause #96 " invalid mandatory information " shall returned
>> If the message is a PDN DISCONNECT REQUEST, a PDN DISCONNECT REJECT message with ESM cause #96 "invalid mandatory information", shall be returned.
[('If the message is a PDN DISCONNECT REQUEST', 'if')] ----> a PDN DISCONNECT REJECT message with ESM cause #96 " invalid mandatory information " shall returned
>> If the message is a BEARER RESOURCE ALLOCATION REQUEST, a BEARER RESOURCE ALLOCATION REJECT message with ESM cause #96 "invalid mandatory information", shall be returned.

>> If an information element with format T, TV, TLV, or TLV-E is repeated in a message in which repetition of the information element is not specified in clause 8 of the present document, the UE shall handle only the contents of the information element appearing first and shall ignore all subsequent repetitions of the information element.
[('If an information element with format T , TV , TLV , or TLV-E is repeated in a message in which repetition of the information element is not specified in clause 8 of the present document', 'if')] ----> the UE shall ignore all subsequent repetitions of the information element
>> If an information element with format T, TV, TLV, or TLV-E is repeated in a message in which repetition of the information element is not specified in clause 8 of the present document, the UE shall handle only the contents of the information element appearing first and shall ignore all subsequent repetitions of the information element.

>> When repetition of information elements is specified, the UE shall handle only the contents of specified repeated information elements.
[('When repetition of information elements is specified', 'when')] ----> the UE shall handle only the contents of specified repeated information elements
>> If the limit on repetition of information elements is exceeded, the UE shall handle the contents of information elements appearing first up to the limit of repetitions and shall ignore all subsequent repetitions of the information element.
[('If the limit on repetition of information elements is exceeded', 'if')] ----> the UE shall handle the contents of information elements appearing first up to the limit of repetitions
>> If the limit on repetition of information elements is exceeded, the UE shall handle the contents of information elements appearing first up to the limit of repetitions and shall ignore all subsequent repetitions of the information element.
[('If the limit on repetition of information elements is exceeded', 'if')] ----> the UE shall ignore all subsequent repetitions of the information element

>> When a message with semantically incorrect contents is received, the UE shall perform the foreseen reactions of the procedural part of the present document.

>> This IE shall be included when IMSI attach for non-EPS services is not successful during a combined EPS/IMSI attach procedure.
[('when IMSI attach for non - EPS services is not successful during a combined EPS/IMSI attach procedure', 'when')] ----> This IE shall included
>> If this IE is not included, the UE shall use the default value.
[('If this IE is not included', 'if')] ----> the UE shall use the default value
>> If this IE is sent, the contents of this IE indicates a list of emergency numbers valid within the same country as in the PLMN from which this IE is received.

[('when the CS fallback or 1x CS fallback request cannot be served temporarily due to O&M reasons or a mobile terminating CS fallback call is aborted by the network during call establishment', 'when')] ----> This EMM cause sent to the UE
>> This EMM cause is sent to the UE when the network has determined that the requested procedure cannot be completed successfully due to network failure.
[('when the network has determined that the requested procedure cannot be completed successfully due to network failure', 'when')] ----> This EMM cause sent to the UE
>> This ESM cause is used by the network when the UE requests a service which is not supported by the PLMN.
[('when the UE requests a service which is not supported by the PLMN', 'when')] ----> This ESM cause used by the network
>> This ESM cause is sent when the UE requests a service option for which it has no subscription.
[('when the UE requests a service option for which it has no subscription', 'when')] ----> This ESM cause sent
>> This ESM cause is sent when the network cannot service the request because of temporary outage of one or more functions required for supporting the service.
[('when the network cannot service the request because of temporary outage of one or more functions required for supporting the service', 'when')] ----> This ESM cause sent
>> This ESM cause is used by the network if the new EPS QoS cannot be accepted that was indicated in the UE request.
[('the new EPS QoS cannot accepted', 'if'), ('that indicated in the UE request', 'if')] ----> This ESM cause used by the network
>> This ESM cause is used by the network if the QCI indicated in the UE request cannot be supported.
[('if the QCI indicated in the UE request cannot be supported', 'if')] ----> This ESM cause used by the network
>> The following EMM parameters shall be stored on the USIM if the corresponding file is present:
[('if the corresponding file is present', 'if')] ----> The following EMM parameters shall stored on the USIM
>> If the corresponding file is not present on the USIM, these EMM parameters except allowed CSG list are stored in a non-volatile memory in the ME together with the IMSI from the USIM.
[('If the corresponding file is not present on the USIM', 'if')] ----> these EMM parameters except allowed CSG list stored in a non-volatile memory in the ME together with the IMSI from the USIM
>> The allowed CSG list is stored in a non-volatile memory in the ME if the UE supports CSG selection.
[('if the UE supports CSG selection', 'if')] ----> The allowed CSG list stored in a non-volatile memory in the ME
>> These EMM parameters can only be used if the IMSI from the USIM matches the IMSI stored in the non-volatile memory; else the UE shall delete the EMM parameters.
[('if the IMSI from the USIM matches the IMSI stored in the non-volatile memory', 'if')] ----> These EMM parameters can only used
>> The TIN parameter can only be used if the IMSI from the USIM matches the IMSI stored in the non-volatile memory of the ME; else the UE shall delete the TIN parameter.
[('if the IMSI from the USIM matches the IMSI stored in the non-volatile memory of the ME', 'if')] ----> The TIN parameter can only used
>> When the maximum length is reached any new entry shall replace the oldest entry in the list.
[('When the maximum length is reached', 'when')] ----> any new entry shall replace the oldest entry in the list
>> There shall be no duplicated PLMN identities in the list and any existing DCN-ID shall be deleted when a new DCN-ID is added for the same PLMN.
[('when a new DCN-ID is added for the same PLMN', 'when')] ----> any existing DCN-ID shall deleted
>> The DCN-ID list can only be used if the IMSI from the USIM matches the IMSI stored in the non-volatile memory of the ME; else the UE shall delete the DCN-ID list.
[('if the IMSI from the USIM matches the IMSI stored in the non-volatile memory of the ME', 'if')] ----> The DCN-ID list can only used
>> The UE shall delete the stored DCN-ID list if the default standardized DCN-ID in the UE is changed.
[('if the default standardized DCN-ID in the UE is changed', 'if')] ----> The UE shall delete the stored DCN-ID list
>> A network-assigned UE radio capability ID can only be used if the IMSI from the USIM matches the IMSI stored in the non-volatile memory of the ME, else the UE shall delete the network-assigned UE radio capability ID.
[('if the IMSI from the USIM matches the IMSI stored in the non-volatile memory of the ME', 'if')] ----> A network-assigned UE radio capability ID can only used
>> There shall be only one network-assigned UE radio capability ID stored for a given combination of PLMN identity and UE radio configuration and any existing UE radio capability ID shall be deleted when a new UE radio capability ID is added for the same combination of PLMN identity and UE radio configuration.
[('when a new UE radio capability ID is added for the same combination of PLMN identity and UE radio configuration', 'when')] ----> any existing UE radio capability ID shall deleted
>> If the UE receives a network-assigned UE radio capability ID with a Version ID value different from the value included in the network-assigned UE radio capability ID stored at the UE for the serving PLMN, the UE may delete these stored network-assigned UE radio capability ID.
[('If the UE receives a network-assigned UE radio capability ID with a Version ID value different from the value included in the network-assigned UE radio capability ID stored at the UE for the serving PLMN', 'if')] ----> the UE may delete these stored network-assigned UE radio capability ID
>> If the UE is attached for emergency bearer services, the UE shall not store the EMM parameters described in this annex on the USIM or in non-volatile memory.
[('If the UE is attached for emergency bearer services', 'if')] ----> the UE shall not store the EMM parameters described in this annex on the USIM or in non-volatile memory
>> Instead the UE shall temporarily store these parameters locally in the ME and the UE shall delete these parameters when the UE is detached.
[('the UE is detached', 'when'), ('when the UE detached', 'when')] ----> the UE shall delete these parameters
>> If the UE is configured for eCall only mode as specified in 3GPP TS 31.102 [17], the UE shall not store the EMM parameters described in this annex on the USIM or in non-volatile memory.
[('If the UE is configured for eCall only mode as specified in 3GPP TS 31.102 [ 17 ]', 'if')] ----> the UE shall not store the EMM parameters described in this annex on the USIM or in non-volatile memory
>> Instead the UE shall temporarily store these parameters locally in the ME and the UE shall delete these parameters when the UE enters EMM-DEREGISTERED.eCALL-INACTIVE state, the UE is switched-off or the USIM is removed.
[('when the UE enters EMM-DEREGISTERED.eCALL-INACTIVE state', 'when')] ----> the UE shall delete these parameters
>> Instead the UE shall temporarily store these parameters locally in the ME and the UE shall delete these parameters when the UE enters EMM-DEREGISTERED.eCALL-INACTIVE state, the UE is switched-off or the USIM is removed.
[('the USIM removed', 'when')] ----> the UE shall delete these parameters
>> If the UE is attached for access to RLOS, the UE shall not store the EMM parameters described in this annex on the USIM or in non-volatile memory.
[('If the UE is attached for access to RLOS', 'if')] ----> the UE shall not store the EMM parameters described in this annex on the USIM or in non-volatile memory
>> When EMM requests the establishment of a NAS-signalling connection, or when EMM requests the lower layers to resume a NAS signalling connection, the RRC establishment cause used by the UE shall be selected according to the NAS procedure as specified in table D.1.1.
[('when EMM requests the lower layers to resume a NAS signalling connection', 'when')] ----> the RRC establishment cause used by the UE shall selected according to the NAS procedure as specified in table D.1.1
>> When EMM requests the establishment of a NAS-signalling connection, or when EMM requests the lower layers to resume a NAS signalling connection, the RRC establishment cause used by the UE shall be selected according to the NAS procedure as specified in table D.1.1.
[('When EMM requests the establishment of a NAS-signalling connection', 'when')] ----> the RRC establishment cause used by the UE shall selected according to the NAS procedure as specified in table D.1.1
>> If the UE is configured for EAB, the EMM shall indicate to the lower layer for the purpose of access control that EAB applies for this request except for the following cases:
[('If the UE is configured for EAB', 'if')] ----> the EMM shall indicate to the lower layer for the purpose of access control that EAB applies for this request except for the following cases
>> If a capability is related to a feature that can be used in a network supporting A/Gb mode only or Iu mode only or both, the capability will be signalled in the MS network capability IE.
[('If a capability is related to a feature that can be used in a network supporting A/Gb mode only or Iu mode only or both', 'if')] ----> the capability will signalled in the MS network capability IE
>> If a capability is related to a feature that can be used in network supporting S1 mode only, the capability will be signalled in the UE network capability IE.
[('If a capability is related to a feature that can be used in network supporting S1 mode only', 'if')] ----> the capability will signalled in the UE network capability IE
>> If a capability is related to a feature that can be used only in a network supporting both S1 mode and at least one of the two modes A/Gb mode and Iu mode, the capability is added only to one of the two information elements:
[('If a capability is related to a feature that can be used only in a network supporting both S1 mode and at least one of the two modes A/Gb mode and Iu mode', 'if')] ----> the capability added only to one of the two information elements
>> If the information is used by the MME only, the capability will be signalled in the UE network capability IE.
[('If the information is used by the MME only', 'if')] ----> the capability will signalled in the UE network capability IE
>> If the information is used by the SGSN only or both by the SGSN and by the MME, the capability will be signalled in the MS network capability IE.
[('If the information is used by the SGSN only or both by the SGSN and by the MME', 'if')] ----> the capability will signalled in the MS network capability IE
>> If the UE supports ACDC, the EMM layer shall determine the ACDC category applicable to the request based on the application identifier received from the upper layers and the configuration information in the "ACDCConf" leaf of ACDC MO as specified in 3GPP TS 24.105 [35] or in the USIM EFACDC as specified in 3GPP TS 31.102 [17].
[('If the UE supports ACDC', 'if')] ----> the EMM layer shall determine the ACDC category applicable to the request based on the application identifier received from the upper layers and the configuration information in the " ACDCConf " leaf of ACDC MO as specified in 3GPP TS 24.105 [ 35 ] or in the USIM EFACDC as specified in 3GPP TS 31.102 [ 17 ]
>> The EMM sublayer shall indicate to the lower layers, for the purpose of access control, this request is for an uncategorized application if an application identifier received from the upper layers is not mapped to any ACDC category,
[('if an application identifier received from the upper layers is not mapped to any ACDC category', 'if')] ----> this request is for an uncategorized application
>> If the UE supports ACDC and access is barred because of ACDC, the EMM layer shall keep track of the ACDC category for which access is barred and it shall not send a request for the same ACDC category or a lower ACDC category until access is granted.
[('the UE supports ACDC', 'if'), ('access barred because of ACDC', 'if')] ----> the EMM layer shall keep track of the ACDC category for which access is barred
>> If the UE supports ACDC and access is barred because of ACDC, the EMM layer shall not send a request for any uncategorized application until access is granted.
[('the UE supports ACDC', 'if'), ('access barred because of ACDC', 'if')] ----> the EMM layer shall not send a request for any uncategorized application until access is granted
